Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mreyre
Reviews.Content: Stayed during coldest February in living memory! Hotel warm and friendly and staff very helpful. Professional without being too remote. Great room and really convenient for all the sights. Would definitely stay again. Fond memories

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiandCheese
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and wish that we would had been able to stay longer. The location is great because it's not on a main drag, so to speak, but it's easy to walk to the different sights. The staff was friendly and quite helpful; they were also great with our 11 month old daughter and were ready to help us out with anything we needed for her. Upon arrival the gentleman at the front desk gave us a map and suggested several restaurants. The room was great and a decent size. Our view was of the lobby of the building next to us but we didn't spend much time in our room or looking out the window so it didn't matter much to us. The bathroom was clean and in good condition. The breakfast was very simple but it had the basics so we were ok with that, plus we were able to dine in our room at no extra charge which made life easier for us since we were trying to get ready to see the sights while minding our baby. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: heynoni
Reviews.Content: An easy walk to everything you want to see, this is a great place to base yourself. The staff are friendly, warm and knowledgeable. We stayed in the apartment which is wonderful, spacious, private and really comfortable. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cadgel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and could not fault it. Rooms clean and a good size (we had a canal view). Bed comfortable. Breakfast plentiful, croissants, rolls and nice strong coffee. Location is excellent for exploring. Would definitely book again if ever coming back to Venice. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: jeweljem
Reviews.Content: My daughter, son and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We had a big beautiful room with a big updated bathroom. This hotel was within easy walking distance to everything. The breakfast was basic but the capuccinos were wonderful. And the very nice woman who served them enjoyed teasing my son. She didn't speak english but we were able to somehow communicate easily. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Real Venice, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: Soon after you book, the L'Aconda communicates with information onnhow to reach the hotel. The directions from the train station were spot on including tips on how to get the Vaporetto and where to get off. Do research but buy Vaporetto tickets in advance. Walking to anywhere in Venice was easy from the hotel. Suggestions for local dining were spot on and helped us avoid the over priced tourist spots. We had two rooms. Ours had a view of the square and the canal, from which we could see Venice working as boats plied the canal delivering and picking up goods, rubbish, furniture etc etc, ie we saw how the city works. There were two layers of windows plus the outside shutters plus curtains. We were there in January when it was quite cold outside but v.warm inside. The girls room had a view across a narrow passageway into the building next door! We have seen rooms like this many times though, so concentrate on what you get inside the room and the hotel as in Europe at this price point you do well to get a view. The bathrooms were well appointed, the beds comfortable. Buffet Breakfast was sufficient and great table service if you wanted a coffee. The hotel entrance is up a steep flight of stairs, (help was offered to get bags down) and entry is by ringing a bell, so security feels good. A manager or night manager is on duty at all times. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Laurence B
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay in Venice, clean, easy to find, in a typical place in Venice. Nothing bad happened to us, good bed, quiet night, good service, varied breakfast and nice music during it; Vivaldi!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet corner of Venice”
Reviews.Author: tiggilulu
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. For people seeking a quiet corner of the Island, far away from the day trippers and souvenir vendors, this is a great place. We booked a junior suite that we were told was not 'canal view', but we had a great view anyway. The host helped us find a great local place for dinner. Room was clean and continental breakfast was simple (we're not 'breakfast' people, so we were very happy). Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay ! Definatelly recomend it !”
Reviews.Author: erikaabs
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice in January and had a really nice stay at Locanda. At first, it was a bit confusing to get there, because we arrived late at night at there was no people around to ask for information. Once in Venice, you will understand how easy it is to get lost everywhere, which is just fun and part of it. The hotel staff is super friendly, helpfull and english speaking ! The room mas spacious, quiet, clean and confortable. The bathroom was very nice too. Breakfast was really good with fresh bread, juice, yougurt and delicious made to order coffee. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk to Piazza San Marco, which was a nice way to explore other areas and get away form the tourist crowds. Will be back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tomas L
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay, very central and quite. All staff was very helpfull. We want to suggest this place for who wants to visit Venice. We will came back with the next year.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmclundy
Reviews.Content: This was my first city on my first visit to Italy. I booked the apartment with canal view for my mother and Me. The hotel is convenient because San Polo is central to every neighborhood in Venice. We easily walked everywhere we wanted to go from there and really enjoyed being in a residential area away from tourists. The only thing I had a hard time with was finding it when arriving from the airport. We were told to get off at the Rialto stop (we were arriving on Alilaguna) but it seems that the walk from the San Toma stop would have been far simpler. A map with directions on how to walk there would be an extremely helpful tool for the hotel to provide before arrival, either via email or on their website. The apartment itself was around the corner from the hotel down a narrow passageway. It was spacious, modern, clean and comfortable with 2 bedrooms and bathrooms, a kitchen and living room. The canal view is very limited but really unimportant to the stay. We had breakfast one morning consisting of croissants, bread, cereals, yogurts, juices and coffee selections. Very simple but adequate for starting your day. All in all, a great stay in a great, quiet neighborhood at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: Gustavb
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for two days. Man at the reception was very helpfull, friendly and made our stay a lot better. Room was a bit small, but that's venice. location was nice, easy to find and within a walk distance from the city parking - if you like walking a lot :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobmac222
Reviews.Content: Situated in San Polo this is the ideal place to explore the beautiful Islands of Venice. This was our third visit to this amazing and wonderful Italian jewel and the hotel Locanda Sant'Agostin made it all the more enjoyable. The rooms are small but well equipped and for us the location was absolutely perfect allowing us to explore from a very central location. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kahbne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in as a family early Jan 2012 and found the Locanda Sant'Agostin to be well located and importantly very clean and comfortable. We were within an easy and enjoyable walk of the Rialto Bridge etc however also able to enjoy local restaurants and shopping tucked away from the main touristy areas and frequented by locals. Fantastic and would definately stay here again - perhaps in the appartment for the family as our friends did rather than in the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quiet hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: flyingsteed
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for the Biennale and spent 3 nights at this hotel in November 2011 and we were impressed with the location and the room. It was so quiet we really got a good nights sleep - in fact with the shutters closed we couldn't tell if it was night or day! When we arrived mid afternoon we were greeted by an older gentleman who was very charming and recommended some local bars and restaurants where we could get a bite to eat. We thought the hotel was good value and would definitely go back. If we have a small complaint it is that the breakfast was a little unimaginative and the coffee wasn't very hot. Hot chocolate was better.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Unintrusive”
Reviews.Author: Acousticharmonics
Reviews.Content: Great service and located deep inside beautiful Venice. Fully recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: LauraJane11
Reviews.Content: Venice - a difficult place to find good value accommodation. Locanda Sant'Agostin - a great hotel in the centre of the action. it's only a small hotel - all the rooms on the one floor. All the staff incredibly friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful - not far from all the main attractions yet felt a bit removed from the tourist overloaded centre. Rooms great - couldn't believe it for the value. Even a bath in the bathrooms! Lovely breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Venice to celebrate my 60th birthday.Having been advised by friends to avoid accommodation in the main tourist areas, which can be overly expensive, we decided on this small hotel mainly for its central location. It was about a 10 to 15-minute walk to the Grand Canal in any direction. Our room and adjoining bathroom were very pleasant, clean, plenty big enough for we two and had triple glazing and air-conditioning. The entrance is up a flight of stairs so I am not sure if disabled people can be catered for? A perfectly adequate continental breakfast is served in the hotel reception area, off which its small number of rooms radiate. The very busy lady who serves the guests could appear brusque if you chose to take her the wrong way, but with a little attempt at poor Italian and many smiles on your part she soon reveals her warmth and sense of humour. This is not a hotel with any other facilities, ie a pool or spa, but on a short break to Venice, who wants to sit in the hotel? The gentleman on reception when we arrived gave us almost too much information about the map of Venice and places to visit but it all proved invaluable as the days unfolded. As with many hotels, the staff have their 'preferred' places to advise you to try but you don't have to take their advice and we found the restaurant just below the hotel to be a good place to eat authentic Italian food. We also liked Nono's Ristora very much and found some good places en route to other places. A good rule of thumb seems to be to avoid any restaurant where the staff wait outside to entice you in. I had the worst 8 euro bowl of vegetable 'soup' in one such place near the Academia bridge. The area in which this hotel is situated has one or two local bars which are most welcoming if you take the trouble to go in. Were we to return to Venice, we would go back to the Locanda Sant Agostin in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: anggingyin
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant Agostin is a lovely hotel in Venice and about 10 minutes walk from the nearest Al Vaporetto station (San Stae). We were greeted by the friendly and helpful reception gentleman who gave us some tips about navigating the maze in Venice. In addition, the room was lovely and I absolutely liked the spacious bathroom. If only the hair dryer had worked better but it was no big deal as we only stayed for 1 night. The breakfast was basic but good enough to start the day. We were also pleased with the hospitality and service provided by the Italian breakfast lady. If you stay there, you MUST try the Pizzeria Due Colonne located just next to Loconda Sant Agostin. This restaurant is just a gem and popular amongst the locals. The food is delicious and good value for money. We ordered the tourist menu and it is euro 15 for 2 main courses (spagetti, calamari) and a mixed salad, euro 12 for 2 main courses (tortellini, pork cutlet with fries). Absolutely a find and the highlight of our Venice trip. Go before 8pm if not it will be packed by then. Overall, good service, nice room, away from the touristy crowds in Venice but still accessible and a great restaurant at your doorstep. I will strongly recommend Locanda Sant Agostin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: rishabh_bajaj
Reviews.Content: Excellent Apartment..But a little away from the hotel reception so no wifi signal in the room.. Convenient location..Breakfast just ok..expected it to be better..

Reviews.Title: “Home in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTonto
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights stating November 16, 2011 when our cruise ended in Venice. During our stay everyone at the Sant'Agostin was polite, pleasant and eager to please. The hotel is located mid-way between the Piazzale Roma and the Rialto Bridge, near the Piazza San Paolo, and is an excellent central location that's a little removed from the tourist-intensive areas. We booked the hotel through Venere.com which gave an excellent rate but meant we had to pay in cash at the end of our stay. Venice is a walker's delight! If you're used to a GPS - throw it away. Street signs are intermittent and maps avoid listing the names anyway. Your best landmarks are churches and piazzas (city squares). There are plenty of street signs for the four major destinations - Piazzale Roma, Rialto Bridge, Railway Station and Piazza San Marco - just find out which of them is near your destination and follow the crowd! Locanda Sant'Agostin is a nice, reasonably priced location to get lost - and found - in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Hotel in The Center of The Action”
Reviews.Author: chauddog
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel and would probably return to this spot if returning to Venice. It is centrally located and a great bargain considering the overall prices in the area. The area is also not quite as jammed with tourists as other parts of the city. Room was VERY clean and comfortable although we were a little disappointed that we did not get quite the canal view we anticipated. (You could see the canal but you had to make an effort to see it.) Also, we were unsure if the balcony was actually safe to go out on...so we didn't. We were really amazed as to how well the balcony doors blocked out noise...we could hear very little when they were closed. Shower was a bit small but bathroom was meticulously clean. The service was generally good although I think we would have better service if we could speak Italian. (We only speak French and English.) At times we felt like we were disturbing some of the staff with our questions Directions posted on WEB site were confusing and not entirely accurate (at least at the time we had printed them out.) Luckily, we found somebody on the street to help as we were wandering aimlessly in the streets with our bags. Also, depending on your arrival time, you may be required to leave your passports overnight which caused us a great deal of confusion upon arrival since the desk attendant that evening only spoke Italian. Breakfast was very good and the woman serving was as another reviewer put it "charmingly surly"...so don't be late for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A review based on facts not opinion”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: Central location but difficult to find even with a map. Stayed in two different rooms; first one looked out to another window, and the other room faced a brick wall across a narrow alley. Price was Euro 169/night, payment in advance, non-refundable.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Venetian ambiance with cozy comfort”
Reviews.Author: SandandSea22
Reviews.Content: After thorough internet assisted research, I chose this hotel for it's central yet quiet location. It met or exceeded all expectations, providing a clean and comfortable respite at the end of our busy day of exploring the wonders of Venice. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Upon waking in the morning I opened the windows to the sights and sounds of daily Venetian life in the quiet neighborhood. The hotel and setting were charming and quaint, clean, comfortable, and relaxing. It made my visit to Venice even more magical and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with a great vibe and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Barimichelle
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous experience with this hotel! Booked it based on other reviews on TA and was not disappointed. Our room was beautiful, spacious and clean. The bathroom was large as well and everything was new. We had a balcony off of the room overlooking a small canal and bridge which really added to the experience. The windows were doubled paned and we could barely hear anything when they were closed. The location is great, you are a 10-15 minute walk from St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge area and very close to the Grand Canal but far enough away that it is quiet. The staff were friendly and had great recommendations for restaurants. Breakfast was included with the stay and on the morning that we checked out we were leaving at 7am, before breakfast was being served, and the staff did not let us leave without making fresh espressos and giving us warm croissants. Free wi fi was easily accessible as well. Like other reviewers have noted, its easy to get lost in Venice and finding this place the first time was a little tricky but you get the hang of it quickly enough. I rarely review places I've stayed but the experience here was fabulous and I would book with them again if I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel close to station”
Reviews.Author: lpip64
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews in TA & was a bit disappointed. Room & shower room both large but dark wood throughout the hotel created a bit of a dark/tired atmosphere. Light fitting & under the bed very dusty but everywhere else clean. Could only get wifi in our bathroom or reception area. Reception looks onto breakfast area which was only a few strides from our room. Breakfast basic and limited choice. Pleasant & helpful reception staff. A nice touch giving us a bottle of prosecco when we arrived (our anniversary).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Willie2000
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in this nice friendly litte hotel. Its easy to find using the map provided but you will get lost in venice anyway. Take a few moments to orient yourself correctly on leaving the hotel. The room was big and perfect for the three of us. The bathroom was also just fine and large enough. We slept well with no outside sounds to disturb us. All the men on the reception (it seems to be only men) were always ready to help as it's not a big hotel with maybe max. 12 rooms so they are not overly busy. A special thanks to Eugenia (the Moldavian born engineer) who made our breakfast so enjoyable every morning. She is very interesting and very friendly. But beware you'll need to have your Italian ready as she speaks Italian to everybody whether they understand it or not. But hospitality and friendlyness is a universally understood. Know what the difference between Cappuccino, Cioccolata Calda and CafÃ© (Espresso) is and have your reply ready and already youre off to a good start.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service”
Reviews.Author: CanEHdiAH
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights before our Cruise and it was a great choice. Even easy to find from the train station. We really enjoyed the free wi-fi to stay connected with friends and family. Beautiful decor, high ceilings and rich fabrics make you feel like royalty. Breakfast was great, good coffee!! Staff always so pleasant, and the warm welcome and good bye will be remembered forever. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Simple, and a great Value”
Reviews.Author: Wh0ami18
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel, and it was everything that we expected. Service was great, and the staffs were helpful at making last minute dinner reservation for us. The breakfast was nice, and the breakfast lady make a very good cappuccino. The hotel was located in a nice and quaint part of Venice, away from all the tourists, but within walking distance to everything. Our room was quite large with 2 windows that open out and gave you a view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: plasma40
Reviews.Content: We were there three nights in mid-September and really enjoyed our stay. Our large (for Venice) room looked out over a little square and a small canal. Service was warm and helpful (well, I'd call the breakfast lady charmingly surly). A small continental breakfast buffet included cereals, canned fruit cup and yogurt, as well as the usual baked goods. The location is smack in the middle of Venice, so you can walk anywhere. At the end of the block; great gelato and arancini from the same takeout shop!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfectly located. Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: JessDre
Reviews.Content: This place was a real treat. The room was clean and beautiful, with a view of one of the smaller canals. It was on a nice quiet street, but the Rialto was only a five minute walk (give or take). The staff were incredibly friendly, and gave us a dinner recommendation that ended up being one of the most beautiful meals of our lives (Al Paradiso - an absolute must). All of this for about $150 a night in the middle of peak season. Really great. I would recommend this Laconda to anyone who doesn't need a $500 a night suite on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, Simple & Pretty Room, Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: libbyrae11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August, and really enjoyed this hotel. It is a little difficult to find, but if you are worried about getting lost, you should probably just not go to Venice, since the city itself is a giant labyrinth. Also, the fact that the hotel is a bit hard to find is what makes it worthwhile, since it is hidden from the hordes of tourists plaguing the rest of Venice. We ended up spending a lot of time just hanging out in the area of the hotel, since it was so uncrowded, and really had a lot of local life going on. The room itself (the double Superior pictured in the "Rooms" section of their website) was very simple and clean, but with beautiful furnishings including Murano glass chandelier. The best thing about the room was definitely the fill window with balcony and gorgeous view of the quiet pizza and canal below. We spent a lot of time just sitting and admiring the view. We ate 2 nights at and highly recommend the restaurant right downstairs from the hotel (Pizzeria Due Collonne, I believe) as it was incredibly inexpensive, with delicious pizza, pasta, big salads, and great house wine. There were a lot of locals at this restaurant too, including a huge party of Venetians one night, so you know it is a hidden gem. :) We didn't have the breakfast any morning, so can't comment on it, because service ended at 9:30am, which was a little early for us, jet-lagged and all. Also, it was a little annoying that the internet did not reach all the way into the room (sitting by the door it works), but those are really our only complaints. The service was very good - we were greeted every time we walked through the lobby, and all the desk staff were very helpful and willing to take lots of time to answer our questions. Overall, we would definitely stay in this hotel again, and really enjoyed feeling like we had an escape from the crowds in the rest of the city.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: currogarcia
Reviews.Content: We heard of Locanda Sant'Agostin through tripadvisor and it was an excellent choice. The hotel has a strategic position in Venice and we stayed there during four days in August 2011. We were four people and we selected a quadruple room that was spacious, clean and really comfortable. The staff of the hotel was kind and charm, especially the lady who served the breakfast. The breakfast was fairly basic but the quality was really good, with delicious capuccinos and brioches. Last, you receive a very good service for an affordable price. If I return to Venice I will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly, well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FranciscoTorres
Reviews.Content: It was great to land here for our first time in Venice! The staff is very friendly, breakfast was nice and we could easily walk everywhere. Pizza and gelato are near as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great city great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisasheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Took a five night break in Venice. Fabulous experience enhanced by choice of hotel. We were sent a very helpful map which was essential to find to hotel. It was located 15 mins from Rialto and San Marco, close enough to walk but far enough away to avoid the incredible hustle of the tourist area. Excellent service and a great breakfast to set our selves up for the date. The lady who served breakfast was wonderful. Rooms had air conditioning, a blessing in the height of summer. had good restaurant next door which offered good value dining al fresco and cheaper prices than the Rialto/San Marco area. Nice little bar in the next square over the bridge. Given a significant discount when paying by cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staffg ,ood value”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a sweet deal via TripAdvisor so we gave it a shot. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a residential part of Venice, far enough away from the tourist mess of Rialto, but close enough to everywhere to walk. The rooms are fair-sized; ours looked over a square and had some noise, but the Venetian shutters took care of that. The staff was very helpful an made good suggestions for dinner and events. The only complaint I have is the wireless, which is really only accessible from the lobby- it does not reach to the rooms. But it is free, which is a good thing. Breakfast (included) was nothing special; croissants, cereals, etc., and good cappucino. As other reviewers have mentioned, there are roughly 20 steps up to the lobby. It was about a 10-15 minute walk from the S. Stae vaporetto stop. GOOD Value in pricey Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey11
Reviews.Content: The hotel in and of itself was very nice. The rooms were spacious and clean, as well as comfortable. The breakfast was a typical Italian spread of croissants, jams, meats, hard boiled eggs, ect. The location of the hotel was good. It was located just outside of the crazy hustle and bustle of the Rialto Bridge, but was well within walking distance. We also walked to San Marco Square in about 15 minutes. My only complaint about the hotel was one staff member. Overall, we had a very pleasant experience, however, one night in particular, it was very apparent that the staff member working the desk did not care for Americans. Other than him, the rest of the staff was very warm, welcoming, and helpful. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a quaint place to stay in Venice on a budget. It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: remainderman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Locanda Sant'Agostin for four nights in late July 2011 and would highly recommend it as a great place to explore Venice. The hotel advertises itself as being "in the geographical centre of Venice" and I wouldn't be surprised if that was actually true - pretty much everything is an equal distance and not very far at all. The Rialto bridge is about 15 minutes' walk and Piazza San Marco is around 25 minutes away, though the nearest vaporetto stop (San Toma) is about 7 minutes' walk so it is easier to get to San Marco by water. Also a few minutes' walk away are the big, busy squares of Campo San Polo and Campo dei Frari which are good for food and sightseeing, but far enough away that the hotel is quiet and secluded. The hotel itself is located just off a small, quiet campo (square) and as a result feels very charming and real - nothing like the big touristy palazzi on the Grand Canal! It is furnished in typical lavish Venetian style but isn't over the top at all. Our room wasn't small (which is unusual for Venice) and was very comfortable. The beds in particular were excellent! The staff were always helpful and the breakfasts, while fairly basic, were good quality. The WiFi worked perfectly from our room, which was at the end of the corridor. We also had breakfast in bed one morning and it was very well done - I would highly recommend asking for this at least once! All in all, the Locanda Sant'Agostin is a perfect place to explore Venice - it is only a short walk to many of the main sights and is close to a vaporetto stop for everything else. It was also very reasonably-priced for Venice as we booked early online using a Tripadvisor Special Offer (which expires in December 2011) and paid in cash. If you are looking for a hotel in Venice which is centrally-located but not too busy, comfortable, high-quality and reasonably-priced, the Locanda Sant'Agostin is ideal. p.s. See my other reviews for some good restaurant and attraction recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “I love the apartment hotel of Locanda Sant'Agostin”
Reviews.Author: wowok2travel
Reviews.Content: Me and a group of friends stayed at Locanda's spacious apartment. We reserved the apartment for four people but you can honestly fit up to 8 people in there. It has 2 bedroom, 2 bath and a huge living room as well a kitchen. It's very clean and modern. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable rooms & centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: jhk5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights on my honeymoon & enjoyed it very much. I will admit it took us awhile to find this hotel but then again Venice is somewhat of a maze in itself. The room was simple & spacious for a european hotel with a good bathroom. The breakfast is pretty much cereal & some fruit, better off going to a bakery. There's a great one just around the corner from the hotel, they also sell wine & gelato. It's about a 5 minute walk to water taxi station, not bad once you figure out how to get it. There's also a great pizza joint downstairs, if you don't want to travel too far. Must go to Burano, great day trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: NigelThornberry
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the very spacious and well-appointed two-bedroom, two-bath apartment. The apartment is huge by almost anyone's standards and does have a view of a small canal. There is also a large kitchen which isn't available for preparing meals but which does have a full-sized refrigerator. There are restaurants nearby and the included breakfast in the main hotel dining area was very nice. Everyone of the hotel staff was helpful and cheerful. The free wifi signal doesn't reach the apartment, which is around the corner from the main hotel, but is available in the lobby. As noted by other reviewers, you need cash to settle your bill if you're staying fewer than three days. We very much enjoyed our stay and would happily return if we ever get back to Venice. Kim, Laura, Bob (Falls Church, VA) and Roberta (Beaufort, SC)

Reviews.Title: “Good location and seemed very traditional”
Reviews.Author: cpniner
Reviews.Content: Overall a good place to stay in Venice. Not exceptional but comfortable for a few days stay. .If you're staying less than 3 days though, make sure you have "cash" for the bill, they will not accept credit cards for short stays. We ended up running all over the city late at night and early in the morning trying to find ATM's that would accept our card in an effort to get the amount needed. Also, let the camera charger plugged in and emailed asking if we could have it sent but no response from the hotel. I agree with earlier writers that the woman at breakfast was very sweet but the food so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable lodging and good value”
Reviews.Author: kjlanc
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with a personal touch. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The room and bath are spacious considering that it is in the heart of Venice. Reception staff is friendly and very helpful. Located in a quiet neighborhood. While the hotel is not very close to the major tourist sites (Rialto, San Marco), the walk there is reasonable. Good selection of restaurants and shops close by. Minor criticisms: Breakfast choices are quite limited and are the same from day to day. Wireless internet service is barely adequate in the rooms. Our devices had difficulty in finding the network, and suffered from occasional dropouts. Overall we found this hotel to be a great value. Other comparable hotels were priced considerably more.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location... Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: AniParWil
Reviews.Content: I'm finishing breakfast as I write this review on the Locanda Sant` Agostin. Rooms are a bit disappointing, we stayed in a standard double room, 101B, with no remote control (it pissed me of the fact they knew there wasn't any for a few days) and the toilet converted on a swimming pool after a shower... and room 104, a twin "Deluxe" room with the same features as the standard but a few tenners extra... The woman on the reception during night time wasn't very pleasant and she was on breakfast as well. But the star of the hotel is Emmanuele, he made us feel really welcome and his recommendations over Venice where spot on!! Over all is a very good looking hotel, offers everything you could expect in hotel and it`s in the residential part, where Venetians live. I recommend this place without hesitations and this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good, handily placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: agedone62
Reviews.Content: Three of us shared a comfortable room. The hotel is clean and quiet, with friendly helpful staff. The lady who served the breakfast was particularly nice! The hotel is up a steep set of stairs, but is well-placed for walking to the Grand Canal where the vaporetto can be caught to all the usual sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: sjellmore
Reviews.Content: You enter the hotel off a small piazza, go up a flight of stairs and enter the lobby/dining room. All rooms are off the lobby. Small but charming. Our room was beautifully furnished and the bathroom was the largest of any during our stay in Italy. The breakfast buffet was ordinary but convenient. It is a 20 minute walk away from the crowds which is great. We wandered quaint alleys and passed wonderful little shops. I liked this side of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “High praise”
Reviews.Author: TheShadfort
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the reviews of others and can only but endorse previous comments. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful - able to advise on some excellent restaurants off the beaten track. And the room spacious and clean. We found the location convenient for both easy access from the main rail station - no more than a 10min walk once you have your bearings (and just 4 bridges to cross with your bag!) - and for exploring the multitude of shops and restaurants away from the more expensive outlets around St Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Small Hotel on a River”
Reviews.Author: Wally S
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was perfect for our stay! Friendly staff, clean and beautifullyl-furnished room with a faux balcony window opening to the Sant'Agostin river (small canal) where gondolas, rowboats, canoes, water taxis and other boats passed by during the day. There is a piazza in front of the hotel where you can have a drink or snack and watch the world float by! We found the location to be ideal for exploring, and after getting lost a couple of times in the maze that is Venice, we soon learned how to get around easily. We arrived from the train station via water taxi as we were tired from our trip, but when we left we rolled our bags along the streets and over 4 canals back to the station in less than 15 minutes. We had fast WiFi service in our room once we got the correct info about logging on. Great breakfast service too.

Reviews.Title: “The apartment was perfect”
Reviews.Author: KatesRoy
Reviews.Content: We rented an apartment overlooking a canal for a great price. It had 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, a living area and a kitchen, although the fridge is the only part of the kitchen that works. It was very convenient for a very fair price, and the breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Olsens
Reviews.Content: Went by the reviews and they didn't disappoint. Perfect communication. Simple walking map to the hotel supplied via email. Atmosphere, room and breakfast were better than expected. Central part of Venice, so very easy walking to all the sights. Very quiet in the evening, so we had an excellent sleep each night. Large room with comfy bed and big bathroom. Would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional venetian style hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BJ216
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and really looked after us. The hotel was quite easy to find, even in the maze of Venice streets, with the email with map & directions that the staff emailed me. The rooms were simple but very large for Venice. We were originally in a double room, which was quite big (for Venice), and were upgraded on our second night to a Junior Suite which was even bigger. Keep in mind however that the rooms are decorated in an extremely traditional Venetian style.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be a fool to pass this place up”
Reviews.Author: kellybeans79
Reviews.Content: I must be lucky or this place is just fantastic. Italian rooms, beautiful furnishings... and a shower in which I can actually shower with hot water! Bed was comfy, the street romantic, the staff? Well the gorgeous guy at the front desk was so nice to my boyfriend and me. He chatted us up for at least a half hour about football, theater, you name it. The first night we arrived, our credit card was having problems because we forgot to call and say we were traveling internationally. The aforementioned gorgeous guy just said "no problem, you must be tired traveling so far" and gave us the key and told us to "take care of it tomorrow." When we woke up the next day, he was still there, and kindly, without being rude or intrusive, reminded us, then offered what the best things to do for the day and evening were. He, along with the sweetheart serving breakfast, together made for a very special trip to Venice. I can't say enough nice things about the staff and the friendly Venetians we met on this trip. I can't wait to go back. Actually... I already booked for October 2011 again. For Venice, avoid the crowds and high prices, stay here, its so fun to get lost after a few bottles of Italian wine... Venice IS for getting lost in the canals afterall~

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple12-8-2010
Reviews.Content: In April, my husband and I spent four wonderful nights in Venice at the Locanda Sant'Agostin. If you want a quiet setting away from all the tourists this is the place. We were only a ten minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and twenty minutes to St. Mark's Square. The Locanda Sant'Agostin was so centrally located to everything... walking all the lovely districts was what we enjoyed the most. The service was excellent...everyone was so pleasant and helpful. The jewel of the Locanda Sant'Agostin is Eugenia. She always made sure our coffee selection was perfect. The many selections of coffee were delicious and yes you had a choice! In fact I didn't have to tell her what I would like, she always remembered. Breakfast was more than adequate...fruit, cereal, yogurt, juice, rolls and croissants. Our room was spacious with no view but it was quiet and had a lovely bath with a towel warmer. After breakfast Eugenia cleaned and prepared the rooms for your return. Thank you Eugenia and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “REGRETS - Overpriced and over-rated!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlusters3671
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in European hotels for over 45 nights in the last 15 months - so we are familiar with and have reasonable expectations about international travel. Needs were not anticipated or met. We had two guests and were provided with one towel. (had to ask for towel) Glasses were dirty from one day to next (had to ask for clean glasses) Breakfast was dreadful - just wanted a piece of fresh fruit - but there was only canned fruit cocktail and stale croissants - had to eat a fresh breakfast from street vendors after paying 215 EU per night.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend, but could improve in some areas.”
Reviews.Author: TestBed
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days with other friends at this Hotel, due in large to the reviews on "tripadvisor". While we were generally happy with the experience, there is room for improvement from this Hotel. Firstly, the staff in general are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast lady/cleaner is a delight and keeps the rooms spotless. I was not impressed however to visit the foyer to use the internet at around 0630 one morning and hear the snoring emanating from the "office" where the "night manager" was fast asleep on the floor in darkness and doors only slightly ajar. He then woke to an alarm and started to prepare breakfast in the small kitchen while talking loudly on a hands free mobile phone (in Asian) and snorting and passing wind. The rooms are small (typical of Italy) but very clean. The pillows are hard (typical of Italy) but the beds are comfortable. Free wifi is advertised, but it is not mentioned that it is not available in the rooms. It is only available in the foyer/breakfast area. This is a major annoyance and results in the already small, crowded breakfast area being overcrowded at breakfast time with people using the internet as well as those eating. Other guests I spoke to were not impressed that wifi was not available in the rooms and believed the advertising was somewhat deceiving. While overall a good experience, there is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet area, comfortable clean well managed small hotel”
Reviews.Author: olgits
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Venice many times over the years and have seen the prices rise so steeply that we cannot afford our usual favoured places to stay. However we found this little gem of a place and could not fault it. Good value in a briliant location, once you find it, (very good map provided prior to arrival) with decent clean rooms and friendly staff. We loved to return to this location at night far from the madding crowds! Was March tho, things may change in high season. Breakfast ok and have paid much more in more expensive hotels for similar.Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Home in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: awh20015
Reviews.Content: A small (12-room) hotel in the very center of the city - near everything but away from the crowds. Elegant setting, personalized service, outgoing staff, free internet, comfortable rooms. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Venice, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jdlowe31
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning and were advised that we could leave our bags in reception while we were waiting to check in. We were given a map and advised the best way to see things. (A Map is really important in Venice). After returning we found our bags were already in the apartment which is 50 metres from the hotel. The apartment had canal views and was very quiet as it is set back from the major walk way. It had a lot of space and we really enjoyed our stay here. The free wi fi internet is only available in reception. What they do need in the apartment is some basics, like a kettle and some plates to eat off. But all in all this was a minor issue for us. The service at breakfast was great. Refills of coffe or hot chocolate whenever requested and the location is one of the strongest points of this hotel. It is set back from St marks square (about 20 minute walk) but this allows it to be a bit more quieter at night and allows you to see the authentic Venice a bit more. We made the walk at night and I would highly recommend this. It is when many of the tourists have left for the night and to see St marks square at night with the bands playing, there is a beautiful ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: wikusdutoit
Reviews.Content: Easy to book online. No problem booking in. Very friendly staff welcoming us. nice room and unbeatable location. Hotel map made finding it in this maze very easy! Average Breakfast. Good solid experience. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: systemic_rebel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the centre of Venice, in the San Polo district. The hotel looks great and seems to be well looked after. We stayed in a double room next to the reception. I have seen a lot of reviews complaining about noise from the reception area, but i can't say I agree with those reviews. The room was quiet and lovely decorated. The view was straight into a brick wall, but its a Venetian brick wall so its ok;) And below the window was a small and quiet alleyway - no noise during the night. The breakfast was ok, as expected for a hotel of this size and standard. The breakfast lady doesn't speak English, only Italian, but she is really amusing and service minded! Some of the guys in the recepton desk, are not that amusing. It might look like they are a bit tired of their job. They will help you, but not always with a smile... All in all, it's a nice littel hotel, with a great central location in Venice. And the price is not bad either (for Venetian standards...)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Zuckerstueck
Reviews.Content: We have really enjoyed our stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin. Especially the receptionist (unfortunately, I do not remember his name) was very helpful and funny. He gave us very good advise on where to go to, what to see, where to eat etc. The room is quite small, but big enough and nicely decorated. High ceilings and beautiful furniture. It is also clean. The location is very convenient, you can reach everything within short walking-distance. The breakfast is alright, but there is not much variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff service, great location, clean, what more could we want.”
Reviews.Author: Maccy124
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It's location is excellent as it isn't in the main touristy area, yet it has easy links to get to St Marcs Square and the Rialto bridge. It is also only a short walk to the St. Toma Vaparetto stop. When going I'd advise emailing the hotel for directions, the ones they sent were simple and easy to use. The hotel itself was immaculately presented and clean. The staff were also always attentive and offering to help or direct us each day. Even reminding us the evening before the clocks changed (we'd have forgotten otherwise). The breakfast offered was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little Gem in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Karene11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days in February 2011. Staff are remarkable nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is clean, warm and welcoming and within easy walking distance of boat stops. We would definitely return here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel away from the busy tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Ferrovision
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Jan '11 as a Christmas present. It was perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful - full of local knowledge and willing to share it! Rooms were beautiful - very clean. The breakfast was fresh and lovely and the service 100%....highly recommended! :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy7759
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was recommended to us by a family member who lives in Salerno. We thought the Hotel was charming, clean and well located. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was large and we loved the drying rack for out wet cloths, (we stayed at a very wet time of the year) The staff was friendly and helpful to us. This is a small and personal hotel. We enjoyed our stay in Venice, and in this lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy for choosing it”
Reviews.Author: Alexanders2009
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel thanks to all reviews on TripAdvisor. I never go on vacation without your advice. Thanks to you all! So, the hotel, as expected from all reviews, was a very nice one, excellent location (walking distance to almost everything in Venice), beautiful style, clean, very kiind and helpful staff. We would stay there if going back to Venice, but would probably ask for another room. Ours had one detail that I would change, though... very poor natural light. Hope you enjoy Locanda Sant'Agostin!

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy warm locanda”
Reviews.Author: _LSV_Cascais
Reviews.Content: Nice and warm Locanda in venice!!! The morning recepcionist was not so friendly and very hard to comunicate but.... the rest of the team was really friendly and ready to help.This locanda is located in the center of Venice a few minutes walk from the main tourist spots.The building is not so friendly for couples carrying buggies with little kids. (the entrance has a very big stair)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, fair price and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RonikSF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. It's located close to one of the central Grand Canal's station - just a few stations from the railway terminal, and fairly priced. The room was large and clean and the breakfast was pretty good. And Eugene who works there was so nice, helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice”
Reviews.Author: caedias
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in Venice, clean, convenient, the best choice ever!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place for visiting venice”
Reviews.Author: katerinarodos
Reviews.Content: ideal place to stay right in the heart of real Venice clean comfortable and elegant rooms very good breakfast very efficient and helpfull staff definetely i will stay again in my nxt visit

Reviews.Title: “Ideal and characterful base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: DrACG
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this charming hotel and found that it was ideally placed for visiting Venice. We traveled from Marco Polo airport by airport bus to the Piazzale Roma, as recommended by the hotel. The staff were uniformly courteous and friendly. They gave useful tips on where to eat and how to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a romantic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: emmaltowers
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel in early December, and it was perfect for a romantic getaway! The location is great - close enough to all of the main sights, but tucked away enough to be quiet at night. Next door to the hotel, there is also a great restaurant, a bar serving cicheti and beautiful cheap wine (with live jazz acts on some nights), and a lovely bakery. The bedrooms are great value, with some of the building's original fittings, lovely decoration and tons of space. Also, the staff are fantastic - check in and out was extremely efficient, and they are more than happy to help with restaurant reservations over the phone, directions etc. We had a lovely stay at the Locanda Sant'Agostin and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a magical place”
Reviews.Author: wiggles25
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin is located in a quiet humble area not far from the train station. We arrived and were greeted warmly by the staff. Their welcoming, helpful, and kind nature is unique and comforting. The rooms are spacious, and extremely cozy and homely. The cleanliness was also superb. The breakfast was great, and Eugenia was just amazing! It was the perfect place for our get-away, romantic, and quiet, with a great friendly staff, and a location that is close to everything we wanted to see. It really made our trip so much better than we expected! We definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Central, cozy, charming”
Reviews.Author: DocVIE
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of both the train station and the bus terminal at Piazzale Roma, Locanda Sant Agostin provides a beautiful cozy base off the path of the largest tourist hordes. The only minor issue is that - like in many places in Venice - some windows only open onto very narrow lanes (mine certainly did), so try to get a room with more of a view. And when you make your reservation, be sure to print out the map the hotel will e-mail you.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: gizmo38
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this small hotel and found that it was ideally placed for visiting Venice. We arrived at Marco Polo airport and took the airport bus to the Piazzale Roma, as recommended by the hotel. It then took about 10 minutes to walk to the hotel, following the excellent map sent with our booking confirmation. This would be difficult with heavy luggage, as you have to cross several bridges. The hotel is located in a quiet area of San Polo, and our balcony looked out over the Campo Sant Agostin and canal. Fortunately our street didn't get flooded, even during high water. It was a few minutes walk to the Frari church, which is worth a visit, and about 10 mnutes to St Marc's square, via the Rialto bridge. We also took a one-day travel pass and visited the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello. Our pass also allowed us to take a vaporetto trip up the Grand Canal. Service was friendly and the hotel staff were always happy to advise us. We followed their recommendations for restaurants, and our particular favourite was Osteria Vivaldi. The hotel breakfast was adequate, but we would have appreciated some fresh fruit and a little more variety. Our bedroom was very comfortable, and the bathroom well equipped. All in all, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Julie
Reviews.Content: Nice big room and bathroom with a comfortable bed. Walls must be pretty thin though you could hear the next room use the toilet and snore. There was no street noise, but the TV set up was pretty ordinary with the english channels needing to be reset constantly. I gave up in the end. You could walk everywhere from the hotel but you need a good map, although the hotel is quite a distance from the tourist areas. No fault of the hotel but coming in from the airport is expensive , 100 euro, by water taxi. Unless you can find someone staying at the same hotel you cant share. Lots of taxis taking only two passengers. If you are staying at this hotel you need to go by'water taxi because it would be too difficult walking in from the edge of the island. Venice is a maze of streets, if you decide to walk, good luck. The water taxi's rob you with out pulling a gun.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Billy62_49
Reviews.Content: Like a diamond in the rough. On a quick glance you may forego staying here , but that would be too bad for you. Clean , spacious, and excellent location to walk to sites. The service was excellent. And the staff go out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: dspowell1
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. Although the hotel was only a 5-10 min walk from the Rialto Bridge, you were still in a neighborhood. It was about a 10-15 min walk to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Reka_and_Peter
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quiet and authentic place to stay in Venice. I can say: we managed to find the ideal place to stay in Venice. Its central location makes it just a few minutes to reach the main, but overcrowded attractions of the city, while the hotel is located in a quiet street next to a small canal. Locanda Sant'Agostin has a unique atmosphere and a fantastic staff. We can recommend it for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and the service!”
Reviews.Author: dlennert
Reviews.Content: The hotel we had booked, without our knowledge, had canceled our reservation even though we had a confirmation letter. We were in Venice with no where to stay. We called the Loconda Sant' Agostin and they went out of their way to accomodate us even though they were near full. Our accomodation was wonderful and very clean. Breakfast in the morning was all you woud need and included coffee, capuccino, etc. The hotel staff spoke English and provided recommendations for restaurants, sites to see and transportation to the airport. We loved the location and felt we were living among Venetians rather than with fellow tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: KHF71
Reviews.Content: Since there were 4 of us, we took the apartment which was not at the hotel building but 50 metres or so from that block. The apartment has 2 bedrooms (1 with double bed and the other with 2 single beds), 2 bathrooms (not ensuite) and a spacious living room. There is also a kitchen but not for guests' use. Paid Euro 380 for 2 nights which worked out to Euro 95 per room per night which was just great for us. There's a shop selling delicious gelato just round the corner. Location is OK. Staff of Locanda is fantastic - gave us useful information and helped us arrange for a private water taxi. Special thanks to Manuel who helped our friend retrieve his wallet and phone left behind at the apartment after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for this location”
Reviews.Author: GandGBC
Reviews.Content: If you're a tourist in Venice, there's a great advantage to staying in the city center -- but that puts you into some of the highest hotel prices in Italy. Locanda Sant'Agostin is a great compromise - you're a 15-20 minute walk (once you know your way!) from the major tourist area of Piazza San Marco, and you pay a reasonable price. The hotel itself is enough off the beaten path that it's relatively quiet. It's not easy to find, but what is easy to find in Venice? Use the map provided electronically by the hotel when you reserve, supplemented by a good map that you can buy for a few Euro. The service at Sant-Agostin is really good, and the breakfast is quite good as well. If you need it, they will willingly help you get your bags up the flight of stairs to reception. Hint: take the hotel's recommendation about restaurants - we did much better with them than with our guidebooks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: brigitteMenton
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had a wonderful room. Spacious and individually furnished at great expense and in good taste. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. They booked tickets for us to see the opera and were always on hand to answer any questions. There are one or two little restaurants in the immediate vicinity. My one and only tiny complaint would be the breakfast, which would have benefitted from some cold meat, boiled eggs or fruit. We stayed 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin”
Reviews.Author: hoelzler
Reviews.Content: Our son and wife who live in New Jersey booked 2 rooms for themselfs and my husband and me on the internet. We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and quiet with a very venezian decor. The staff was very helpful and the lady serving breakfast was especially friendly and made us feel so welcome. I would recommend Locanda Sant'Agostin to my friends and have already. The hotel is centrally located and ideal to explore this fantastic city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: kholmes1
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Venice and we booked this hotel via Trip Advisor based upon location and availability. It's a small property with 5 bedrooms located in a quiet street. However it is within walking distance to some of the best sights outside of San Marco (San Roco & Museum of Modern Art). The room was clean and well decorated in a renaisance style. Breakfast is a small continental buffet with fresh pastries and lots of coffee thanks to the Waitress (who doubles up as the room maid). The receptionists were excellent and booked us the Opera and also checked our restaurant booking when my Italian failed me. They held our luggage until the room was ready and also on our last day until we eventually left this beautiful city. The downsides? Well this isn't a 'hotel' as such. It is more a set of serviced rooms with a reception. However, this suits many travellers as you spend all day visiting the sites and the evening at the opera, or eating at a restaurant on the main canal. Just don't expect an evening dinner menu or vast lounges or a bar which are all within 2 minutes walk of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: starlite05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in September 2010. It was our first trip to Venice and we took the vaporetto and got off at the St. Toma stop. We had clear directions from the hotel, so it was fairly easy to find the hotel. The staff was very friendly and since we reached before our check in time, we were told that we could leave our bags there and go sightseeing. We got a map and directions on how to get to the Rialto and St. Marks square, and other things to do. When we finally returned, we realized that our luggage was already transferred to our room, which was very nice of them to do! The room itself was very nice and comfortable and the bathroom was clean. There was free wireless internet available which was a plus. The hotel is located in central Venice, so it's only about a 15 min walk to get to St. Marks square. The closest vaporetti stop is St. Toma (which is one of the express line stops). Or you can just as easily walk anywhere. There are a lot of good restaurants nearby, and the staff was helpful in providing recommendations. We had to leave early in the morning, before breakfast was scheduled to start, so weren't expecting to eat anything. However, we were still given breakfast and hot coffee, which I thought was very nice of them. Overall, we had a very nice stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend to anyone going to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Teresa011
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and had a deluxe room with a balcony overloving small piazza. Room was nice, clean and quiet with generous bath. Location was the best. Easy to get all around Venice and yet in a quiet neighborhood in the evening/mornings. Staff was so helpful and gave great recommendations for eating and navigating. Always pleasant and interested in seeing we saw the best of Venice. Really excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: LisaSuz
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this little gem to everyone. Everyone at the hotel was so welcoming and helpful. The hotel is in a great location, and you can easily walk to everything that Venice has to offer. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the bathrooms are modern.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RowleyEssex
Reviews.Content: A very small place - all rooms are on the same accessed straight of the lobby but it is in one of the wonderful old houses in the island, and overlooks a very quiet square and canal. We were only about 5 minutes from all the crowds at the Rialto, yet this place is in a very peaceful spot. The room was not large, but it was very well appointed, clean and comfortable. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. You really felt that you were soaking up the character of Venice here. One word of waring - they like you to pay cash if you stay less than three nights, which could mean needing around E500 in notes readily available!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with big service”
Reviews.Author: Tp136
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to many attractions and you are within walking distance of all the major attractions of Venice or close to the vaporetto which is a must. There a piazza's close by as well as cafe's and a market. We enjoyed the piazza's at night while eating dinner. The children would come out with parents to play, you could sit and enjoy the food and wine or stroll while eating gelato. The hotel is located more in a residential area but there is a bakery next door so what not to like. There are so many cafe's close by and also the canal...but then you can start the fun process of navigating the small alleyways to get to the Rialto bridge and San Marco Square...and if you get lost hop a vaporetto and then a close walk back to the hotel. All vaporetto roads lead back to the hotel. I would not hesitate to come back. Beware, however, that there is no lift and you have a walk up stairs with luggage. However, the staff is very helpful with the luggage. The morning we were leaving our driver was picking us up at 4:30 a.m. and they fixed us breakfast for us (European stye) before we left which they did not have to do and was greatly appreciated especially as we were rushed for time at the Venice Airport and DeGaulle...so that meal was what got us through until on the airplane heading back to the states. She was so accomodating that morning and so cheerful...service that is not offered everywhere. They were helpful in directions and helping you navigate the city.

Reviews.Title: “When we go back to Venice we will stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin.”
Reviews.Author: pwalker69
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were very tired and were so pleased to be greated with a smile and a "Let me help you with your bags." Our check-in was done very quickly and then we were taken to our beautiful room. When we left, to start our day, we were given a map, directions to where we wanted to go, wished a good day and reminded that someone would be at the desk 24 hours. When we finally returned to our room we found the bed and pillows to be very comfortable. Breakfast was good and beautifully served in a lovely area. My daughter requested a bottle of champagne be put in our room to help us celebrate our 50th anniversery. When the hotel found out we were married 50 years they moved us to a room with a balcony (no extra charge.) We "Highly" recommend Locand Sant'Agostin!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Central Location”
Reviews.Author: ctony
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin was the perfect hotel in Venice for our family vacation. It was clean and quiet.. The location couldn't have been better, only a 5-minute stroll to the Frari & 3 minutes to Campo San Polo. The staff was very accommodating, friendly and welcoming. Given the high hotel prices in Venice, the cost of our stay was quite fair. We definitely would recommend the hotel to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value in an Incredible City”
Reviews.Author: Globalshare
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews on TripAdvisor were a factor in choosing this hotel for our family's trip to Venice, and, while my expectations were pretty high, the Locanda Sant' Agostin exceeded them. Even before we arrived, I had received, via email from the reception staff, very helpful information regarding where to park and how to get to the hotel. Thus, even though Venice is a maze, we were able to find the hotel with no problems. The location of the hotel is just about perfect -- lots of things to do in the vicinity, not too far from San Marco square and all of its offerings, but still off the beaten track enough so that it's not a zoo around it (even in August). My wife and two teen-aged sons traveled with me, and we all unanimously felt that this was a great hotel experience for the four days we spent there. The staff was friendly and helpful (with good recommedations for where to visit and eat), the rooms were very clean and comfortable, the air conditioning worked great (this was especially appreciated in the hot/humid weather we had visiting Venice in August) and the continental breakfast each morning (included in the price) was just right to start our days. Having free Wi-fi was also appreciated (especially by the boys). The value of this hotel was incredible -- the atmosphere and quality would have been good value at even twice the price. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation -- the only caveat being that I don't think there is an elevator (I'm not positive about this, though) so someone who would have difficulty going up the stairs to the second floor might have a bit of trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Seagr112
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but fantastic things to say about the Locanda Sant'Agostin. From the moment we arrived, we felt welcome and everyone we met was friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean and quiet (and air conditioned!). Venetian glass chandelier and venetian decor throughout. The beds were comfortable and the breakfast was definitely adequate (croissants, bread, jams, etc., cereal and all the capuccino you could drink. (As well as juice, hot chocolate, coffee etc.) The lady who serves is very nice, and the guys at the front desk were all very nice too. We really liked the location. It was about a 15-20 minute well marked walk down to St. Marks and all the touristy stuff, but the walk was just as interesting; plus you are far enough away from the crowds that you are in a quiet and more authentic part of Venice. As well, exploring in the opposite direction back towards Piazzalle Roma or towards the Port area is easy to do with the central location. Being a bit away from the touristy places, I found the pricing a bit more reasonable in the neighborhood shops, markets and ice cream stands, too. Make sure you try the San Souci beer at the grocery stores. Finding the hotel was relatively easy - the supplied map on the internet was more than adequate. After all the stories of getting lost in Venice I thought it would be a bit of a challenge but it was not hard at all. We had a fantastic time in Venice - it is certainly one of those 'must see' places if you are into traveling, and I would highly recommend that you stay at Locanda Sant' Augustin. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have spent my money somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Treadted2
Reviews.Content: I was excited for this place because the website makes it look great, and the reviews are great, but I was really really dissapointed. Put a pretty big damper on my trip to venice. First of all, there is nothing much to rave about with this place. Yeah, nice location, friendly staff, its clean, whatever. Beyond that, it's a big yawn. We made our reservation with the request that we have a room with a view. I was a bit surprised when the guy at the front desk walked over two feet and opened a door right next to the desk into our room. Upon opening the windows, I found a brick wall. Awesome. The room was big, but a bit drab. A TV the size of a toaster, not a big deal, but at this price? Give me a nice TV. I have a brick wall to look at outside my window! Well, at least breakfast is included. Hmm, another dissapointment. So you're telling me that for $250 a night, all you can give me is some cornflakes, a croissant, and some juice? It was rediculous. Upon reading some of the other elated reviews, I read about the rooms with the fantastic views of the nearby canal and plaza. I felt majorly ripped off. I won't go back. This place has VERY LITTLE charm. The room I was put in should not be a room they put guests in. If you decide to go, make sure you don't have this room. To top it off, if you don't stay more than 3 nights, you have to pay in cash. That's BS. And the lady who speaks no english... she's nice and all, but stop blabbering to me like I understand. I have no idea what you are saying. And they have free wifi, but for whatever reason, the password is impossible to input. It litereally is something like, jkj39 lk395 u4213 ds195 fs935 ns295. Why so long? Why so random? AFter three five minute attempts to punch this in on my iphone, I gave up. No sense in going back to the front desk to complain, it was Ms. noenglish working. $250 a night... Go somewhere else, really. There is better.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, super location!”
Reviews.Author: freiburg13
Reviews.Content: Where would I start? We found Locanda Sant' Agostin through Trip Advisor, and consider myself fortunate and privileged to stay there for few nights, while in Venice. First of all, great location in San Polo, 15 minutes walk from train station, away from craziness of San Marco, but close to everything, very nice and artistic, close to Campo San Polo, Da Fiore (one of the best restaurants in Venice, where we dined), dei Frari Church, and beatiful Scuola Grande di San Rocco with Tintoretto paintings. Secondly, wonderful, helpful staff: reception, breakfast, cleaning, everybody was top notch, especially Evgeniya! Rooms are quite nice and good sized, with interesting design touches, breakfast was better than in most places. Nothing to complain about, perhaps, a bit expensive, but it is Venice, after all. I very highly recommend this place for anyone who is coming to Venice. Quick tip: go to San Marco for sightseeing, enjoy wonderful Basilika di San Marco, Palazzo Ducale, the whole Piazza San Marco, then quickly go elsewhere, unless you enjoy this endless tourist circus with overcrowding, bad expensive food, souvenir shops, this is not real Venice this is glamorized commercialized museum, stay away! Venice has much more to offer than San Marco, believe me!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful! Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: LucyDangerRothwell
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel located right in the middle of venice, next to a delicious gelato shop, and a square with outdoor film pavilion, fabulous restaurant and shopping street. The location is perfect if you want to be close to all the excitement of Venice, while still a little of the beaten track. The view from the window was incredible, overlooking another small square and canal. Street musicians can be heard through the windows to provide a romantic, classic Venetian atmosphere. The rooms were cozy and well affixed with all the necessities: bath, big bed, tv, internet, a wonderful breakfast included. Extremely comfortable stay. Last, but certainly not least, if nothing else, go to the Locanda Sant'Agostin for the staff. Service was excellent! The nicest hotel management I have ever experianced. They were interested, friendly, and took you in like family. Everyone working was extremely kind and hardworking. The half that dont speak English do their best, which is incredible, and still manage to communicate. If you need an English speaking manager, there is an absolutely stunning Italian man that helps to run the hotel and can speak beautiful English. I hope this review has helped. We absolutely loved out stay, and hope as many people can experience one similar. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Venice Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: karen_toon
Reviews.Content: Sant'Agostin was a lucky find on the internet but we will be recommending it to family and friends who wish to visit Venice. The welcome was perfect with a good explanation of the facilities and a useful map of Venice with the hotel marked. The hotel was like staying in someone's home with beautiful old decoration in the Breakfast room and our suite. I can't describe it as a room as it had an entrance with wardrobes, a good bathroom,with plenty of hot water and daily clean towels, to the left and then our room to sleep 3 on the right. This room was so big the 3 of us were never falling over each other and could always find somewhere to sit as as well as a double and 2 single beds there was a sofa and large antique desk with chair. The chanderliers were Murano glass which made our visit to the island even more special. Breakfast was a good continental buffet with super service for hot drinks. The only improvement we would see would be useful would be for breakfast to start a bit earlier than 8.15 to enable the committed tourist to get out ahead of the crowds. Our 12 year old son is quite critical but he found he could have his privacy space within the room, got plenty of food (not easy with his growth spurt at the mo) and felt comfortable in the atmosphere of the Locanda. A definite pearl of a find

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Gracelane
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for great items made by some customers who had stayed there before and we can not only confirm the courteous staff always helpful and friendly. We looked for a small hotel to have a more family atmosphere. The room was as described in the website and spacious with a wonderful bathroom. The simple but hearty breakfast served by a person always ready to make you smile. The Inn is located in a central area 10 minutes from all points in the City. We can only advise to all this beautiful structure.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: MikeandSarahLondon
Reviews.Content: We are avid readers of Trip Advisor and always consult the reviews when looking to find places to stay on our travels. The overwhelming feedback for Locanda Sant'Agostin was positive and, although not cheap, we took the plunge without any hesitation. We got a water taxi from the airport which took us almost to the door of the hotel. A very nice way to arrive! Then the reality. For a small hotel you usually expect a warmer welcome on checking in. Not so in our case. It was conducted with very little communication by a receptionist who looked like the job was beneath him. Our room was extremely small and with no view. Decor was pleasing though. The room was next to the reception desk, which was just as well as there was no offer to help with our cases. Internal noise, from the reception and breakfast tables, was a huge problem for us. Never have I stayed in a place with such a badly designed layout â€“ a breakfast area right outside a bedroom! I can just picture the scene when they were converting this place into a hotel.
