When everything was finished, the owners looking at each other and one saying â€œOh no, we forgot to include a reception and breakfast area, what can we do?â€� The other replying â€œNot a problem, letâ€™s just plonk them in the hallway.â€� We relayed our sleep deprivation woes to the owner on our first morning. He brushed it aside in an arrogant manner. Not a great start. Breakfast, if you could call it that, was unadventurous, repetitive, and very basic. Management seemed impervious to, and offended by, any criticism. Style over substance we felt. There are some places you stay and you get a feeling that the owners take great pride and pleasure in what they do, and that the hotel has been designed with the customerâ€™s comfort and wellbeing paramount. With Locanda Sant'Agostin, we felt we were just being taken for mugs by people who looked down their noses. I think working in an art gallery may be a better vocation for these guys. We stayed for 3 nights and loved Venice itself. On our walks we noted lots of lovely looking hotels that were better located, had better facilities, and, on further inspection, were very welcoming and hospitable. We will know better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we dreamed of...and more!”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarried4Ever
Reviews.Content: Having spent hours and hours planning every last detail of our 20th wedding anniversary we were thrilled to have chosen Locanda Sant'Agostin. The location is terrific. My wife and I had room 103B which has a juliette balcony with a view over a small courtyard and canal. The front desk was very accommodating and helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations and other activities. They recommended a great family restaurant at Campo San Polo. We spent 3 nights here before heading to London, but we would go back in a heartbeat. Good European breakfast--cereal, yogurt, pastries, and coffee. Room was very good size for European standards--large antique armoire, desk w/chair, good-sized bathroom with tub, shower, bidet, comode and sink.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located, a good hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviews. This hotel has been reviewed quite impresively already. I will add several things. We stayed in the apartment. It is in a tiny alley (really tiny - two people cant fit shoulder to shoulder) in then same block as the main hotel. The apartment is on the second floor, windows go out to a small canal with some traffic, but nothing exceptional in terms of views. It has two bathrooms, one with a stand in shower, the other with a bathtub. Water pressure adequate, the stand-in shower door leaked all over the floor. Towels were flimsy, but adequate. No Wifi, no phone, TV reception terrible. TV really is a computer monitor that sits in the living room (20 inch or so I think). Wifi is available in the main building. Did not use the kitchen, but it was spacious. Bed OK, nothing amazing, adequate. Furniture in general was acceptable. Breakfast - the most basic I had in Italy ever. The server was extremely nice, but all she had was yogurt, couple pastries, cereal, milk, cofee, juices. Breakfast is in the main lobby. Overall - I would stay there again, excellent location, very friendly staff and adequate accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little boutique hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: John_Beccles
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff who mostly spoke good english. Only a few rooms but ours was clean and reasonably well-equipped. The air con worked well. All the rooms are located off the main lobby which is situated up a flight of stairs. Excellent location away from the main crowds of St Marks Square but stll within reasonable walking distance. Easy access to a couple of vaporetto stops and also to the main railway station. Good restaurants and/or take-aways nearby. We would certainly return if we had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around!”
Reviews.Author: anne_ng
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and we stayed at the Locanda Sant' Agostin for one night during our trip to Venice in July. The Locanda is really excellent all around. The location is great, the rooms were clean and most importantly, the friendly staff really went out of their way for us. We really wished we could have stayed there longer and we really do appreciate the wonderful service. Right after our trip, a family friend asked for hotel recommendations in Venice, needless to say, we immediately recommended the Locanda.

Reviews.Title: “This small hotel is charming, friendly, well located and atmospheric.”
Reviews.Author: venetianadmirer
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't be more obliging and helpful.Our room was spotlessly clean and decorated Venetian style with a great bathroom. They serve a good breakfast included in the tariff. There is an initial quite steep staircase to negotiate. There are good eating places very nearby and an atmospheric little bar on a canal two seconds away. The area is fantastic, local, not too busy and touristy with lots of good food and drink readily available. Our room was very quiet despite being on a busy street as it was very well insulated by double glazing etc. In any case, we enjoyed the noise which was mostly happy chatter by local workers. Our only disappointment was we did not have a room with a view, but then we booked very late and had not requested one! When they became aware of our disappointment [and were not able to remedy the situation due to prior bookings], they charmingly sent a chilled bucket containing a bottle of very good prosecco to our room, we appreciated the gesture!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Brownstones2
Reviews.Content: The location is great; not too noisy or touristy, but close to everything. The staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean, and there was a nice view from the balcony. The hotel does not provide irons which seemed to be the case in most of thesmaller hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinDCambridge
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location, the staff could not be more helpful. arrived very early in the morning and they took care of our luggage and it was already in our room when we returned later in the afternoon. Only thing missing was tea/coffee facilities in the bedrom, but this is comon in many parts of Europe, but as there was no room service it would be a nice touch to have it included.Do not book this hotel if you have difficulty with stairs as in order to enter the hotel you need to walk upstairs to the first floor. All in all a very nice hotel in a good area.

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: weimanj
Reviews.Content: I had booked here based on recommendations from trip advisor. We checked out early although we had to forfeit two nights since they wouldn't give us a refund (not their fault although we would have appreciated the gesture). The location is terrific - off the beaten path, and the bar/restaurant downstairs was wonderful. However, we found the hotel claustrophobic, the ac barely functional, and basically we had the feeling that we were staying in a cave. The breakfast was awful. We are not fancy pretentious people, and thus I am surprised by the great reviews. There are lots of wonderful small hotels all over Venice and it is worth looking a bit harder.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mondave
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and rooms beutifully decorated. Noisy if you want the windows open but windows are double glazed. Hotel is up steep flight of stairs with no lift. Staff very helfpul. Away from the hubub of tourists at St Marco so you get a better idea of the regular Venice. Check your route carefully if walking from the Vaporetti as its easy to get lost (invest in a good street map).

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, comfortable,”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, as well as another couple reserved 2 rooms on the internet and were very happy with the accommodations. They were clean, comfortable, charming, centrallly located, and breakfast was a nice start to the day with yoghurt, cappuccino, coissants, cereal. The rooms were decorated with old world charm and the bathrooms were newly upgraded. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was walking distance to all of Venice. It is easiest to take a water taxi or the walk has many bridges and steps for you to navigate with your luggage. -Great value. Loved Venice and Locanda Sant'Agostin Loretta and Vincent

Reviews.Title: “A very special Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: Finnan3
Reviews.Content: We choose this place through the great reviews from various websites and all were spot on. Staff spoke English well and all were very nice and friendly, breakfast was good and the room was immaculately kept. We will be staying there again and highly recommend to anyone who whats a value stay off the beaten track in Venice. (Travelers note: As Venice is a maze this place in the center can be hard to find first time, even with the maps, check often en-route from train & bus terminals.) A truly great Venice experience in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loction, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: sfnative2UK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin. A true gem of a find in a magical city. The hotel staff was unfailingly pleasant and helpful The rooms were generous and nicely appointed. We had a family room (jr. suite) which sleeps 4 just off the dining room. Due to my scheduling error, we were moved to an apartment around ht ecorner for the last night. This little gem was a 2 br 2 bath flat, right on the canal. If you get a chance to book this, it is fantastic, like having your own little slice of Venice. The true beuty of this hotel is the location. Located in the geographic center of Venice, you are never more than a 10-15 minute walk from anywehere in the city. Further, you are off the beaten path (or at least feels that way) so you never get a sense that you are overrun with tourists. The Taverna da Baffo just downstairs with al fresco seating in the Campo was a delight. A perfect spot for a morning cappuchino, a light antipasti in the afternoon, or drinks in the evening. There was a more substantial menu that we never tried, but it looked good. We were concerned that Venice would be difficult with children, but our kids (9 + 12) raved about "how cool" it was. We never tortured them with Museums, but always found plenty to keep them occupied. A gonddola ride was the highlight for them, as was the water taxi. Of course any city that serves Pizza, pasta and gelato would rank pretty high on their list of activities! We look forward to visiting Locanda Sant' Agostin again!

Reviews.Title: “Venice class and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: mic_bishop
Reviews.Content: Plus - great service, good location Minus - its hard to find the place without a map when you first arrive (but Venice is a maze)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: water_lili_88
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin is not located in the touristy part of Venice but is a easy walking distance to the main areas. However, Venice is a maze and this place is literally right in the middle of the maze. It was really hard to find the place at 7am in the morning - many locals did not seem to speak English when we asked for directions. We took a water taxi to a stop and from then on it was 5-10 minute walk navigating the lane ways. A map is definitely necessary. We booked the apart hotel (it is actually about 100m away down the road in a different place from the hotel - so may not be convenient to walk back for breakfast), I suspect they double booked us so we stayed in a suite instead. The suites are pretty good, they contain a double bed with ensuite. Only complaint is that the hotel has no internet (apparently there is a place with internet 5 minutes away) and the only English channel, BBC, had no sound! Otherwise, the room was good value for Venice and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - good value - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: WanderingAngusEurope
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in Venice at Locanda Sant Agostin which was recommended by a friend. Found staff friendly and very helpful throughout our stay. The small hotel is within walking distance of the rail station. We had a large quiet room with air-conditioning, a particularly comfortable bed and a sparkling bathroom. The coffee and croissants at breakfast were very good. The hotel is close to the Friary which is well worth a visit and a walk along the waterfront in Dorsoduro with a stop at Nico's is a very pleasant thing to do in Venetian sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel with an exellent service”
Reviews.Author: Protravellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located reasonably close to the bus and railway terminal and you can quite easily reach it by walking. If you arrive by bus from the airport, you don't need a water taxi to get there. In the area there are not too many tourist either which means 30-40 percent lower prices than those you will find in restaurants close to Saint Marco. It takes only 15 minutes to walk to San Marco and 7-8 minutes to get to the Rialto bridge. I could also recommend a Vapareto (water bus) ticket to get to the sights in Venice. It will take some time to travel by those, but then can see the city also from the canals. The ticket is not very cheap, but much less expensive than water taxi or gondola and the view is the same or better. By that you visit also other islands like Murano or others. Hotel itself is small and comfortable with an exellent service. You feel there like at home. The staff is able to speak good English and they can give you good recommendations where to go or eat. Rooms are not big, but big enough for spending your few night hours there. The quality of your sleep is also exellent because rooms are very quiet. The variety of breakfast choices is not very wide, but comparing to local standards it is wide. The breakfast room doesn't offer a table for everyone at the same time, if the hotel is fully occupied, but you do not have to wait too long either to find a free seat. On the back side of the hotel the rooms do not offer any window view (there are windows) either, but anyware in Venice you get more to see when staying out from the hotel. The hotel offers a free internet access that is working well in the lobby/breakfast room. All in all this hotel is good choice for people who are looking for a small hotel in Venice with a reasonable price and with an exellent service.

Reviews.Title: “The staff did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: mikanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April with our two sons for a family holiday. Right from the start when we made our reservation the staff at the hotel could not have been more friendly. They even emailed us a detailed map of how to get to the hotel by foot from the bus station when we arrived in Venice. Our quadruple room was probably one of the best in the hotel. It was light and airy with great quality furnishings and also very clean. Every morning we thoroughly enjoyed our continental breakfast which was always served with a smile. The location of the hotel is very central. This was our second visit to Venice and we discovered new places to visit plus some very good restauarants nearby. We spent many relaxing evenings sitting in our favourite local square, drinking Camapri soda's and watching our boy's playing. Whilst we were at the hotel the volcano erupted and our flights were cancelled home. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and we managed to stay there for an extra two days without any problems. Also on the last day we were served breakfast at 6.30 am in the morning before we finally left, which we all really appreciated. Overall this was a very friendly, high quality hotel with exceptional staff. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff, reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Burgundy79
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights. I used the trip advisor reviews as a guide, and I'm glad I did. Brief version: The staff made us feel very welcome and provided lots of recommendations for restaurants and areas to visit. The hotel was clean and elegant with pretty, Venetian style rooms of reasonable size (for Venice). Breakfast was basic continental (croissants, bread rolls, yogurt, cereal and drinks). The location is superb, away from the crowds but close enough to walk to everywhere easily. We found the area and its alleyways more charming than some of the grander sights in Venice! TIP: if you pay in cash you get a significant discount as they prefer to avoid charges (this is similar for many Venetian hotels). More detail: we stayed in room 103/B which is a double room with a small balcony overlooking the square and canal - an enchanting first experience. The room had a wardrobe but no drawers or shelves, so we kept our underwear in our suitcases. On our third day we were moved to a suite (they'd double-booked us). We didn't mind as it was a lovely suite and they didn't charge us extra. This was room 102 (I think) and was large with drawers and shelving. This is a large double room or a room for four at a squeeze. This didn't have a balcony but two windows looking into the alleyway. We met Dario, Manuel and another guy (but we didn't get his name) on reception and each had their own recommendations for Venice. We are glad to have taken up their restaurant recommendations by and large. But we ignored one recommendation not to go to the Castello gardens area (a shabbier but very charming area to the east of St Marks). I don't think our advisor thought it was awful but possibly assumed we only wanted to see the grander sights. We are really glad we wandered to this area, however. We aren't the type of tourists who zone in on the glamorous sights only, and the peaceful walk through the gardens to the imposing Arsenal was a delight on a sunny day. The lady who serves breakfast divided opinion. She is clearly very friendly and encourages you to try out the language, speaking to every guest. It gave me the opportunity to speak Italian (she doesn't seem to speak English, whereas the people on reception do). My partner, however, found it intimidating when she persisted in talking to him in a language he doesn't understand. If you are not a fan of trying out the language, or being chatted to at breakfast - have your breakfast in your room, which is an option. If you don't mind the opportunity to chat to a friendly Italian woman (no matter how bad your Italian is) then here is your chance! Breakfast would have been improved with some fresh fruit and a wider variety of cereals but it was adequate to start us off. The double windows are excellent at shutting out most noise (but this isn't a very noisy area anyway). However, there is a pub underneath one side. This had some sort of event on during our first night and we could hear a vague voice on a microphone. It didn't disturb us as we walked so much that we fell asleep straightaway - and we didn't hear it on subsequent nights, but if you are a light sleeper then you may ask for a room away from this pub. Overall, this is a lovely little hotel and better than many others at such a price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Euro1999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Laconda Sant'Agostin for 3 nights at the end of April. We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. Our double room was compact but I guess that most of them are in Venice. This small hotel is centrally located in San Polo, about a 10-15 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge and water bus stops and about a 20 minute walk from Piazzale Roma (Bus station). The staff were friendly and the continental breakfast was good with as much tea/coffee as you want. We would recommend this hotel if you want a good location, a clean,comfortable room but no extras. You can get a water taxi from the airport for about 120 euros but we went by bus for 3 euros which was no problem. Make sure you have cases with wheels if you are walking and have a map or you will definately get lost. Overall, we had a great time in Venice and I would say April/May is a good time to go to avoid the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and charm abounds....”
Reviews.Author: raccoonhollow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and my teens loved the spacious room full of antiques and charm. The front desk staff were very attentive and Frederico was extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants, concerts, etc. They made us feel welcome and let us know our stay with them was appreciated. I would highly recommend this hotel and next time we're in Venice will definitely stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gemgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Each morning a simple but quite lovely breakfast is served and the front desk staff went out of their way to accommodate us, even calling into town to check on the conditions in St. Marks Square when we were concerned about flooding.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Venice was very romantic”
Reviews.Author: V12TwinTurbo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent part of our honeymoon in Venice. It was the best trip of my entire life! We had been stayed in Locanda Sant'Agostin hotel for 4 days. This is a small hotel great placed (not far from places of interest but in a very quiet place) Hotel is managed by two brothers and they doing their best to do it excellent. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They had done all my special instructions about payment very accurate (I had to pay all money in advance from my card for visa reasons) and they advised me where we can find very tasty ice-cream shop. It was the best ice-cream Iâ€™ve ever eaten! Rooms are very clean, big and comfortable. Hotel offers tasty breakfast. We had been enjoying our staying in Venice and now we often recall our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LindaTKansasCity
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Sant'Agostin was a delight in every way. The hotel is a historic beauty with a pleasant surprise of a large spacious room and bathroom. The location was ideal; situated off a quiet plaza but within easy walking distance to our destinations.The staff was very friendly and helpful; their English speaking skills were somewhat limited but not problematic. Our stay was very pleasant and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Scrumtrulescent”
Reviews.Author: WanderHound
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise Locanda Sant'Agostin enough. The location is perfect - close to everything interesting and yet removed from the crowds of day tourists. The rooms are fresh, clean and quietly elegant. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We had imagined something very basic and found a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Firendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bluehiggy
Reviews.Content: I knew our stay would be great after I booked on their site as I was promptly contacted by the hotel with information and directions. We are a family of 4 and our room was very big by European standards. The staff was friendly and helpful and breakfast was just fine with fresh coffee and hot chocolate for the children. The location was very convenient for us, just around the corner from Campo San Polo which is very central, but not crawling with loud tourists. Even so, the widows had light blocking and ,it seemed, sound blocking shutters on the outside. This was a very good value in Venice which can be so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nelehnna
Reviews.Content: great place in a central area with really helpful staff.clean, friendly, perfect for our stay stay at a really reasonable rate. The staff were really helpful.Can recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Charming”
Reviews.Author: singletraveler123
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Venice, this quaint hotel offers large clean rooms with comfortable beds, a nice breakfast, and a very friendly and helpful staff. I found this hotel to be very affordable and I very much enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime Retreat in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyZagalsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended week in November with my father and sister. We couldn't have had a better experience. The combination of intimate family like atmosphere with superior service makes this place a must stay when traveling to Venice. The location is great for exploring to find friendly hidden local bars and restaurants...not to mention breathtaking backdrops for pictures. The staff is exceptional and I couldn't have started the day without the breakfast service! Superb :) -Courtney

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, covenient location”
Reviews.Author: julia15w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Sant'Agostin on our first trip to Venice. The location was excellent and the staff were keen to recommend restaurants to give us a taste of authentic Venice. The room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. We would recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superbe!”
Reviews.Author: Savonniere
Reviews.Content: Lucky me, a surprise birthday trip to Venise! Hats off to my dear husband for choosing such a perfect hotel. Great location, in a quiet street but just minutes walk from all the sites. The room was very big for a city with so many hotel rooms and the bed as comfortable as home. Continental breakfast copious (compared to what I had heard at other hotels) and served by a lovely lady who was always willing to top up my cappucino! Don't forget to ask frederico or eduardo to direct you to the great coffee Bottega Del CaffÃ© for their delicious and very inexpensive coffee's! Hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located; quiet, comfortable, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: bolt51
Reviews.Content: I am a 54 year man. I took my adult daughters to Venice for a belated college graduation present. The three of us stayed in one room with three single beds and one bath. We were quite comfortable spending 9 days in this small and cozy hotel. The entire staff appears to be about 4 people---all polite, kind, warm, and accomodating. They offered unlimited assistance with our every question and need. We It is located in the center of Venice, affording easy access to the entire island. Our room was clean, comfortable, and surprisingly QUIET. I slept with the window over my head open every night, and was NEVER disturbed by noise. They offer a superior continental breakfast each morning with espresso made to orderl, fresh croissants, butter and jam. Yes, I highly recommend this hotel to those who are looking for a convenient location to see Venice. This suited our requirements perfectly, as we were not interested in peripheral amenities, rather, a quiet location from which to set out each day and see Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lovely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: David123657
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in November and had a wonderful time. The hotel is lovely and so are the staff who made our stay truly memorable. We'll definitely be back in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “really friendly helpful staff, room was gorgeous and location brilliant”
Reviews.Author: inl0veinItaly
Reviews.Content: Cann't wait to go back, the hotel was within walking distance of so many of the attractions, the restuarants recommend by the staff were great, basic breakfast, our last morning we left before seven before breakfast began but the staff got us a breakfast anyway,much apprectiated

Reviews.Title: “a nice short trip to venice”
Reviews.Author: Duffi66
Reviews.Content: a nice hotel in a wonderful town - we come back - in two or three years

Reviews.Title: “Traveler friendly and great Location”
Reviews.Author: kwpinky22
Reviews.Content: First, the 24 hr desk staff who spoke fluent English were extremely friendly and helpful. There were many sight seeing and event services they had to offer. The rooms though slightly smaller than expected were very clean and comfortable. We will sum it up as a boutique size hotel with an old world charm. The location was a big factor in choosing this hotel. It is only a few mintues walk to and from the Piazzale Roma and the S. Lucia train station. The Rialto bridge that leads to Pza. S. Marcos is also walking distance . There is a choice of vaporetti stations at S. Stae, S. Sivestro, and S. Toma. The neighbourhood was our favorite. Right outside the door are numerous eatries and local stores.The nereby Campo S. Polo is one where the locals and visitors alike hang out in the evenings..with Tango dancing on Tuesday nights. Very charming and heart warming. Overall a great Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel off the beaten path!”
Reviews.Author: Coco26Ottawa
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely fabulous hotel. The rooms and staff were great. It's not in the heart of all of the crowds but yet a short walk to all of the main attractions. I especially loved it because it was in a more residential area and I loved seeing how people live in Venice and carried on their daily activities. And it was only about a 5 min walk to the Rialto bridge and maybe 15 min to St Marks Square. Getting back took me a little longer as I get lost, but where else would you rather be lost than in Venice. I had an amazing stay!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Harry924
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Sant' Agostin is a charming small hotel tucked away in a quiet part of Venice away from the maddening crowds of St. Mark's square. Still, the major tourist sights are easily accessible by water bus from the nearby vaporetto stops. Rooms are clean and well appointed, although relatively compact, as space is obviously at a premium in Venice. The hotel is located in an old building and has only a few rooms. (The lobby is on the second floor and reached by a staircase from the street.) They had obviously been recently redone. The furniture was old style, contributing to the palace-like style. The bathroom was more than adequate, but not spacious, with a large shower that drained well. (This can be a problem in hotels in converted old buildings.) The included breakfast buffet was plentiful, with breads, spreads, juices, and cereals. Coffee and cappucino were delivered freshly made and hot by a friendly lady who spoke little English but bubbled with enthusiasm at our feeble attempts to speak Italian. The reception staff was friendly and accommodating. When we arrived, having dragged our luggage across several bridges from the Piazzale Roma, the night clerk insisted on helping us carry our bags up the stairs to the reception. The day clerk was very helpful in providing restaurant recommendations and directions. Both spoke excellent English. The hotel staff was most accommodating, providing a tablecloth when we spread out wine and cheese in the lobby, and ordering a water taxi to take us to the airport at 4:00 AM on the day we departed. The hotel is located just by a landing stage, making it very convenient to reach by water taxi. On foot, it is a bit more difficult to reach with luggage, but the hotel provided us with an excellent map and directions which took us there without any difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: noddy91
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice with two children - this hotel was one of only a small number who take 4 people per room however we also were swayed by the good reviews. We really enjoyed our stay - friendly people, nothing too much to ask, warm and friendly service at breakfast and very child friendly. We would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: CestrianCouple
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend and it exceeded our expectations. Very friendly and helpful staff particularly Eugenia and Emanuele. Photos on the website give an accurate picture of what to expect and we were not disappointed. Would rate everything and everyone excellent and would go again. We would now recommend Locanda Sant Agostin to our friends and family. Thank you for making our first visit to Venice a memorable one. Also recommend the local bar and pizza restaurant we found near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, value for money, very comfortable and accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: Anon09London
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted a plush hotel, close proximity to the main attractions and with a canal view, Locanda Sant' Agostin provided all of this at such a reasonable price. I had looked at so many hotels before booking but this offered by far the best value for money, especially as we were able to get a balcony with a view of a small sqaure and a canal for the same price most other hotels offer for no view. The staff could not have been more helpful and so friendly. Nothing was too much and as we were new to Venice they were wlling to spend the time with us, showing us on a map the best places to eat, drink and the must see areas. It really did seem like a family run hotel and that they cared, shown in the great service. The room was exactly how it looks in the pictures! The bathroom looked newly refurbished and everything was so clean. The mini-bar offered drinks at the price you would buy them in the shop which we were also impressed by. Location was excellent. After a wonderful three nights stay, we did not want to leave. We would recommend this to anyone and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: VickiWestervilleOhio
Reviews.Content: Located in the center of Venice, it was easy to walk everywhere. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, fantastic staff, an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: Myfti
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Locanda. We payed a little more than our normal budget, but the place was so worth it! The staff were friendly but with an old style sense of professionalism and service, and some great advice thrown in! In late August the air conditioning was a life-saver!! Also a top class breakfast, served with flair by a waitress with a keen sense of humour...all in Italian of course! Our room was spacious and clean with a great bathroom, and in late August the air conditioning was a life-saver!! An all-around great place. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Very Helpful Staff; Use Their Expertise to Plan Your Day”
Reviews.Author: Deb_Mich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at Locanda Sant' Agostin after getting off our Azamara Cruise ship in Venice. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The included breakfast is good; typically European. Croissants, french bread, yogurt, jams, butter, bland cereal, good, fresh juices. Delicious coffee made to order. All the staff at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. They know the city well and can offer you tips on how to get to places and when to visit what can be very crowded sites. Venice is a maze and Locanda is not so easy to find as it is very near a lesser "campo" but once you learn what well known "campos" are nearby, you can figure out how to get out and back. Easy walks to the Rialto Bridge and the Piazza Le Roma (the bus station). Bring or download a good detailed map; it's worth it. Two things Italy still doesn't offer with a room -- kleenex or wash cloths -- bring your own if you can't live without 'em.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot understand the rave reviews. It's very misleading.”
Reviews.Author: muncherama
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this "hotel" for 3 nights. It was a dissapointment. First of all, it's not clean. The very first step in the bathroom and I found hair over the sink and tub. Very sloppy cleaning. Second, they ddin't even bother to buy new pillow cases and towels since there were holes in them. The bed was uncomfortable. Cheap mattresses. The view room does not deserve the money we paid for. The air conditioning was hardly working. The breakfast was very skimpy. The only positive thing I could say about this place is that the staff are nice and helpful. Overall, this place is totally overrated. Not impressed. I truely think that this hotel needs some work. At least, spend a couple dollars to buy some new towels and pillow cases.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet residential area but close enough to main tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: petefitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this lovely hotel. Nice quiet part of Venice but only 10 minutes walk to Rialto and another 5 minutes to St Marks Square. Hotel staff very friendly and informative. Rooms nice and spacious, nice bathroom, breakfast is basic. Be warned if staying less than 3 nights you must pay by cash, no credit card accepted, which is a bit of a drawback. Some restaurants only accept cash also. A useful tip to remember is that each building has a unique number, this hotel is something like 2305, so it is easier to find the hotel by following house numbers rather than looking up street names. For Gondola trips I think the last night trips head out at about 9 o'clock. Burano island is well worth the trip and St Marks Square is fabulous. Its probably quicker and more enjoyable to walk to the Rialto area, St Marks Square etc. from the hotel rather than get on the water bus which can be quie crammed.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: paulde
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 5 nights and wasn't disappointed with my choice. As others have said, its in a non-touristy residential area but close to everything you'd want to see, and the area itself has a plethora of good bars, cafes and restaurants. Its very close to the Pizzale Roma - just 15 minutes walk (assuming you can navigate the labyrinth - the hotel sends you an excellent map if you book directly), and I was very surprised about others' tales of the 'long' flight of stairs - in fact there are no more than about 15-20 steps up to the hotel - not Kilimanjaro I assure you. Staff are brimming over with friendliness. Our rooms was small but clean and comfortable - though the double bed we were served up with was one of those twins pushed together jobs which i loathe - and there doesn't seem to be any hurry to clean the rooms early in the morning which I like. No problems with internet access (no storms when we were there) - they charge a nominal 5 Euro but there's nothing silly like charging by the hour or anything. I love Venice, and will certainly be returning to this little place when i'm back.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler132
Reviews.Content: For any age, college, mid, to the elderly, traveling with a significant other, this is a perfect hotel for you. It is a very reasonably priced hotel with a lovely staff, comfortable, clean beds (which is MOST IMPORTANT to me), clean bathrooms, bedrooms, and breakfast/reception room. I spent hours researching hotels for my trip through Europe and actually stayed at two hotels while in Venice and found the Locanda Sant'Agostin Hotel most accommodating, comfortable, Venetian, and pleasant. I kid you not, stop searching for other hotels! This hotel has I think 10 rooms. But they are all extremely well kept and beautiful. The Hotel is centrally located, a close walk to all of the touristy spots in Venice, but I found it most pleasant to be able to stray away from the mass crowds when returning to Locanda Sant'Agostin during the day and at nighttime. There are great restaurants all around the hotel. Stay here and you'll love it. I am only writing this review, because I enjoyed my stay that much

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no tourists around, and close to the city-center”
Reviews.Author: Prigunther
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was close to the center, but without this tourists-frenzy. was not the cheapest one, but for what we payed was pretty good!! Best deals on the hotel website. Small Hotel in an classic stile.

Reviews.Title: “great apartment - poor air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: FVILL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the apartment at the Locanda Sant Agostin from July 17-19. The apartment is wonderful, trly roomy and well appointed. It is down an alley from the main hotel but that is not a problem. The two problems we had were a) it was very hot on July 17 and the air conditioing unit - one small one for the entire apartment was not sufficient to really cool down the apartment fully. b) We over packed and found that in Venice you have to carry your bags - no way to economically get to the hotel except by walking - carrying the bags over 4 little bridges really tired my wife and I out. So, in conclusion the Locanda is a very nice hotel, just don't bring many heavy bags and hopefully you won't get a very hot day (the other days were fine) One last point the staff is very helpful, giving great suggestions. The breakfast is very ordinary. All in all the hotel is well worth the money. Definitely would go back

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Blb66
Reviews.Content: I would highly recomend this hotel to everyone. On our first night, we were up graded to the apartment as we waited on a room with a balcony to become available for our next two nights. Very cool. Highly recommend for a family or group of friends. The desk staff was always more than helpful with directions and recommendations. They also booked us on a wine tour that was really great. The location is prime as it is a short and beautiful walk to everything yet a quiet and still eventful area in the evening. As well, the simple continental breakfast was perfect to start our mornings...save money and still have pleanty of room for lunch! Thank you so much to all the staff who helped make our stay wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Third time at this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dottieD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before with my husband but returned with my mum, auntie and cousin in celebration of mum's 80th birthday. We chose the appartment as it had two bedrooms and two bathrooms plus a lounge where we could all sit together. The appartment is just around the corner from the hotel and breakfast was included in the rate. Although the appartment has a large kitchen with dining table, you cannot use it to cook or make hot drinks but it would be fine for a take-away pizza! We all had a lovely time - the staff were excellent as usual, especially Emmanuele and Eugenie who made Mum feel very special on her big day. They recommended restaurants and places to see. In my opinion the hotel is in a super location, just away from the madding crowds and it was lovely to return to the area in the evening and enjoy a drink and a meal in a relatively quiet area of Venice. We were there for 3 nights and I would recommend the Venice Connect card 72 hour pass which gives you use of the vaporetto for the 3 days. You get a discount if you book up on line at least a week before you travel. I would definately return here on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great base in "real" Venice”
Reviews.Author: Maclaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days as the second part of our 6 day trip to Verona/Venice. We travelled from Verona to Venice by train and my plan was to walk to the hotel with our cases.i had a map but it was'nt the best and we had quite a hot sweaty journey trying to find the place despite my pre planning. We eventually found it ok but my advice would be get a detailed street map as opposed to the online ones which are not so good once you're there. In reality, it is ten minutes walk from the station as opposed to our half hour getting lost three times.. You could try a water taxi however they are very expensive and the vaporetto only travels the main waterways. Anyway, none of these issues are the hotels fault. The Locanda Sant' Agostin is a lovely hotel with some of the most courteous staff i have found on my travels. The rooms are very tastefully decorated and everyone seemed dedicated to making our stay an enjoyable one. The hotel is a little away from the main tourist haunts such as St Marks however once you find your way around (which happens very quickly) you reaise you are only ten minutes from the rialto bridge. You also have the advantage of being in a place wgere you can explore a little and find new squares and restaurants. As our friend at reception said " Once you stop seeing the Mask shops you know you are beginning to find the real Venice". If you want a big posh hotel on the grand canal then that's fine and we have done that previously, however this is something different. The breakfast was basic yet good and the Hotel in my opinion cannot be faulted. This is our second trip to Venice and due partly to this Hotel and it's location we felt just a little less like tourists and more like...we were home.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, qaint, and charming!”
Reviews.Author: katgaskins
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and spoke good English. Very conveniently located-close to the train station, shops, resturaunts, and major sights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It felt more like a bed and breakfast, with more privacy. Breakfast was good, and the croissants were amazing! We would definately stay here again, upon returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A true Italian Experience”
Reviews.Author: Loverofsunsets
Reviews.Content: My girls and I tend to shy away from staying at more "touristy" hotels and try to find hotels that are away from the beaten path and represent the essence of the country we are visiting. We were very pleased with our stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin in Venice. It is a very small hotel that was once the home of a Duke that has been kept up quite well. The continental breakfast was consistantly good (everything was very fresh) The staff was incredible! One of the gentlemen at the desk went out of his way to help find the best and most reliable way to get us from their hotel to the airport on an early Sunday morning. A wonderful woman got up at 4:00 am to make sure we were up and to see if we wanted any coffee, etc. She even helped me get my heavy luggage down the stairs to the front entrance. She is the same woman that gave us towels to wash our faces when we first arrived, bag and baggage in hand ,on a very warm day. We felt like we were extended family which is a nice thing when in a foreign country. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & warm atomosphere”
Reviews.Author: AnneMarieIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Locanda Sant'Agostin for 3 nights, found the staff very pleasent, friendly and welcoming. Very helpful in recommending places to see and eat. Rooms were very clean and exceptional good value, particularly the apartments. Enjoyable breakfast, always served with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMontreal55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the train station and right next door to an excellent pizzeria. The room was luxurious, big bed, lots of space in the bathroom (shower only). The staff is extremely friendly and helpful (they had an adaptor on hand for our flat iron). Loved the intimate setting. There are only two small things that I felt could use some improving (neither affected our stay)...the hair dryer setup is slightly awkward...and they had no decaffeinated coffee. As I said, neither were major issues and I still feel that if ever I go back to Venice...this is where I will stay. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for discovering Venice”
Reviews.Author: zambullida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located but still far enough from the crowd and calm. It needs some minutes of walk from the next boat stop. It is an excellent location for some days of discovering Venice. The Hotel is located on a first floor - unimpressive from outside - nevertheless it is a pleasant place with shops, bars and restaurants nearby. The staff is very attentive and helpful. Rooms are in a Venetian style, some of them with canal view, with nice bathroom, very clean. We very much enjoyed our stay and will surely come back!

Reviews.Title: “'Quaint' hotel for Venice”
Reviews.Author: JulieNorwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. The rooms are basic but nice and clean, although very dark and gloomy due to hotel's position in narrow Venice streets! It could be described as periodical and elegant. Beware, there is a steep flight of stairs on arrival to negotiate with your suitcase! The breakfasts were extremely bad - situated in the reception area which felt odd - and the food was less than basic with just cheap version cornflakes, burnt criossants and tinned orange juice. There was no fruit at all but the cappuccinos were good. As a base to stay when sightseeing it is perfectly fine. However, personally I wouldn't stay there again as it was too dark and gloomy - I would choose one of the hotels overlooking the Grand Canal which appeared lighter and brighter with terraces to sit for a drink. Warning - take an umbrella as it poured with rain both evenings from 8pm!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gen001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in more of a residential area so it is reasonably priced and you donâ€™t pay the high prices at nearby bars/restaurants for food/drinks like you would in San Marco. It is easy to get around and very central, approx 10 mins walk to the ferry or 15mins walk to San Marco. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodated any requirements. The room was in excellent condition with traditional decor and the bathroom was very clean. I will be staying at this hotel in future when I visit Venice and I could thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly and great value!”
Reviews.Author: StockholmSussie
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel for a weekend, to celebrate our 1 year Wedding anniversery. It has an axcellent location, right in the centre but is still very quiet. The rooms are very beautiful with really comfortable and royalty like beds and very clean and exclusive bathrooms. The breakfast was nothing fancy but just enough and tasted very good - and it was very nice to be able to get in your room. :) And the owners and staff were very nice, friendly and helpful in all possible ways. Thank you so much for all your help and friendliness! If we will come back to Venice we look forward to staying at your hotel again! :) //Suzan and Mikael Westrup

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: JNBEastCoast
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin was a great find in Venice. We chose it based on past reviews here at Trip Advisor. It was in a quiet, yet convenient location. There were nearby restaurants, cafes, and shops. The staff was extremely friendly and offered recommendations for places to eat and good directions. The bed was very comfortable, which was really appreciated, and the room was very clean and did not smell like cleaning products, as many hotels do. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and will recommend this place to friends travelling to Venice. The good price made this even a better find. Grazie !!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful B&B in a great location for central Venice”
Reviews.Author: KateG09
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin is an ideal B&B for a few days in Venice. Our room was spacious, tastefully furnished and well equipped with a delightful view of a tiny canal and not one but two bridges. it was 10 mins from the Rialto bridge, easy to reach on foot from the station yet not in a busy or noisy location. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly Reception staff who really made our stay special by advising and making reservations for us. We'll definitely be back and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: balog_r_gy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay in Venice. Situated in an excellent area of Venice it is close to all the main attractions. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The apartment, were we stayed, is quiet, and thereâ€™s a beautiful view over a canal. This apartment provided for us an extra feeling; we stayed there like the Venetian and not like the tourists, because the apartment is not in the hotel, it is in the near tight street. Next time, we will stay again in this hotel, in this apartment. And we highly recommend the Locanda Santâ€™ Agostin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel a few but important steps away from the death row of Venezia”
Reviews.Author: lkpCph
Reviews.Content: A nice and friendly atmosphere. Everyone were very helpful in helping us with arrangement of a water taxi pickup early Sunday morning. It is located so you can easily (< 5 min) reach the places where the Venezians go out. I am sure that we will consider this place, the next time we go to Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the tourist zone”
Reviews.Author: milikkelbutmitaliwah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during the last leg of our honeymoon trip. It was a very well run, friendly, clean hotel in the San Polo area. This is a more residential area that is very close walking distance to the Ponte di Rialto, and many other amazing restaurants and bars. While here, we spent our days exploring the San Marco area (where most of the tourist sites are at) and our nights relaxing and enjoying the nightlife with the locals. Everyone who worked the front desk at this hotel was extremely friendly and helpful (they gave us suggestions to restaurants, bars, sites, and directions to the bus terminal). They really went above and beyond. The rooms were extremely spacious and clean. We even had a couch in our room! Overall, this was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know Venice had bargains like this!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyA
Reviews.Content: Spotless rooms. great shower, friendly and helpful employees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and perfect for a stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AlexWivenhoe
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on the internet and based on previous reviews booked a room. The hotel was better than expected and perfect for our stay. It is situated in a quiet residential area but close to several very good restaurants and five minutes walk from San Stae waterbus stop. The Rialto Bridge was a 15 minute walk with St Marks Square about 20 minutes. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. The room was excellent - large, comfortable bed, pleasant bathroom and styled in classic venetian way. Breakfast simple and straight forward and served with a smile. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Venice without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and feel like a Venetian”
Reviews.Author: MagdolnaandLaszlo
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us exactly what we expected from a hotel of a Venice trip. Good location in a narrow street with a view on a canal and a palazzo. Spacious and stylish room with a balcony. The absolutely soundproof window and the high quality mattress of the huge bed garantie the undisturbed sleep. The breakfast is Italian style: sweet and simple. The staff is excellent: kind and helpful. Ask them if you want to go to the undiscovered parts of the city, to a tipical Venetian restaurant or to a wonderful concert in one of the old chapels of Venice. If you want to feel like a stranger from abroad and you are satisfied with a correct, but unpersonal service and do not want to get anything else, but only what you paid for, then go to a big hotel and spend your time with people who think on the same way. But if you want to forget where you come from and feel like a Venetian for a couple of days, then this is the place for you. Thank you Locanda Sant'Agostin, thank you Eugenia, Emanuele, Leonardo and Federico. Magdolna and Laszlo from Hungary

Reviews.Title: “Charming place, brilliant staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: ADandKD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Sant Agostin between the 12th and 15th April and found it a charming place. As with all our holidays, we did extensive research prior to booking and were almost put off by the one bad review the hotel received but we're really glad we weren't, as it was fantastic. Our room was clean, comfortable, tastefully decorated and adequately sized, not huge but then we weren't intending to spend a lot of time in the room anyway. The bathroom was spacious with a great shower, much better than the dribble you get in some hotels. The free room safe was also an unexpected bonus. The staff are brilliant, all the people on reception gave useful help and advice and the breakfast lady, Eugenia was wonderful and made breakfast a little bit special. Although she can't speak any English (then why should she, we were in Italy after all) she manages to communicate brilliantly and is very attentive, constantly topping up the supply of croissants, bread rolls, jams, yoghurts and cereal and checking if you require another drink. The location is ideal, far enough away from the crowds of tourists to be quite quiet yet only 10 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge and about 15 minutes to St Markâ€™s Square. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops close by and the area is mainly used by locals, rather than tourists, so you get a picture of modern Venetian life, which was great. When we go back to Venice, we'll stay at the Locanda Sant Agostin. Why would we want to go anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, very friendly and helpful staff, will come again!”
Reviews.Author: new_md
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend a few days in Venice before embarking in a cruise to Greece. I did a lot of research and spent time reading reviews placed by others... I came accross Locanda Sant Agositn and despite 1 bad review (unfair in my opinion) did realize that most people said very good things about this place, It is a lovely place! There are several things I could mention, but I'll summarize a few: 1. Service: outstanding, all the reception guys were always nice and helpful.... but most importantly I have to thank Eugenia, the lovely lady who serves breakfast... she was so nice and polite, poor thing she tries to communicate very hard with non-italian speaking tourists but she doesn't know other languages... she speaks her native language but somehow you can see in her eyes that she means to help and to be nice... I happened to have my b-day one of the days I was there. She found out (I guess my wife had something to do with it, although she wouldn't admit) but the point is, Eugenia brought to our room a nice breakfast with cute arrangements and 2 bullinis to celebrate. She didn't have to do that, a happy b-day would 've been enough... It's just that kind of place... 2. Location: Away from major touristic paths, it is literally 15 min away from Piazza San Marco and 10 min from Rialto. You feel you are one of the locals, the stores and restaurants nearby are mainly frequented by Venetians and not by many tourists. To me this was great. I felt I could experience the true life of Venetians while at the same time I was just a few min away from the major touristic areas. We loved it... 3. Comfort: The room we stayed in had a nice view of a small venetian cannal (I have posted a few pics). The room is adequate, slightly small but very comfortable. After all I did not go to Venice to spend my time in a hotel room. Having said that the bed was nice and comfortable (queen size). There is climate control, a small tv and a comfortable bathroom with a nice shower. I read other reviews and comments regarding noise but to be honest my room was extremely quiet to a point that I thought we were the only guests in the hotel. What a surprise when I found out that it was actually packed... we didn't hear a single 'peep'. Not even from the busy street and cannal underneath us... 4. Food: The hotel does not have a restaurant although there is a great place next door. It's a small pizzeria, but by far one of the best in town (according to some locals)... We ate there once, it was very very good... Now if you are looking for a fancy dinner, Venice has plenty of places to try. I WOULD NOT recommend a place suggested by the staff called Vivaldi... it was TERRIBLE, again, I am honest, the place was dirty (flies all over) and despite being the ONLY clients there, we had terribloe service and the food sucked!, too bad we had to pay close to 60 euros for a terrible experience... In summary I have to say Locanda Sant Agostin is a great place to stay. I would definetely come back. The service was outstanding and the price is just right. Thank you Eugenia, you are great...

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: L8Dublin
Reviews.Content: Locanda San Agostin is the most charming hotel; it is all about service and making sure the guests are comfortable. The staff are so helpful and so pleasant. We stayed in the apt nearby and found it spacious and clean, and it gave us a flavour of how Venetians live. The hotel is away from the main tourist drag but it is still in a great location, not far from the water-ferry station and Rialto,and quite close to a couple of great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice, I&J”
Reviews.Author: Medolina
Reviews.Content: Very nice and kind staff, spacious room, good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Keycom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Friday to Monday March 20th to 23rd. Sorry to say it was DISAPPOINTING. Firstly, this place is NOT A HOTEL. Laconda means Inn in Italian, and this is more B&B than an inn. No facilities to speak of, you eat 'breakfast' in the reception area, the ROOMS (we had a 'superior') are EXTREMELY SMALL as are the bathrooms. The photographs on the website are misleading. Our room had a balcony 'with a canal view'. On the website it looks as if two people could sit comfortably on it. It was tiny, no way you could fit a table and chair (as per website) and the canal was off to the right. All credit to the photograher, he worked miracles with a fish-eye lense and creative angles!! We did not get to the hotel until around 9.30. Restaurants in Venice tend to close at 10.00pm & we had enquired as to a good local restaurant that would suffice the first night. Emanuele at reception had given us the name of a local pizzeria / pasta restaurant by email & said that it was very close. When we checked in the woman at reception, who also served the extremely limited 'breakfast', refused point blank to direct us to the restaurant. We had been travelling all day, were very tired and hungry and simply wanted to eat and have a glass of wine. Shouldn't be that difficult? She babbled at us in Italian and sent us on a wild goose chase to some place she said was "better for tourists." Luckily we gave up as it was getting close to 10.00 & found our way back to the hotel. There was a small local restaurant right next door, not the right one admittedly, but it did us fine. Breakfast is only served for 1 hour 15 mins and is a dreadful affair. If you like small croissants, packets of industrial jam, and coffee from a machine then this is for you. Again the reality is that this place should not refer to itself as a hotel. The woman from the previous evening serves the coffee and (just what you need first thing in the morning) delights in humiliating, shouting and laughing at non-fluent Italian speakers. It gets really, really wearing after day one. She thinks she's hilarious. There is nowhere to sit and relax, no facilities, no atmosphere. To be fair Emanuele on reception is a helpful guy. Having said that we said we were not happy and nothing was done. Something else you really need to be aware of, THEY WANT PAYMENT IN CASH. Draw your own conclusions about that one. They say they'll do a special deal if you'll pay this way. The limit for cash withdrawals in Italy is 250 euros per day. We don't travel with lots of cash, who does these days? When I went to pay the bill by credit card as previously agreed the other guy on reception really was not happy. We asked to see a standard room as well as we wanted to compare, but he simply showed us another room exactly the same as the one we had. His answer was "all hotel rooms in Venice are small". Not only are the rooms in this place tiny, but the one we had was simply half of what had been a bigger room that had been partitioned off with plasterboard. We could hear everything, toilets etc, next door and from the room above. A very poor standard and not what we expected nor paid for. This place would be ok if it did not try to pass itself off as something it isn't. Something else too, they give a feedback form and if you were satisfied with your stay they email you to ask for a favourable Trip Advisor review. We found the hotel through Trip Advisor and will never book a hotel on that basis again. Anyone can put up a review. Basically we said on day one we were not happy, nothing was done. We said on day two we still were not happy, nothing was done. When we checked out we said it again, and when we got home we emailed them and yes, you've guessed it - nothing was done. Do yourself and your partner a favour, Venice is full of great hotels. Don't be fooled by the tiny amount you are saving by staying here. BOOK A REAL HOTEL INSTEAD, YOU WON'T REGRET IT. I've checked prices and you can get a 4 or 5 Star Hotel close to the Campo di San Marco or Rialto Bridge for the same or less with all the facilities you would expect. The reviews on Trip Advisor and the 'hotel' website just don't stack up. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rudders71
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here for 4 nights and the hotel is lovely, the room was large, comfy beds and a great shower! It is situated in a lovely quiet area away from the main drags however Pizzale Roma and Ferrovia are only about 7 minutes away, Rialto no more than ten and on the Dorsoduro side there is many more squares to sit in and watch the world go by; have lunch, etc at a much better rate. This hotel is functional, clen and the information from the staff is spot on and they are all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel with gracious receptionists”
Reviews.Author: jenny24luxembourg
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Locanda Sant Agostin and very much liked the area of Venice in which it is situated. We were upgraded to a lovely apartment on our arrival, which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great rooms, fine location”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaCanadaGoose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Locanda Sant'Agostin with my 89 year old mother in a room for three and we were very happy with every aspect of our stay. Our daughter and her husband and baby son also stayed in this hotel as well as our son and his girlfriend. It was a great time for all of us. The staff was very attentive and helpful and my husband enjoyed several cups of coffee supplied by the very courteous breakfast lady before anyone else was up. We liked the location in the more residential area of Venice and were more than happy with the restaurant recommendations made by Emanuele. We will stay here again and recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: sgm393
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment next to the hotel which was spacious, comfortable and clean and a great price for Venice. Breakfast next door at the hotel was lovely and the breakfast lady is very warm and friendly. The staff at reception could not have been more helpful, booking us tickets to a concert, recommending places to visit and restaurants to eat. Would definitely come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Allways a pleasure !”
Reviews.Author: LeVenitien
Reviews.Content: Jean-FranÃ§ois July 2008 Since two years we are going to this hotel and it's allways a real pleasure to stay there several days. The reception is very pleasant, smiling, in English or in Italian. All the family works for the wellbeing of the customers. The receptionist helps us to find addresses or to hold visits. We appreciate the copious continental breakfast, and the cappuccino is great ! The rooms are spacious and calm. The bathroom is very clean. Moreover this hotel is well located for all the visits. In short, a very positive quality-price ratio. And we are happy to go back there this year once again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: krca
Reviews.Content: It is the nice hotel with very warm and pleasant staff. The location is in the center of Venice and you can easy reach any part of town. Four beds suit is fine accommodation for a family. The reception desk works 24 hours a day and main entrance is locked after 23:30 (you can enter the hotel with your key or you can ring to receptionist). Early in the morning fine smell of Italian baked goods prepared for breakfast will wake up you in the beds :).

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Xerxes1_9
Reviews.Content: Another lovely , peaceful stay at our favourite Venice hideaway. As usual a warm welcome from everyone, comfortable and beautifully appointed room , the perfect situation to explore real non touristy Venice,near cafes ,bars, trattoria etc. Nowhere is far in Venice and in this little corner you really do feel special. Venice just before Christmas is a wonderful place and a really relaxing experience before the much noisier and more commercial Christmas in the U.K. Thanks again, we'll be back! Alan and Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Venice and The Locanda: a perfect match”
Reviews.Author: AMBinkom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay in Venice. For the fourth time we stayed at the Locanda and once more we enjoyed every minute of it. If you are looking for a quiet, well located, charming little place where you feel immediately at home, you found the right spot. Once you pass through the door a warm welcome awaits you. In search of a map, directions to historical places, restaurants or an advise whatsoever? Just ask, the staff will be more than happy to help you. The rooms are beautifully decorated Venetian style. We already stayed in three different rooms. All of them are very clean, of a good size, well appointed with a comfortable bathroom. Of course the rooms on the front with lateral view on the little canal just have that little extra. Some rooms look out onto a wall or the windows of the neighbours in front, but as the streets in Venice are very narrow that seems rather logical and inevitable. For Italian standards the breakfast choice is quite elaborate and served by a very friendly, good humoured Italian lady. An enjoyable way to start the day. So if you appreciate personal attention and care, enjoy true Italian atmosphere and approach you will love the Locanda and ... you will keep going back! Leonardo and Federico, see you next time!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Venice, and Locanda Sant'Agostin is part of the reason...”
Reviews.Author: SGill1125
Reviews.Content: This is an adorable, cozy hotel in a fantastic part of Venice. We just spent a week in Italy (2 nights each Rome, Florence, Venice), followed by a week in Paris, France. Venice was BY FAR our favorite city, and our choice of hotel had a lot to do with that. The staff was very kind and accommodating, our room was gorgeous, and much bigger than any of the rooms we stayed at in the other cities (and not any more expensive). I can not speak about the room temperature as the general climate was cool and rainy while we were there, so we had absolutely no complaints. But I will say that we got the impression that the staff would help us in whatever way they could if we only asked. We had room 103B and it was beautifully appointed, with a large comfortable bed, lovely Murano glass chandelier, a more than adequate bathroom (not fancy but certainly clean and modern) and a balcony that opened onto a small square and canal. If there were one thing I would change, and I find this rather minor, I would wish for more variety in the breakfast choices, or for the option to have the cost of breakfast deducted if we choose not to eat there. There is so much delicious food in Venice, I hated to waste a meal on mediocre choices for breakfast. Make no mistake, the food is fresh and plentiful...but not too exciting. That would be my only mildly negative comment and it will NOT keep us away in the future. The neighborhood is charming, quiet and out of the way of the real bustle over by St. Marks Square, and the hotel is very easy to find. We walked ALL OVER Venice and didn't see another location we would have preferred to stay in more, although the island itself is amazing and we can't wait to visit again, for a longer period. My husband and I both agree that when we do return, we will stay at the Locanda if at all possible. Special thanks to Emanuele for his assistance in helping us make sure our flight was on time before we left the hotel (if you ever do come to NYC, email us so we can show you around!). I do have some photos of the hotel and our trip. If possible I will try to post them later (I don't have them with me right now). I can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kffm
Reviews.Content: It's extra localisation Very nice room. Very clean. Exelent staff, espacialy Breakfest Lady

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel hidden amongst the Canals!”
Reviews.Author: ISandMP
Reviews.Content: After a very long and tiring trip, my eight year old daughter and I were very relieved to find the Loconda Sant'Agostin ready & waiting. The staff were at all times courteous, helpful and very well presented. The breakfast Lady deserves a special mention, always jovial and merry! The hotel is pleasantly situated in a quiet residential area with good access to all the major tourist spots. Rooms are spotless and adequate. We had a five night stay and absolutely enjoyed our time at this hotel and overwhelmed by the delights of Venice! What a wonderful experience my daughter and I shared together!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but not that great”
Reviews.Author: travelerRegina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night at the end of October. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the bus or train station and the hotel will provide you a map with the route marked. The triple room we booked was very basic, and the breakfast was fine but is only available for 1.5 hr each morning. We also felt that the hotel staff were snooty, and the hotel has a lot of rules posted in the room that you are not alowed to put you luggage on the bed, you can't eat/drink anything in the room/lobby, you can't wash anything in the sink, you have to dress properly at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, loved the location, room and staff.”
Reviews.Author: henrydog02
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 days at this hotel toward the end of a 3 week European vacation, and would definately stay here again. The location was ideal in a quiet residential neighborhood, but within walking distance to many restaurants, stores and sights and 5 minutes to the nearest vaparetto stop. After being out amidst the crowds in Venice all day it was always pleasant to come back and relax in the quiet of the hotel. The room was spacious, very clean and well appointed. The staff were amongst the most helpful and welcoming we experienced in our 3 weeks in Europe (especially the breakfast lady!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jps860
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the reccomendation of a friend. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome. The staff were excellent and the room was beautiful. help was given to find restaurants and places of interest. In all I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants a good introduction to Venice. Thankyou to all at the hotel who made our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family room”
Reviews.Author: Jessie059
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because the service was so friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean, and the family room was large and comfortable. We travelled with two small children aged 8 and 6 years for five weeks in Europe and so saw quite a few family rooms. This one was roomy as you had room to move around the beds and the room also included a large desk and some chairs. The bathroom was also of good size, well equiped and clean. The front desk is 24 hours and the staff were in our experience all very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in a great part of Venice, away from the annoying crowds with some good coffee, gelato and resteraunts nearby. The map supplied by the hotel guided us to the hotel on our arrival. We also thought the hotel was pretty good value for the size of the room, cleanliness, level of service and location - given the cost of accommodation in Venice it could probably be considered very good value. We certainly recommend the hotel. The room had large windows which were double glazed which also made the room very peaceful to sleep in at night, which is a plus with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Not my ideal choice in beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: karenmerry
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was rated 12 out of over 400 hotels on this website in Venice, unfortunately I can not understand why? The staff were friendly enough, although when I first called the hotel to see what would be the easiest way to get to there, the receptionist said get a water taxi? We did'nt as we could not find one and decided to walk and thankfully found the hotel quite easily but when we got there the receptionist said a water taxi would have cost us â‚¬80, I am just glad we had decided to walk. The rooms were clean and comfortable enough but I had booked two rooms, one with a 'canal view' unfortunately the view was actually of the graffitied wall opposite, you could only see the canal if you lent out of the tiny balcony and looked round to your left? This was very disappointing when we had decided to book this room for my sister and her husband as there 1st wedding anniversary treat . Our room was even worse and looked out directly onto a wall so hence it was very dark and a bit gloomy. The breakfast area was really a hallway situated next to the reception desk with no windows or atmosphere and breakfast was only served until 9.45. It was the most basic I have ever experienced anywhere in Europe as I don't think they have a proper kitchen, it was just cornflakes, croissants, jam, yoghurt and cheese spread, with a choice of tea, coffee or chocolate. From the moment we walked into the breakfast area we were aware we had to get out as they wanted to finish service. The waitress asked us if we wanted a second coffee and then said we had to take it to our rooms as she wanted to clean up. And we must have been told three times that check out was at 11 and could we make sure we were out by then? The position of the hotel was central enough but it was not a particularly nice area surrounding the hotel, I saw nicer hotels in better areas and wish we had stayed elsewhere. Venice itself is beautiful, the canals, the bridges, the people and the food all make this a fantastic place to visit, just choose your hotel wisely.
