This one makes sure they get lots of positive feedback from trip advisor as they email all there guests to ask them to make comments. Its good marketing but slightly misleading as it is an average hotel lacking in any atmosphere at an ok price for Venice. Spend a bit more money and I don't think you will regret it :o)

Reviews.Title: “personal service and a great experience”
Reviews.Author: toddr4fun
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be located in a residential (quiet) area -- which was great. The staff was all very personable and really cared about our trip and our experience. The room was comfortable and the accomodations were great. I'd highly recommend this hotel to Venice travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Rehovot
Reviews.Content: We would like to advice to everyone to stay in this lovely hotel. Its location is super convinient (10 minutes from Railway station and 20 minutes to San Marco) and the rooms and the service is outstanding. Have a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo4001
Reviews.Content: This is a small and lovely hotel in a quiet area with easy access to all the attractions. There are some strange comments about this hotel staff that I don't quite understand having met all the staff and finding them all very helpful and extremely friendly. The rooms are all decorated and furnished beautifully and it is very quiet at night ensuring a good night's sleep. It may have been nice to have an English news channel just to catch up but it wasn't a big problem. Breakfast basic but nice and fresh and room kept clean during our stay. I would have no hesitation returning to this hotel having stayed in countless hotels in many different places.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: tompkinscop
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in Locanda Sant'Agostin via Laterooms.com, mainly because of the location and good price. We arrived at San Marco airport and paid a few euros to get a bus from the airport to venice main bus station called the autorimessa, from here we were able to buy a 3 day boat bus ticket for around Â£17, this was the only way to see all of venice. Getting the water bus to Stan Stae, we then made our way to the hotel which was a little hard to find mainly due to the complicated side streets which all seem to look the same, after consulting our map and following directions provided by the hotel we eventually found it. A map is a must and without it we probably would not have found it. We checked in with the friendly staff, we were a little early but were able to leave our bags with the staff and go off exploring. On returning back to our room later that day, we found it to be very clean with all the normal ammenaties such as en - suite bathroom, colour tv (italian only), double bed and mini bar. The room was venetian styled and very well decorated. We also enjoyed a continental breakfast of croisssants, yoghurts and toast bread with fresh juice and coffee. We booked for a 3 day stay in Venice and found this to be more than enough time, any more would be to much we thought. We first visited St Mark's square which is beautiful, the pigeons are very accomadating and will intrude in your holiday pictures, a trip to the top of the campineli allows you to get wonderful views across Venice and is well worth a visit!! Other places which we visited included the lido (beach) which is a boat ride to the end of the canal, there is not much to do when you get there but we hired a bike and had a nosey around and enjoyed a pizza in one of the local restaurants. By night the Rialto bridge is a must, very romantic, we enjoyed dinner here on all nights of our stay which was very nice, note restaurants will charge a premium for the location but it does make your experience to venice awesome. We also enjoyed a ride on the very famous Gondala, there are many people trying to offer you a trip on thier Gondala but wait until you get a price thats right for you, we bartered for a half hour - 40 min boat ride for Â£80 euros which seemed about the going rate for this length of time. There our lots of museams around to visit, we visited Doges Palace which is recommended, lots of artwork and a prison where you can visit the bridge of sighs. All in all, Venice is a must european city break with lots to do and see, very romantic and ideal for couples. The hotel is situated in a great location more or less central to everything and around 10-15 min walk to the Rialto Bridge. Good map and guide book are essential!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLLB
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews and sending off a number of emails for availability in Venice, my family and I settled for this location. We are glad that we did. We deated the merit of staying on Lido and away from Venice proper but it just didn't make much sense for us. We are four people, with a 3.5 yo and 16yo, and so we needed a larger room. The room here was spacious and clean. It accommodated us easily. Breakfast in the morning was served with a smile with cereal, expresso or coffee and crossiants and jam. It was a good start to the day. The location was ideal for getting around to see the sites and the suggestions were decent on places to go. We found Venice a little touristy and the selection fo food in restaurants was pretty standard pizza and pastas. Sadly they were not as good as other areas of our trip. Venice is a city to walk in, and there was plenty to see. We enjoyed the waterbus around the city and the Grand Canal as well as Piazza San Marco. We had a day trip to Murano on a one-way water taxi to the factory and even though we bought, it mustn't have been enough and we were shown the water bus entrance for the return trip. I would recommend this hotel and the friendly, helpful staff. This for 4 people was not cheap, but then again nothing in Venice will be in July. Incidentally, buy a detailed map for walking around as Venice is a maze of narrow streets and bridges. Keep looking above for the larger directional signs for San Marco initially when you get off at the bus or train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel well located in Vencie”
Reviews.Author: SwissTraveler1977
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in this locanda. It was our honeymoon and we spent 4 nights there. The staff was extremly firendly and the location very central. We had asked for a room with view which we got (103B). We had a nice little ballconey with a view on a canal. Really nice. The only reason I wouldn't give it an excellent rating is because the room was relativelly small for a price which was not cheep (150 Euro per night) but I guess that is normal since we are talking about Venice. Shoudl I go back to Venice I would deffinetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Aerber
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin is situated in S.Polo, a residential aera for Venicians, altough it's very central, you find a lot of little Trattorias and Pizzerias with moderate prices, visited mostly by local people. The Lobby and the rooms are are beautifully decorated with antique furniture and paintings. Everyone of the staff in this Hotel was extremely nice and helpful, I'm shure, I wiil stay here again, next time I come to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time here and excellent as always!”
Reviews.Author: SCA2
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay in this hotel in 4 years. Last year we went to a different hotel on the Grand Canal which was also very good but this time we wanted to come back here to be away from the crowds but still near enough to walk to St Marks Square etc. There is now an excellent ice cream parlour about 10m away from the door step... This time we stayed in the apartment which was huge, and as it was VERY hot, the air conditioning was welcome. It was also great to wake up early in the morning, open the shutters to the windows, and look out on daily life along one of the small canals. The apartment was spotless, has 2 big bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, handy when there are 2 children in tow..... We checked in at the hotel reception, the staff are friendly, informative and great with kids. We were given all sorts of local info, and, even though we were in the apartment next door to the hotel, we were offered breakfast and remended to ask if there was anything at all that we needed during our stay. We had a brilliant holiday, again! and we still managed to get lost in the maze which is Venice (but then that is all part of the fun) Thank you, will see you next year.!

Reviews.Title: “great b&b”
Reviews.Author: canadianduck
Reviews.Content: Great b&b in the center of Venice. Friendly personal , helpful, dead pan humor...clean rooms with very clean bath, all renovated..super honest cleaning staff-found my lost pearl earing and attached it to my receipt..+++++++ recommended...will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rosa34
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff, great location, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Locanda”
Reviews.Author: EssexColonel
Reviews.Content: On entering the hotel we were very warmly welcomed even though we were well ahead of the earliest booking in time. the staff took time to tell us a little of the area and where to go for food and drink and the local sights. Our room was well appointed, very clean, and full of up market but old, highly polished furniture. The beds were large and comfortable. We could not fault the bathroom for cleanliness and facilities with the exception of the hairdryer which, after we found the hidden switch, lacked the necessary power for the childrens long hair - a minor problem in the heat of the Summer. The hotel is central to the bus station, train station, Rialto Bridge and Jewish quarter and is certainly where you would find the more reasonably priced restaurants, the cheapest ice cream shops and pizzaria's. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for its comfort, cleanliness, friendliness of the staff, and value for money (for Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Definite ThumbsUp!”
Reviews.Author: ihc49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in one of their superior double rooms (#105). The hotel staff was very friendly, the room was very clean and fairly large by European standards and the bathroom was very modern and seemed recently renovated. There were no disappointments - the room was exactly as I had seen on their website photos - they offer room service for the breakfast at no charge. The breakfast was quite decent and the cappuccino was great! The location is good - you can walk to Rialto Bridge in 15 mins (we took the AliLaguna line water bus from the airport to Rialto). Almost every place is a 15-20 min walk from here. There is no great view from the hotel as such, but if you are in Venice, would you stay in your hotel room instead of venturing outside? Word of caution - the stairs leading to the entry door is quite steep, so pack accordingly. Overall, we absolutely enjoyed our stay in this hotel, and would definitely stay there if we are lucky enough to visit Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBluesman
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at Locanda Sant'Agostin for 4 nights in late June. Venice, as we now realise, can be unbearably hot & humid, & it was - well over 30c each day. Thankfully the hotel has superb airconditioning, effective & QUIET. We had the famous 'room with a view' over the neighbouring canal but, since the outside temp was so high, opening the windows out onto the small balcony wasn't really an option. Noise-wise the double (triple?) glazed windows are super efficient & keep out all of the passing street/ canal sounds below - which aren't much anyway as the hotel is situated in a quiet friendly area, much less touristy than expected, with a distinct local flavour. The best thing by far about the hotel is the staff, especially the brothers Federico & Leonardo who go out of their way to make you feel welcome, & supply as much excellent information about sights, restaurants, travel as you could possibly need. All the other staff were extremely friendly & helpful too. My one niggle (which makes me hesitate to give the hotel 5 stars) is about breakfast, which is passable by european buffet standards and the lady serving is always there to top up your coffee, but overall it's unimaginative eg no fresh fruit, no choice of cereals or pastries. There are excellent coffee bars & pastry shops in the vicinity but breakfast is included in the room prices so it's a pity it's not up to the general standard of the hotel. Room service isn't offered & I don't think you need it in such a compact set-up, with the desk manned night & day. But it would have been great to have been able to make a cup of tea or coffee outside breakfast hours. I think a 24 hr tea/ coffee machine would be a real asset. The supplied directions from vaporetto stop 'San Stae' were really easy to follow & it takes less than 10' to walk to the hotel. After afternoons amongst the huge crowds in & around San Marco, The Rialto, Accademia etc, it was always a real pleasure to return to the quiet area around the hotel. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Locanda again, but I'd avoid Venice from June thro August because of the heat & humidity.

Reviews.Title: “a fab little hotel away from the frentic tourist streets of Venice”
Reviews.Author: kiwidocLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and it was a pleasure to return to the hotel after wandering the streets of Venice as the rooms were well appointed and comfortable. The hotel is very handy to all areas of Venice, so we explored areas of the city that we have not had a chance to explore on previous visits and to sit and enjoy the scenery and people. The staff are very pleasant and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best accomondations ever!”
Reviews.Author: kfarmersmith
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and had a fabulous stay at the Locanda Sant'Agostin! As you can tell from the other reviews, the hosts and their staff were wonderful. They speak very good english which made getting around Venice very easy. We especially loved the fact that they could put all four of us in the same room comfortably and we did not have to rent two rooms! The map at the hotel is fantastic but I would suggest getting one before you arrive so you can negotiate your way to the hotel without paying the $100 private taxi ride from the train station. If you can figure out the water bus system, the hotel is the second stop on the route going down the Grande Canal and is about a five to ten minute walk from there (be sure to travel light). Walking is a way of life in Venice which is why it's so special. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NVGSanMateo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three days at Locanda Sant'Agostin and loved it. The room was lovely and comfortable -- on the large size for a Europeon hotel, as well. Location is terrific -- in a quiet part of town, but any easy walk or vaporetto ride to anywhere. Venice was terribly hot and humid during our stay; the hotel's air conditioning was effective and amazingly quiet. The directions the hotel provided for arrival were excellent (we got lost anyway, but it was totally our fault -- the directions were perfect). The nicest thing about the hotel is the staff. All were welcoming, friendly & helpful. And the lady who served breakfast has a smile that makes for a perfect start of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Bella Venezia !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flanders59
Reviews.Content: Considering the prices of Venetian hotels, we found the Locanda Sant Agostin to be good value for money. We booked there because we were attracted by the location and the "room with a view". Unfortunately, when we arrived, that room appeared to have been taken, notwithstanding their confirmation by e-mail. However, our initial slight irritation quickly dissolved when we were offered the appartment for the same price. The appartment (2 rooms, 2 bathrooms, sitting room with TV, kitchen with huge fridge) is right around the corner from the hotel in a tiny alley, next to a canal. It was absolutely spotlessly clean! Good airco (which we needed, since it was over 30Â° Celsius). After our initial misgivings of being in an appartment rather than a hotel room, we truly enjoyed our stay. The only down side was that no one came in to make our bed or change towels during our 3 days' stay but, judging from the personnel's friendliness, I'm sure they would have, had we asked for it. As it was, we didn't really bother and just enjoyed the lovely city of Venice to the max ! We had to go to the hotel for breakfast but didn't mind that. Breakfast is served in a nice room and good for Italian standards but rather poor to our liking, except for the coffee. But there's a wonderful bakery next doors AND a great coffeeshop on the corner. Location cannot be beat if you like a quiet area which is nevertheless close enough to all the main places of interest and to lots of places to eat. Everything is within a 15-30 minutes' walk. We even walked to Canareggio (lovely, quiet walk, almost no tourists). We had a lovely meal at Vivaldi's (recommended by Leonardo). We cannot comment on the hotel rooms since we did not see them. Anyway, I guess most rooms do not have any view to speak of but if that's what you're looking for, you'll have to be prepaired to pay much more and after all, who wants to be inside a hotel room when there's so much to do and see in Venice? Over all, a very enjoyable stay. Would probably stay there again if lucky enough to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely want to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller12345
Reviews.Content: I was fully satisfied with my stay in Locanda Sant'Agostin. I heard all rooms were very small in Venice, but it was much bigger than I expected and even was beautiful and clean ! The hotel(in fact all the buildings in Venice) was antique style and so was very nice, also had a clean modern bathroom&shower. The breakfast was simple. not bad, not excellent, just okay~. I guess only few rooms have nice views. But considering the building organized in Venice, I could fully understand our room's view facing the other bulinding behind. It is not the hotel condition, but the VENETIAN condition. :) Anyway, most people would spend time outside the hotel in Venice. It is so a lovely city. The location is okay to walk from/to station or the Sant Marco or any of most places in Venice. Venice streets are very complicated however the location of the hotel is just in the middle of the tourists places. Above all, the staffs are perfectly kind and friendly !!** I would stay there again when I visit Venice again. Can strongly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find away from crowds”
Reviews.Author: Racoon0
Reviews.Content: Mature couple. In the district of San Polo, few minutes to vaporetto, 15 minutes of delightful walk to Piazza San Marco. If you love to explore, but return to a peaceful setting, this is for you. The hotel is in a quiet zone, shutters and windows in a very soundproof room, we had comfortable matrimonial beds, well equipped including a tub for tired body. Wake up to the church bells and chatter of children going to school. Staff is helpful with info for places to eat. Breakfeast is a standard continental served with smile and enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danruas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located in the centre of Venice but in a nice quiet situation. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and the hotel was spotlessly clean. I would certainly recommend this hotel and when I return to Venice will look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlfredHull_England
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty much perfect for the short break my wife and I spent in Venice. It is extremely friendly, in a calm and unobtrusive way, with the staff always willing to help you to find whatever you want. The room was very nicely presented. The location was ideal, being away from the busiest part of the city but within easy walking distance of everything we wanted - about mid-way between the coach station and the Rialto Bridge. The sun shines into the breadfast room (when the weather is good, at least), making for a delightful atmosphere. Local restaurants are good, and reasonably priced. Best surprise of the stay was the Venice Jazz Club - again a short walk away and a wonderful evening of top class jazz from local musicians. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel In Venice”
Reviews.Author: jeffbass07
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has all the perks of a large luxury hotel. Beautiful public rooms, roomy and emaculate guest rooms with luxury-level bathrooms. It is tucked away in a quiet area of San Polo but close to magnificent cathedrals, and within walking distance to the Rialto Bridge and Railway Station. I have already recommended this inn to several friends and family. Great places to eat right in the immediate neighborhood. A better find at this price can not be had!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little gem off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: kiteflyers
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay with my husband in this charming small hotel on our first visit to Venice. It's location is ideal, away from the mad throngs on the Rialto and St Mark's Square over priced side of the city, in a more neighbourly part of Venice with lovely reasonably priced local shops, bars, cafes, and around the corner from Da Fiore restaurant, which really is the best in the city. Easy to find a few minutes walk from the San Stae vaporetta stop, it's spotlessly clean, very comfortable and the staff could not be more friendly or helpful. You can reach any part of the city from it on foot very quickly, so you are not far from the hub of things, but it also allows you to get breathing space away from the crowds in places like the nearby San Polo square and it's cafes. The Frari and Scuola Grande are just around the corner, and all the other main sights can be accessed from it very easily. The rooms are air conditioned and peacefulat night, Venice is not a party city, things close up early and it gets quiet, so if you are out you want to walk back safely to where you are staying and the location of this hotel is ideal for that. Would recommend it for couples, families, or friends of any age traveling together who enjoy a nice place to stay that has an authentic Venitian feel about it, in fact we would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: WarringtonWanderers
Reviews.Content: Away from the tourist area but close enough to walk everywhere, the hotel met or exceeded all our expectations. Staff are friendly and helpful. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent. We had a room with a balcony and although the balcony is small we were able to take our breakfast to the room and enjoy sitting in the window area overlooking a canal. The room itself was larger than we expected for Venice, was very clean and very well appointed. Breakfast is simple but all we were looking for - who needs a big breakfast with all those cafes and cake shops to be visited during the day :-) It is a small hotel and therefore does not offer services or have lounges etc and is clearly targeted at tourists who are out all of the day and just use it to sleep / get changed.... But if this is what you are looking for then no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Locanda Sant' Agostin”
Reviews.Author: Grovelet
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel, the room we had was quite grand with a a balcony over looking a small square and canal. The staff were very nice and friendly and always eager to help. We had a delightful stay and would say this hotel is very good value, would definitely recommend this hotel. The really nice thing about it was it's intimate and personal nature. The Locanda really made our stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: fabtravels
Reviews.Content: It was excellet from the beginning! Our stay was made so enjoyable by the staff, Federico and Emanuele were so helpful with their suggestions. The room was great (especially by Venice standards!) We loved not being right on the tourist path, close enough to everything that wandering the streets was so easy. Engaged during our trip to Venice, Locanda Sant' Agostin will always remain one of our special spots. We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: shug358
Reviews.Content: A great find on our 4th trip to Venice. Tucked away from the madding crowds but with easy access to all major attractions. The staff were excellent and their recommendations for food (Vivaldi, Ignazo) and drink (Blue Bar) were spot on. Simple cold breakfast and nice rooms (with bath!) made this a delightful place to stay. Get a good map before setting off on foot from the Piazzale Roma but as long as you can get to the De Friari church you won't be far away!

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: bs2007
Reviews.Content: Ignore the comments about the stairs and breakfast because when you stay at beautiful, immaculate, charming and welcoming hotel like this one, none of these things matter. Some people just want to find fault and I can assure you that they are nitpicking. When we arrived at the San Stae waterbus stop, we followed the directions on the hotel's website and had no trouble at all finding it. The moaners obviously didn't do their homework! In our opinion, the hotel couldn't have been in a better location. It is away from the thronging masses, but being in the centre of the city, all of the main sights are within ten to twenty minutes' walk. Perfect. Many of the supposedly more popular hotels are located right next to the bus station, which means a long walk or a waterbus into the centre for sightseeing. We needn't have bought 3-day vaparetto passes as you could do it all on foot from where we were. The room was beautifully decorated and furnished, just as the pictures on the website show. It was immaculately clean and a fair size, with a lovely marble bathroom. There was a canal view, not directly out of the window, but turning your head left. I stayed at the hotel with my Mum for a short break to celebrate her 60th birthday. From the first contact, the hotel staff were extremely courteous, helpful and friendly. We took advantage of their restaurant recommendations, which were very sensible - well priced and not touristy. We were made to feel very welcome and were touched that they remembered Mum's birthday. It was exactly these extra touches that made me thankful I had booked a small independent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just as other reviewers found it”
Reviews.Author: Singe
Reviews.Content: Spotless, very (appropriately) helpful staff, plenty of space, expensively decorated room. Surprised myself by walking straight to it, despite family changing their mind when the Alilaguna dropped us off, and wanting to walk all the way. 15 mins from Guglie stop. In fact, around 15 minutes to most of the sights. (Tip, walk - do not buy a water bus ticket until you are sure you will use it). The photos of the narrow street outside were a little offputting: it was only when we got there that we realised that pretty much ALL Venetian streets are like this. If you like the windows open at night, be warned: the narrow street brings the noise right into your room - even a quiet voice sounds like it is right next to you - but I guess this is true of all hotels in Venice. I got a big reduction for paying cash. The hotel recommended Birraria restaurant (their no.1) was definitely the best and cheapest. Within 20 yards of the hotel is an ice cream parlour, a bar, a pizza restaurant, a fast-food pizza place, etc, and two small squares as well as a canal. The Friary (Frari) is within two minutes' walk. There is graffiti everywhere in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailingby3
Reviews.Content: Good value for Venice. Quiet and good beds so we slept well. Central, can walk everywhere. Clean and smart. Friendly and helpful. Fruit would improve breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Good Value but....”
Reviews.Author: VeryGCGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and i, and our 15yr old daughter booked in for 3 nights in Locanda Sant'Agostin in a triple room. There is a very steep flight of stairs up to the reception where all the rooms are located on this single level. This is venice though and is to be expected, at least the rooms are all on the same level. So don't pack alot unless you have a strong (and willing!) man. You should also note that you are not allowed to eat or drink in the hotel rooms, and you have to hand in you key before you leave, and retrive when you get back which alot of hotels do apparently for security reasons. The room was beautiful and just like the photos on the website, but do not expect any water views. Our two windows opened out onto a brick wall, and courtyard type area. However the room was furnished beautifully and very well maintained and extremely clean. My daughter felt like a princess and adored the bedhead and chandlier which sure wanted to take home! The tv is very small though and only italian channels. The hair dryer in our room didn't work. The bathroom was beauitful though with marble tiling etc. It had shower/bath, toilet, bidet, and corner basin. Be warned though if you are expecting to use wireless internet, forget it - there is a firewall on the modem, which when asked the staff about after paying 5 euros for unlimited use they said they couldn't do anything, so you cannot access emails, myspace, blogs, etc. etc. The location was good, a little bit of a find but that is the maze of Venice! You can take a private water taxi, at stupid prices of 60 euro etc. upwards, straight to doorstep but otherwise you need to depart the water bus at S.Toma station and take you bags over bridges and navigate you way through narrow streets. This is everywhere though in Venice unless you are prepared to pay 4 or 5 star hotel prices. You should be fine, buy a map before boarding the water bus, and ask wherever possible for some help with directions. Most venetians are used to confused tourists asking for help with navigation! I would advise however not to arrive in Venice at night unless you know it like the back of your hand or are prepared to pay at least 80 euro for private water taxi. The staff were mostly helpful depending on who was on front desk.. The man who was on 2 april in the morning was extremely helpful and we would like to thank him for a great stay. You may find many venetians very arrogant toward english speaking tourists, which is bizarre considering Venice is powered entirely by tourism by anyway, but he was one of the least arrogant people we came across and very helpful and friendly. It makes the difference really. The breakfast was reasonable if small because there are only a few rooms in the hotel, and typical italian. Coffee, hot chocolate, breads, croissants, cornflakes, yoghurt, juice etc.. Overall, Locanda is great value, the room will satisfy the most fussy, even without water views, the location is good and very quiet. The staff were mostly helpful and friendly. As long as you are eating out, and do not need internet, it is a great choice and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Eugenia, she makes you want to learn Italian!”
Reviews.Author: Defamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 4 nights at Locanda Sant'Agostin. Our family of 4 - two adults and two teens - had two delightful rooms in this wonderful hotel. The location is excellent and the rooms are also very nice, but what sets this place apart is the staff. They take a personal interest in all their guests, remembering your room numbers and native languages from the start. Especially we would like to thank Manuel for welcoming us, orienting us to Venice and for excellent dinner ideas, and also Eugenia, the hotel's secret weapon! This classy and energetic woman provides welcome duties some evenings and sublime cappucino and breakfast service as well as immaculate cleaning services each day. She speaks only Italian and is so friendly you will wish you studied your Italian better before arriving just so you can converse better with her. I would highly recommend this place to anyone as an excellent choice in terms of value, cleanliness, service and location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jmmBrentwood_Essex
Reviews.Content: A 4 day trip to Venice in March was thoroughly enjoyed. Having arrived at the airport, we were whisked away by bus to Venice. We then found our way to the most delightful little hotel - Locanda Sant' Agostin. Upon arrival we were greeted by a beautifully spoken young man by the name of Manuel, he was very helpful and polite. He showed us to our room, which was perfect for our short stay, being fairly central to all parts of Venice. The room was very well appointed and lovely and warm (being March is was still quite chilly outside). We decided to explore straight away, and Manuel was there with a map and marked many points of interest including eating places. Breakfast each morning was continental and the waitress would be there with a big smile and a warm greeting. Every time our cups were empty, she would bring more tea/coffee. Nothing was too much for her. After a long day out, we arrived back to find our room spotless and the mini bar restocked. We could not ask for more. Thankyou, thankyou for making our stay such a pleasurable one. We will be back, hopefully in the autum this year, because we never got to see everything. Our good wishes for a successful season.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at its best”
Reviews.Author: bonneville-dave
Reviews.Content: We where recommended to the Locanda Sant'Agostin for our first holiday in Venice by some friends and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone else, and already have! This special little hotel was an absolute delight and the staff where fantastic. It is a haven and far from the madding crowd but situated close to many small and delightful cafes and restaurants with culture on the doorstep. The Rialto bridge is only ten minutes walk away through delightful streets and over picturesque canal bridges. We can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Facchinettix
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this small hotel, right after the carneval time. Staff was very helpful and gave us very good hints for non-tourist restaurants and sight-seeing locations. Our double-room was clean and quite small, but that's how it is everywhere in Venice I guess. We ordered breakfast to the room, but if you want to eat more there's also a buffet. Just one thing: If you're looking for a great view out of your window like it's shown on the hotel website, you probably have to ask for it, otherwise you will probably see a wall if you open the rooms window (that's what happend to us).

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Sant Agostin great value”
Reviews.Author: ProdEng
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, being a walk away from Piazzala Roma and all the main sights. In a very central area but still a quiet area. The room was lovely and the staff very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Venetian family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: milesPerth
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an authentic family hotel in Venice staffed by naturally charming people who have delightful eccentricities and are falling over to please, this is for you. Get a good map though because you'll need it. It is set very strategically in the middle of Polo with numerous little pasticcerias and bars and restaurants all around. The owners and their amazing breakfast lady Eugenia had an old-fashioned , old world charm that was highly enjoyable. The room we had came with great big shutters that opened out onto the life of the canal below. From it, we felt as if we were seeing the authentic daily life of Venice. Below, people met, debated, walked their dogs, exchanged views and they were all locals.... Room was impeccably clean and well presented and the entrance to the hotel is up an imposing staircase which sets the scene beautifully for their reception (antique chairs, ornate oils on canvas). Quite an experience if you would like to get away from modern impersonal hotels. Even so, you could get CNN on the tele and we felt well looked after. Oliver and Lavinia West Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: wein123
Reviews.Content: A realy nice hotel in the heart of Venice, perfect central location to explore Venice. Very kindley Staff. Very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wimple
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and I would recommend this wonderful hotel to everyone. The staff are all so charming and helpful and reception is manned 24 hours a day.Emanuele in particular was brilliant and gave great advice on restaurants,places to visit and generally helping us find our way around.Eugenia was delightful and nothing was too much trouble at breakfast and it was funny just trying to communicate as we have very little Italian and Eugenia had a little English. The hotel itself is very small and intimate and is perfectly located. The rooms are large, very comfortable and quiet and the hotel is immaculately clean. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to all our friends and family and can't wait to stay there again soon. I will be trying to improve my Italian just for Eugenia!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: bonbini19
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with very, very friendly staff. We had a clean and spacious room with bath (and bidet) for 3 people (2 adults, one child). Wooden floor, very good (and very clean) beds, TV, safe, minibar (very acceptable prices). For breakfast, you could select from fruit juice, milk, cereals, small breadrolls, croissants (sort of), yoghurt, marmalade, butter and, most important, espresso, cappucchino or hot chocolate, all freshly brewed and as much as you can digest. Enough to last you until the afternoon. The staff speaks little English, but is is very helpful. The location is excellent, too: Not in a typical tourist area, with shops and bars around the corner. The Rialto is 10 minutes walk as is the Piazzale Roma. The student quarter is nearby with its bars and restaurants. The Locanda is definitely worth its money. We enjoyed our stay there very much and felt immediately at home.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DownunderAussie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked inside this beautifully restored boutique Hotel we were delighted. The ambiance, the decor, the smiling and friendly greeting - this was our introduction to Italy . Wow! One could not ask for a lovelier place to rest your head in a quiet little part of Venice, but still only a short walk from all those magical and famous sights of this beautiful city. Breakfast was good - made all the more charming by Eugenia with her broken English and with our childish Italian - it all made for a lot of fun times in the morning. All the other staff spoke good English and their knowledge of the city was as good as any Tour guide plus their local knowledge enabled us to enjoy the true Venetian way of life at some quaint trattorias in the area. Our bedroom was beautifully furnished, super bed, the bathroom was quite nice and everything was scrupulously clean. What a joy! If we ever returned to Venice (it's a long way from Australia) we would book our stay at the Locanda Sant'Agostin first and foremost. It may not be on the Grand Canal - but its a Grand place to stay. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Quite getaway from tourists in Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: tnorfrog
Reviews.Content: Venice is a very busy city filled with tourists. The Locanda Sant'Agostin is a nice escape from all of that! It's tucked away in a small square. The staff is helpful, friendly, and ready to provide any assistance. Our room was spacious and had a nice bathroom. Our view was minimal, I had to stretch my head out to see the tiny alley below. The best part about the Sant"Agostin was that it was quiet! The breakfast was decent, but not memorable. Venice is an expensive city! The food is nothing special, I would prefer to spend it on gelato, coffee, and a gondola ride!

Reviews.Title: “A special little hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TAFSing
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin proved to be one of the nicest small hotels anyone could wish for. And good value too. A friend and I stayed there for four nights over the New Year and were made to feel very welcome and comfortable. The hotel is quick and easy to reach from either the Railway Station or the San Stae vapporetto stop on the Grand Canal, provided you follow their instructions and map very carefully. The entrance is off a small square, up a single flight of stairs leading into an elegant Reception Room, furnished with character but not overdone. The Bedroom we used was large, calm and spacious with a nice old armoire for clothes, antique bedside tables and very comfotable beds with crisp white linen. The new marble Bathroom with shower cubicle, wc and large vanity counter and basin was also spacious and bright and the heated towel rails kept the towels really warm. We quickly got to know our way around the maze of littlle streets and were pleased to discover how close the hotel is to both the famous sights and the local neighbourhoods. But what really made our stay memorable were the friendly, helpful staff with their good maps, recommendations for good authentic nearby restaurants and their favorite sights, and the breakfast coffees always served with a smile and a friendly laugh over our hopeless attempts to speak even the most basic italian. Thankyou Eugenia, Emanuele, Leonardo and Federico. I enthusiastically recommend your hotel to anyone reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: tmhAshevilleNC
Reviews.Content: Has a wonderful stay in this small, immaculately run and maintained hotel in the heart of Venice. Staff were super-helpful and gracious, rooms well-appointed and spotlessly clean. Location was great, close to everything but off the beaten track. In this neighborhood the main language heard spoken on the streets was Italian! We were a party of 5, myself, husband, 2 nine year olds and a13 yr old. We took 2 rooms, both were spacious and the children were very comfortable in their triple room. (NO fighting !) This was our second visit to Venice and we loved this hotel. I would definately return and highly recommend this hotel both to couples and families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bhursin
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Locanda hotel. No noise, very quiet. Room was big enough, Bathroom was more than ok ! And the welcome was perfect, we appreciated it very much. The breaksfast was very ok ! Next time i go to Venise, I'll book Locanda again!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: enthusiastengland
Reviews.Content: another great stay... our fourth! Once again we have spent a peaceful few days at our favourite small hotel, well looked after including a champagne breakfast for the birthday girl! as usual immaculate rooms and bathrooms helpful staff at all times and not forgetting eugenia the charming and funny breakfast lady. this is an unspoilt area of venice yet near friendly bars and restaurants two vaporetto stops and of cours the frari. recommended to the discerning traveller who enjoys the true venice and its people sarah and alan in the u.k.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juanrami
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for main Venice attractions. The Hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were so willing to help us with restaurants and getting around Venice. Breakfast was also included and it was provided in a spacious room and it was very good I will certainly use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: thering
Reviews.Content: Step into this little hotel and you are treated like family. The last november was the 3rd time for us! The staff is always fantastic and we cannot say enough about them. We didn't want to leave and neither did any of the other guests at this hotel that we met during our stay. The hotel was a reflection of the wonderful city of Venice itself. Charming, friendly, helpful, welcoming. Thanks again. Mr Kurt, Wien.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: italianbroad
Reviews.Content: This is one great place to stay. The rooms are perfect, clean and comfortable. The managers are especially helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located in a wonderful neighborhood...just off the craziness of the tourist center but easily walkable if you want to feed the pushy pigeons and see St Marks. I had a salami and formaggio sandwich every day from the corner store and there is a fabulous Murano glass place across the piazza. Eugenie is your breakfast host and she is worth the price of admission...unfailingly cheerful, welcoming AND she makes a great cappucino. This was definitely one of our favorite places to stay and we recommend it wholeheartedly. We are a couple of American old broads, on a trip to celebrate the sale of our bookstore/cafe in California. Lucky us to find Locanda Sant'Agostin. You can too and although the directions to get there seem screwy, it is actually easier than we thought ...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation”
Reviews.Author: Nick8347
Reviews.Content: Lovely family friendly hotel in a peaceful area of Venice, close to the shops and restaurants. The staff were extremely helpful giving advice on the best places to eat, how to get around Venice and ideas on places to visit and things to see. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. We had a very enjoyable stay and will definitely visit this hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “five star”
Reviews.Author: Tognon
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful small boutique hotel right in the centre of Venice. It is a small family type run concern with the most friendly and attentive English speaking staff to assist with any activities in the region. The rooms are very clean with a very good breakfast. Ask for one with a view over the little square and river. It is ten minutes from all of the major attractions but set back from the main tourist areas. The joy is wandering the alleyways and seeing the real sites. We will stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here.”
Reviews.Author: GulliverL
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed to good to be true online - and it was. First of all their website states that they are handicapped accessible but they are not. There is a steep staircase with no elevator. The rooms were not clean. The bedspread had a bloodstain on it. The air conditioning didn't work which would have been ok if we could have left the window open but our room was over a reggae bar and the cigarette smoke wafted in our window. Even with the window closed the music boomed in our room. Some of the staff were nice but not very helpful when it came to the airconditioning. The room was stuffy and hot with the windows closed. We complained twice to no avail. The bathroom was tiny with the sink stuffed in the corner at an angle. Bathroom was nominally clean. Our telephone cord was cut thus no phone. They did give us another one when we complained. The worst was when we went to check out early. They screamed at us that we had to pay for the whole reservation. It is stated on their website as a policy. Probably they've had this problem before of people wanting to check out early. We ended up paying $1,000 for the three nights we didn't stay there and they were very nasty about it. I would NOT reccommend this hotel to anyone who wants to sleep. The area was nice enough and not touristy.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Sant'Agostin”
Reviews.Author: bobsleigher
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel could not have asked for better, very proffesional and friendly staff, first time in Venice if we revisit we would certainly stay here without question.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel...felt like someone's home.”
Reviews.Author: hbm9
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Sant'Agostin made Venice our favorite part of Italy. We have never felt so welcomed at a hotel, from the moment we walked in it was as though we were invited into someone's home. It was also clean and comfortable, with beautiful Murano glass chandeliers. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Venice location”
Reviews.Author: fellspointfoard
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin does not disappoint. We had an excellent 3-night stay in this quiet 7-room hotel. Website directions were good from the vaporetta stop and the front desk folks were very helpful (and accurate) with maps and restaurant recommendations. Interestingly, the first two nights we stayed in the "canal view room" for about 50 euros more. Because the canal room wasn't available for the 3rd night we were moved to room 102 which was significantly larger and still had a view of the square below the hotel. We found the second room to be a better value. The hotel location suited our needs perfectly. It's a 15-minute walk to all major tourist destinations. After a day of sight seeing Locanta Sant'Agostin provided a great retreat from the tourists-clogged sites of Venice. There's an excellent little wine bar on the canal side of the hotel with cafe tables perfect for a drink and post card writing in the afternoon. Only locals and lost tourists will wander by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TyRex26
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a long weekend in Venice staying at the Locanda Sant'Agostin, a welcome break from the poor London weather. The location was easy to get to and we found the staff to be exceptionally friendly - they went out of their way to ensure that we had a good stay by recommending restaurants, places to see and directions to get places. The room itself was nicer than expected for the price - recently refurbished, very clean and with a nice balcony overlooking a canal. Great value for money in my opinion. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: PedroBrazil
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stay there during the summer and this is what we found. Overall was a good experience Highlights -Nice view -Good breakfast -Friendly staff Lowlights -Bed: the double bed was actually two single beds put together, what is not comfortable -Mosquitoes! Be ready for then -Location is not so good â€“ not really near from anything important

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Val001
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a magical stay in Venice at Locanda sant'Agostin. The hotel is a delight. location perfect,in a quiet square,rooms comfortable and well equiped.hosts charming and extreemely helpfull,always on hand for advice on anything from vaporetto times to restaurant choices. nothing was too much trouble. we will certainly return,and tell all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bennett68
Reviews.Content: Our introduction to Locanda Sant'Agostin was from the internet. Everything that you see on their web site is what you get. It is quite charming and very quiet. It is a little further from the Railto Bridge than first thought but a pleasant stroll to Railto takes about 10 - 15 minutes. Special mention must go to Frederico and Eugenia. Frederico helped us with lots of information and was extremely helpful and Eugenia started our day with lovely coffee and a very pleasant smile and was also very helpful. The continental breakfast that was included in our rate was good and most adequate. The hotel was a little difficult to find initially. To walk from San Stae Vaporetta Station with luggage took about 20-25 minutes (without luggage 10 minutes). If you follow the Piazalle Roma signs from Rialto Bridge or the St Marks or Rialto Signs from Piazalle Roma you shouldn't have too much difficulty in finding the hotel. Frederico - a special thank you for helping us down with our luggage. Our water taxi arrived on time and took us to the airport. All in all a very pleasant stay and a hotel we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted”
Reviews.Author: jagru
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Santa Lucia Railways Station around 9.30 am, on July 4 2007 for a three days stay in Venice. After a walk of less than a quarter of an hour we were booking in at the hotel. The hotel is exactly as described on the web site of Locanda San Agostino: [--] So, we were delighted. Very conveniently situated in the heart of the city , confortable,intimate,very friendly. and not expensive. Again, as it is totally relevant, we suggest to visit the web site for more details. In conclusion, we strongly recommend this hotel. Marie-ThÃ©rÃ¨se et Jacques (French)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 'Locanda Sant'Agostin'”
Reviews.Author: Chrisal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little gem, situated in the heart of Venice, yet remarkably quiet and away from the interminable crowds of tourists. It is an elegant Venetian house, furnished in traditional style, but understated. It is a small hotel, so guests get personal service from the very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are spacious, and rather grand. The restuarant suggestions from the staff were excellent, and the hotel is well situated for visiting individual shops. Try the 'Hat Shop' just around the corner! There is a lovely jewellery shop almost opposite as well.

Reviews.Title: “try someplace else”
Reviews.Author: jsarge
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice with my wife and 2 teenage kids and a 2 night stay at the Agostin. Very disappointed. After reading recent reviews of the Agostin I expected more. The hotel is a little difficult to find and located away from most sights. Upon arrival the staff was not accomodating. Maybe because most didn't speak much english. The room was decent size for 4 but had a/c problems ( fan was broken ) and the shower door had a hole in it. We told the staff but they did not fix and didn't seem too concerned. Breakfast was limited. Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 rooms in 2 days”
Reviews.Author: applesDonna
Reviews.Content: Donna Whelan, Dublin. Booked Locanda Sant'Agostin after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Location wise its not bad, be warned! it is difficult to find, its approx 10-15min walk from the Piazzale Roma, but we got lost and took us an hour. On arrival we were told that we would have to change rooms the next morning, it was a bit of an inconvenience as we were only staying 2 nights so felt as if was packing and unpacking.the whole time. Word of advice to management, if you are going to inconvenience people by moving them then (a) replacement room should be available straight away (we moved out 11am but the new room would'nt be available till about 2pm) and (b) the replacement room could have a better view, 2nd room looked out onto a wall! 105) The breakfast I know is Continental, but in my opinion is quite poor, the choice is very limited, a bit of fruit or meat would'nt go amiss. The rooms are nicely decorated, average size, very clean and good air conditioning, the staff are friendly and helpfuI.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: robinson1220
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the service. The staff at the hotel was friendly, knowledgable, and very helpful. When we first arrived we were handed a map and shown all the highlights of Venice along with some great restaurants. The accomodations were decent. The hotel was not extravagant or very fancy, but it was clean and the price was certainly right. Also, the hotel was in a great location, right in the middle of everything. All in all, it was pleasant experience and I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking for an affordable option in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: taylormo
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed in Venice before, so I do not have anything to compare to, but our room was quite large and very nicely furnished and well organized. The people at this hotel are very nice, and work hard to make everything perfect for you. The breakfast is very modest, but the people serving you are great! The location is convenient to everything, but not in a crowded area. Returning from the tourist areas, you see children out with parents and older people enjoying the outdoors. We loved everything about our stay .... with ONE EXCEPTiION... we had difficultly finding the hotel after dark in the rain!! Our plane was delayed, and the hotel advertises English speakers. But that is only during the day!! If we had been to Venice previously, or had experienced a day on the island, we would have been able to navigate, but arrange to be picked up or be sure you will have a working cell to get directions--and don't arrive late at night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in good, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: bookeeper
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Sant'Agostin is in an excellent location - a quiet square within walking distance of the major attractions of Venice - but you do need to walk about 10 to 15 mins to St Marks etc, so probably not too good for those with mobility problems. The staff were one of the highlights of our stay - offering helpful advice of places to visit, restaurants and bars, very knowledgable about opening times and transport timetables etc. We stayed in a room with a small balcony overlooking the canal (just!) and a campiello, which was very pleasant in the evenings. The room was clean and comfortable with a king size bed but on the small side; not untypical for Venice. 2 recommended restarants/bars stand out - La Antica Birreria in Campo St Polo, a lovely restarant and pizzeria which serves really good value food and drinks, and Vivaldi, a typical Venetian restaurant just off Campo St Polo. Breakfast at the Locanda was just adequate - croissant, cereal and rolls, concentrated orange juice and no fresh fruit - but reasonable value for money and friendly service. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service in a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scarborian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central area, within twenty minutes walk of nearly anywhere in Venice. The staff are friendly and helpful and gave great advice about where to eat. We liked it being less 'touristy' nearby, more like a part of the real community. The room was excellent, spacious, clean and air conditioned, which is a bonus if you come at a hot time of year. We intend to go again! Venice, of course, is amazing. Nothing like it in the world. It's as it's been described, but even better than you expect. The art and history, the churches and architecture, the canals and the gondolas, there is so much in such a small place. Yes, Venice is faded and crumbling in places, but it's entitled to be so with its age, and although there is a surprising amount of graffiti on some of the passage walls, the plus side is that there are NO CARS at all, children play in the Campos in the evening, and you feel completely safe in the narrowest alleyway at midnight. Eat out in the open in Campo San Polo - have a half litre of the house Prosecco , a starter and a nice bruscetta and a superb calzoni , and less than forty euros for two- great value!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, just not the room location.”
Reviews.Author: segsmudge
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel except for one thing. Where the room was located. Our room was the room right next to the stariway up to the hotel, so we could here when people came up the stairs to be buzzed in. Luckily, we were there in the dead of winter, so it was pretty quiet and didn't bother us when we sleep. But in the summer..oh, that would be a bad room. Other than that, it was a great hotel to be at. The hotel is very small, and the service is very personal. It's in a great location, right in the middle of everything, and very easy to talk walks in any direction. The guy at the front desk was amazing. We were there a little early, and he held our bags while we cruised around with a map and some recommendations from him. They sent us to great restaurants and gave us a good little breakfast every morning. The rooms are very nice and roomy for Venice, and everything felt very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - Head for the Locanda Orseola!!”
Reviews.Author: RobinHood1
Reviews.Content: Well we ended up here after having our reservation cancelled by the Locanda Orseola ( we were there last year) who told us they had construction problems with a number of rooms and so had to cancel. This was two months before....the cynic in me suggests that they perhaps had a better offer from someone else.....nevertheless, we like small hotels so looked for an alternative and came across this. If this is no 15 in the popularity rank of Venice hotels then that doesn't say much for the rest. Now I know the Orseola is no 1 but this is very average! Let's start with the good parts - well it is in a very pleasant location, with easy access from bus and train, and with some of the very best Venice sights close by - the neighbourhood is residential with many good restaurants and shops round about, and generally away from the crowds! The hotel is immaculately clean and the reception is pleasant and helpful. The rooms - well don't bother paying extra for the one's at the front if you want a good nights sleep! Hot! Hot! Hot! We complained each day to the "reception" - who told us that they were not "authorised" to turn on the air conditioning and the reason it is hot is that Venice is humid! The quadruple double glazing and shutters do a great job of keeping the noise out and the hot air in. Open the windows and shutters to get the temperature down, and you hear people walking by all night and much though I like them, the Italians are not quiet. So much for the "individual room air conditioning unit" in the hotel description. ( and whatever the management say about this it was raised with them each day!!!) The rooms themselves are smallish but I guess it is Venice, and the bathrooms also small but with a great shower! Beds ok if firm - limited other furniture, Breakfast - very basic at this price range and the lady who serves the coffee is not that pleasant at all , and makes little attempt to communciate beyond her mantra of coffee offers.....that she sings out regularly! Service is OK - but they really don't attempt to do more than they have to, no extra mile ....( eg tea/ coffeee in the rooms, internet, pleasant sitting area) . So compared to the Orseola - I am afraid this loses hands down. If you like small hotels and can get a reservation at the Locanda Orseola don't give this a second thought! It is not that dissimilar in price I was expecting a lot more given the reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends so had two rooms to experience. The ambience is excellent and the renovations have kept the character of the palazzo. The staff were efficient and extremely helpful. The hotel is in an excellent position, near to everything but not in the middle of it. The rooms were a good size and very nicely appointed although only one really had the 'square and canal' view from the room (in the other you had to actually stand on the tiny balcony for the view but it was there). The bathrooms were well equipped (except for the inevitable 'hose pipe' hairdrier) and everything was spotlessly clean. The photo on the web-page is the view from the hotel, not a view of the hotel, which confused us when we were looking for it. However the only real criticism I have is that they have one of those push button coffee makers. The very friendly woman makes the coffee for you but the quality is not as good as a proper machine. Overall this is a very good hotel in which to base a visit to Venice with cafes, bars and resteraunts close by and only a short walk to the train station, Piazzale Roma, The Rialto etc. Wherever you stay Venice is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: BG10
Reviews.Content: Found this Locanda through TripAdvisor and it was everything I expected from the excellent reviews I read here. Staff were very friendly and helpful, although there was a bit of a language barrier as two of the staff didn't speak english! Really can't beat this hotel on location, it's right in the middle of the city so is within easy reach of all the major attractions and the train station. The directions the staff e-mailed us were very clear so we had no trouble finding the hotel, and they provided us with a map detailing routes to some of the big attractions and local restaurants. The little bar downstairs is brilliant and there are some good restaurants close by too. The room was perfect, great big comfy bed, great shower, and a gorgeous little balcony overlooking a square and a small canal beyond. Couldn't have been better, we were really pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Locanda Santagostin”
Reviews.Author: Matelot59
Reviews.Content: Very charming and friendly hotel. Staff (Federico,Emanuele & Eugenia) is really nice for our daily life & visits (restaurant, museums...). It was not the case with shop holders in Venice ... Room in the hotel was clean and well furnished. Thanks a lot and see you again ! Alexandra & David D - France - 30.12 / 04.01

Reviews.Title: “very un business like!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: am7234
Reviews.Content: Spent hours on the internet reviewing hotels and decided finally on this one. Contacted the hotel directly for best rates and was told no problem, confirmed price, availability etc. Was asked to email details which would then be confirmed. This evening still no word back I telephone and speak to someone else only to be told that they are now full and have no record of conversation or email.......bloody annoying and unproffesional!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: HelenCC
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel on the internet and found the reviews on this site very helpful, in fact the reason we chose the hotel. The hotel is fairly easy to find - providing you can read a map! Failing that the Italians are very helpful and all know where Sant Agostin is! The hotel is exactly like the pictures, very lovely and very italian! The staff are incredibly helpful and most speak great english. Definately have the cappucino in the morning - it's fantastic! The hotel is so near to everything - our tip is to turn right when you leave the hotel as this is the quickest route into the centre. If you need any ideas of what to do or where to visit, ask the staff, they are more than willing to help. We would stay here again and indeed hope to. Our tip for Venice is go in the winter, wrap up warm and drink red wine regularly! There is a fantastic restaurant just round the corner from the hotel in the first big square you come to if you take the first right then left. It's a little pricey but worth the money. My partner recommends the steak. I'm vegetarian so had a really good greek salad and very nice vegetarian pizza - the peppers were divine! House wine is good enough so you can save yourself a bit of cash there! Easyjet makes Venice very affordable and this hotel is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second time here, it was excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: oceanman
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed here in the past 3 years. It was even better this time than the first. The location is perfect. Away from the crowds, but close enough to everything. You feel like you are a "local", with all the great little shops and resturants very close. The staff could not have been more helpful. Our room this time was a Junior suite and since it was off season the rate was low. The first time we had a double and it was great also. We made our reservations directly with the hotel, which helps too. The included breakfast was good. Typical Italian breakfast, cereal, rolls, great coffee, fruit. Service was superb. Very friendly and cheerful. Eugena is the name of the woman that served and cleaned the rooms. Really a nice person and great personality. The only negative was no internet, but you can't have everything. There are several cyber cafes nearby. I normally don't leave reviews but as you can tell, I like the place and I like Trip Advisor.com. Enjoy your trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone else but....”
Reviews.Author: FirsttimeinOz
Reviews.Content: This is surely the best Locanda (Guest House) in Venice. Great value for money and service that could not have been faulted. We had a lovely room which (despite other reviewers comments) DID overlook a small canal; I think it was the room featured in the hotel photos as we had a small balcony on which to sit in the afternoon sun and watch gondolas, boats etc go by. Great french doors (2 of them both double-glazed) kept all outside noise to a bare minimum making it a quiet room at night; nice bathroom with an excellent power shower and comfy beds too. Lovely furnishing throughout the room & breakfast room/reception with really high ceilings gave a taste of the palazzo (palace) that this hotel had once been. The two guys on reception (not sure if they are owners or managers) were both exceptionally helpful (as well as v charming & handsome!); they recommended several restaurants & cafes and the 3 we tried were all fab. The location of Locanda Sant'Agostin was perfect for us, a quiet area of 'real' Venice, whilst still an easy stroll from 4 different vaperetto stops, the Rialto Bridge & the Dorsoduro district. Some lovely squares eg Campo San Polo & San Giacomo dell'Orio were close by and it was great watching the Venice families playing there in the early evening. Breakfast was continental; rolls, crossiant etc; served by a wonderfully friendly lady. We booked direct via the hotel's webste & even got discount for paying cash! A wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience in busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelQwerty
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin and highly recommend it to other travellers. The hotel was clean, quiet and convenient to everything. This location allows you to see the sites and to explore Venice, without having to fight the crowds everytime you leave the hotel. The staff was very friendly, efficient and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the madding crowds!”
Reviews.Author: louie4
Reviews.Content: We cannot speak highly enough of our stay at this gorgeous hotel. It is located away from the really busy tourist area , we loved that about it! Every major tourist sight is within an easy walk ! Although the website does show it as fronting a canal , it is in fact on a street perpendicular to a canal...very close! In fact, of an evening there is a gorgeous little bar about 10 metres from the hotel ( on the canal) and we delighted sitting there having a local wine and watching the water taxis and locals in their boats (of all kinds) liesurely cruising past. There is a fabulous family run little restaurant down the street ( ask at the front desk about it) , and a great little pizzeria just opposite. The staff also recommened some amazing places to eat that where only a short walk away. When you first arrive in Venice ( if you come by train) , take the vaporetto to the Stan Stae stop and the hotel is an easy walk from there. We emailed the hotel and asked for directions ,and were provided with an brilliant explanation. We founfd it without a hitch. The room is not that big , but for expensive Venice standards it is excellent value for money and spotlessly clean with a really good bathroom. Breakfast of a morning is more than satisfactory, in fact we loved the eccentric Russian maid who kept us entertained without being able to speak any English . The desk staff can speak English and were very helpful. We loved it and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Not on canal!”
Reviews.Author: roddle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June on the occasion of my 50th birthday. To make the occasion perfect we did a lot of research on the internet to find a hotel overlooking a canal - and from the pictures on TripAdvisor, and those on the hotel's own website, we thought this one was on a canal and booked accordingly. Even the instructions from the hotel on finding the hotel said a water taxi would bring us to the front door. Imagine our disappointment when thousands of kilometres and dollars later we turned up to find this hotel is not on a canal at all! The pictures on the website and TripAdvisor may be taken in the vicinity, but don't feature the hotel itself! Anyway, having said that, apart from the lack of a canal, this hotel was absolutely perfect, with friendly staff and comfortable accommodation. Well located within Venice and beautifully furnished although a bit claustrophobic as if you did open the shutters in our room we looked at a brick wall a few feet away. On the day of my 50th, the staff laid out a greeting in rose petals, together with a card and Venetian cocktail. So if you don't need a hotel actually on a canal, then we can't recommend this one strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vhardima
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 child) stayed at Locanda Santâ€™Agostin for 3 nights in June. We had the Triple Standard room and it was huge. There was even a little entry way where the closet and doorway to the bathroom were located before you actually walked into the room itself. The staff (both day and night) were very polite, friendly, and helpful. They recommended restaurants (we tried one and it was excellent,) copied down a time table for several vaporetto stops per our request, stored our luggage for the day, etc. The included breakfast was very good and consisted of croissants, cereal, coffee, orange juice, hot chocolate, and of course nuttella. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great find off the beaten path!”
Reviews.Author: Legalgal25
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay and see the real Venice, this is it! While it is only a 15 minute walk to St. Mark's Square you are off the beaten path and away from all the crowds and noise. The hotel is very hard to find but that is part of it's charm. Once you find it the first time you will have no problem getting back again. The service it what makes this place exceptional. The owners give you maps and great personal recommendations to eat at local places. Breakfast may also be brought to you in your room for no charge! The lady who cleans the rooms also serves breakfast in the mornings and sometimes works the desk and speaks no English at all but is so charming you will love here instantly. Word to the wise....make sure you bring a paper copy of your reservation with you when checking in! There is an amazing pizza place downstairs to eat at when you are in a hurry. About the rooms..They are beautiful with windows that can be opened and GREAT AIR CONDITIONING which you will appreciate in the summer! The bathrooms are spotless and the room is very large for a European hotel. Would I stay here again? Absolutely....You could not pay me enough money to stay in San Marco with those crowds; do not even consider staying in San Marco area unless you have enough money to stay at Danieli or Cipriani. Thank you to everyone at the Locanda for a wonderful stay!! Ashley Long

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn in Charming Venice”
Reviews.Author: Diane_Denver
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 3 nights at the elegant, intimate, Locanda Sant'Agostin. It was a bit tricky to find, as the directions I received from Federico (one of the owners) stopped at a critical point. He forgot to tell us that after you turn left at San Baldo/Calle del Calice and reach the Campo Sant'Agostin, you then need to TURN RIGHT and continue until you see the sign for Locanda Sant'Agostin appear on the left (immediately past a pizzaria that had tables outside in the Campo). Without that last instruction we ended up dragging our suitcases out of our way to Campo San Polo. There I found a real estate office and she directed me back the way we came, and from there found a jewelry store owner who took us outside of his store and pointed us to the hotel. Everyone we met in Venice was VERY VERY warm and helpful. Once we made it to the hotel and up the steep flight of stairs to the lobby, all was well and we were warmly welcomed and shown our room. It was not on a canal, but this was not important to us, since we did not spend much time there. It was roomy with good closet space and an in-room safe. Bathroom was nice, although hair dryer was a bit odd (had to hold it at just the correct angle to get it to operate) and the shower doors leaked, so there would be a pool of water under the sink after we showered. We told the owner and he seemed unconcerned about this (maybe when you live in Venice, a little water on the bathroom floor is nothing to worry about! :-) What was especially great was the heated towel rack, handy for hanging hand washed clothes and getting them to dry overnight. Breakfasts were very pleasant with charming, friendly service and good coffee. The location was excellent, particularly if you prefer to say away from the San Marco/Rialto Bridge crowds. The neighborhood had lots of great restaurants, artsy shops, was central to everything, and close enough to San Stae stop that you could hop on a vaperetto if you were tired of map reading. A piece of advice our hotel gave us was to buy the 72 hour boat pass, so that we could just hop on and off as often as we pleased (which came in VERY handy one day when we took the ferry to Burano, and then made mistakes and jumped on and off several wrong ferries, before finally getting on the right ferry to Torcello!). It cost us $25 euros each, but paid for itself by the end of our stay. One other sweet thing, my friend turned 50 during out stay, and the staff left her a birthday note with softdrinks in our room. I would not hesitate to recommend Locanda Sant'Agostin and will choose it for a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant,Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a wonderful three day holiday in Venice, staying at the Locanda Sant' Agostin. This is a small friendly, typical venetian furnished, very clean and well maintained establishment. As soon as we arrived Leonardo was on reception and gave us a very warm and friendly welcome. He issued us with a map and marked on this recommended restaurants, galleries and other places of interest. He then helped us with our luggage to our room which was just like the pictures we had viewed on the web page.
