We had continental breakfast brought to the room each morning at no extra cost, delivered by a very polite lady (sorry I didn't her name) It rained whilst we were there and we were loaned an umberella, we wanted for nothing. The location of the hotel was exellent too, away from the crowds in a small quite residential area with a few shops and trattorias but only five minutes from the vaporetta stop, five minutes from Campo San Polo and ten minutes from the Rialto Bridge and fifteen to St Marks Square. I am very particular about cleanliness and I found this hotel one of the cleanest ones I have stayed in. I would stay her again and definately highly recommend this hotel and Venice as a city, I love it (its a magical,romantic place) On the day we left the other brother Fredrico was there to check us out and I was sad to leave. Thank You for making our holiday a memorable one. You have a wonderful place. Best wishes to all the staff (including the night staff, you were all great) Hilary and Ian (Ciao Ciao) x x

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When travelling, we try to stay in small, intimate hotels that have a bit of character. For our recent visit to Venice we thought the Locanda Sant'Agostin would suit our requirements perfectly. We arrived at about 9.30pm on our first night and were greeted by a very stern gentleman at reception. No welcome or friendly smile, it was almost as if we were inconveniencing him. We were taken to room 105, just to the right of the reception. I was a little disappointed by the room; I had expected something grander and bigger judging by the photos on their website. The bath was tiny, so no relaxing soaks after a hard days walking. We opened the shutters to be greeted by a view of a wall even though we had requested a room with a good view. We had also requested a superior double, but not sure that this is what we got. Another factor that worried me on arrival was that our room was right next to the reception counter and right in front of the breakfast area. During our stay we were woken on numerous occasions by the reception telephone ringing. We also did not sleep beyond 8.00 any morning due to the breakfast noise. All the rooms seem to be on the one floor so I would presume they all suffer similar problems. The breakfast is very limited but the coffee great and plentiful. During our stay we subsequently met both owners who were, on the whole, charming. The lady at breakfast was also a great character. It rained constantly on our first day in Venice. However, we braved the elements as this hotel is not one that you would want to spend an extended amount of time in - no view, no facilities, no bar, no lounge. In fact, nothing apart from your room and the reception area. If returning to Venice, I would definitely try somewhere else to stay. This is not to say this hotel is bad, it is just a bit basic and did not have the character that I thought it would.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitelw
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and in a very good area. The staff was helpful and polite, the rooms were updated and comfortable. We had a two room suite with our two children. I am very picky about cleanliness and this hotel easily met my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MarcelM
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed three wonderful days staying at this small, comfortable and extremely well run hotel. You step out onto the path at the front of the hotel and it is like walking out of your own front door to real Venice. The quiet narrow paths lead you over bridges and through squares on a comfortable 10 minute stroll to the Rialto. The location is everything, from being able to walk from the bus station in one direction to San Marco in the other. Friendly staff and that extra cappucino in the morning make this an absolute must for a return trip. Make sure you visit the bar next door - Draught Leffe Rouge is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Get directions first- but get to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quite the adventure trying to find the hotel! Venice is easy to get lost in- but once there was happy with the very friendly staff, clean rooms with character, location, and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: JHB2B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Locanda Sant'Agostin in January '06, we were very impressed with the quality and friendliness of the service we received. Our room was very quiet, if not a little cold, however I think the Venetian's are a little more hardy when it came to the -C temperatures we experienced. January was a brilliant time to visit, St Mark's square was practically empty and we did not have to queue for anything! Breakfast was basic continental style, but the humourous attention of the waitress more than made up for this. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience Venice, you really can walk anywhere from the Hotel, the Rialto Bridge and St Marks are only a few minutes walk away. A brilliant holiday - thank you Locando Sant'Agostin we'll be sending our parents your way next year!

Reviews.Title: “Location Perfect, Staff Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a stay at the Locanda and I am not usually one for writting these kind of reviews. However, I am one to read them and I tend to take more notice of the really bad reviews than the really good ones. I booked the Locanda because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor and for anyone thinking of booking it - DO IT NOW. A couple of things you should remember; You aren't staying in a corporate hotel (this isn't the Hilton), you get the feeling you are staying in someone's house, a really nice house away from the hustle and bustle of San Marco but close enough to walk there (is anything in Venice too far to walk to?). You are also not going to get a huge buffet breakfast, breakfast in Venice is genuinly eaten quickly and consists of croissants and coffee (please don't expect much more, although there is Juice, Cereal and Rolls). It is plenty to get you up and moving and you are served breakfast by the nicest member of staff at the Locanda. I spoke to some people on my flight back from Venice yesterday evening who hadn't even ventured into S.Palo (the district when the Locanda is located). They had just walked across the Rialto and then headed back. To do this is a mistake - the side of the Grand Canal where the Locanda is located contains a couple of the nicest squares in Venice (and the best food). Guys - book the Locando - you won't be disapointed. (Sorry for the spelling mistakes!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff are excellent. Rooms are clean and reasonably spacious. Breakfast is good. Location is very central and all of Venice is within easy walking distance (or via the Water Buses / Taxi's).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely locanda”
Reviews.Author: CuriousKaren
Reviews.Content: My husband, young daughter and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in December. We were provided with detailed idrections on how to arrive at the hotel, but got a little lost as we were arriving late at night. The location we discovered next morning however, was ideal. It is away from the busy tourist areas yet a short stroll to anywhere in Venice. The room was soundproofed and comfortable. The decor was very nice and the bathroom was gorgeous. The list of rules on the back of the door was pretty funny though! No food from outside the hotel was to be taken into rooms and no luggage to be placed on the beds. Ha! The staff were more than helpful and the lady who did coffee in the morning was a hoot. She spoke no English and we knew just enough Italian to make sense of what she was saying. She would rave on at a frantic pace and my young daughter would simply look questioningly at me. She was very friendly and even helped us lug our heavy suitcases up the stairs on the night we arrived. We enjoyed our stay here - it was great to find a small, out-of-the-way place, for such a great price (115 euros per night).

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: IP_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We reserved our rooms through Venere.com for a 4-night stay. After our plans changed and we needed to cancel our entire 19-day Italian vacation, we informed the hotel that we needed to cancel our planned stay. Eventhough we contacted them a few days prior to their cancellation deadline, they insisted that we had to pay the ENTIRE 4-night stay. Despite several attempts to reason with the management, they charged our credit card. Of course, we have initiated a chargeback against the hotel. ALL of our other Italian hotel reservations, including those PRIOR to our stay in Venice gave refunds. Avoid them!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: miss_charley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at the Locanda Sant'Agostin in December 2005 and loved it! The Locanda is within walking distance of the railway station and is also a short walk to the Santa Stae vaporetto stop (there is only one bridge to negotiate with luggage using this latter route as opposed to several bridges on the way to and from the station). The Rialto Bridge is approximately a ten to fifteen minute walk away, with Piazza San Marco being about a further five minute's walk from there. The area of Venice in which the Locanda is situated is wonderful - full of excellent restaurants, shops and sights (including the beautiful church of Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari and the Scuola Grande di San Rocco) - great for wandering around. We booked our room using the reservation system on the Locanda's website and had no problems at all, with all correspondence being responded to promptly. Our room (107) was beautifully decorated, spacious and, most importantly, immaculately clean! What we saw on the Locanda's website was exactly what we got (unlike some other hotels we have stayed in where photos seem to have been taken with an extremely wide angle lens on a good day!). The marble bathroom was similarly spacious (with ample space around the sink for my many products!) and very clean. All the staff we encountered at the Locanda were just wonderful. In particular, the two owners, Leonardo and Federico, were lovely and extremely helpful and gave us a number of recommendations for restaurants and sights, most of which we followed (we didn't follow all only through lack of time) and all of which were fantastic. We were also provided with an excellent map of Venice (on which all recommendations were marked for us to minimise our chances of getting lost), which was very useful. Breakfast consisted of a buffet that included cereal, warmed croissants and bread rolls with assorted jams etc, yoghurt, tea, coffee and hot chocolate. For the price (we paid 98 euros per night inclusive of breakfast), I very much doubt that you could beat the Locanda Sant'Agostin for service, location and quality of accommodation, particularly in an expensive city such as Venice. I cannot recommend this place highly enough! We had a wonderful stay and will definitely be staying there again if we are fortunate enough to return to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we had hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: howardbrenni
Reviews.Content: Expecting a huge price and a tiny room in the heart of Venice, we were pleasantly surprised by the Locanda Sant'Agostin. The location is ideal for visitors who want to do more than feed pigeons in St. Mark's Square, which by the way, is close enough. The room was spacious and soundproof, perfect for a family of four (children ages 11 and 8). The bathroom marble was lovely and the shower was a 10 out of 10. Staff were extremely knowledgeable, super friendly, and very helpful. The breakfast was more than expected and the capuccino was the best we tasted in four days in Venice. Overall, this hotel is a fine value and definitely recommended. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A first rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart34
Reviews.Content: This is a real find. Although only a 3* hotel, with 3* facilities, the location, the very friendly staff and high level of clenliness make this worthy of a high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Homey Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Gskong4444
Reviews.Content: Before I start my review I have to preface it by defining the rating logic I used. Locanda Sant'Agostin is a fantastic, homey hotel that provides anything a traveler needs, with undeniable Venetian charm. However, if your idea of an excellent hotel is spa and the beach near the tourist traps, then this is not for you. Locanda Sant'Agostin is the first stop of our 40-day honeymoon. It's literally in the center of Venice, and is not easy to find for first-time Venice visitors. However, once you find the hotel and give yourself a little time to orient yourself to the city, you'll find yourself 15 minutes to all corners of Venice--not just the touristy St. Marco Square area. The hotel is situationed in a regular Venetian neighborhood right next to one of the many small Venetian squares. Our room on the second floor opens up to the square and has a view of a narrow canal and a cute bridge. The breakfast room is beautiful, if not big. The bathroom is generously sized for European standards and the rooms air-conditioned, which is important in the hot summer time. There is a great pizza place around the corner that will give you some delicious cheap bites if you're on the run or on a bugdet. If you want to try some great Italian food, the concierge gives some good suggestions that will provide a glimpse into authentic Italian cuisine. The service is first-rate. The first morning after we arrived, management spent time going over the city map with us and pointed out all the shortcuts and city highlights. On our second day in town, we ran into an American couple travelling with their grandchildren who were obviously lost. We brought them back to our hotel and the management spent a good 20 minutes to help them contact their hotels and a happy ending was had by all. Don't believe the reviews that says Sant'Agostin is only 5 minutes away from St. Marco's. It really is more like a leisurely stroll of 15 minutes or a 10-minute brisk walk to Rialto, and another 5 minutes to St. Marco. However, Venice is a Pedestrian city, and we thouroughly enjoyed every stroll we took. Another note of caution--the hotel entrance is on the second floor at the end of a one-flight (carpeted and very wide) stairway. If your physical condition is not fit for stair-climbing, Locanda Sant'Agostin is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ital/Swede-American
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in early November. It is a very good place for the price. Our room was on the main floor, just to the left of the front desk, and we never heard any noise from the lobby. In fact, there are 2 bars just downstairs, and we never heard noise from that either. This was definitely the nicest room we stayed in when we were in Italy. The room was nicely decorated and spacious (by European standards) and so was the bathroom. Each morning we had breakfast in our room, I particulaly liked the croissants, cappuccino, and orange juice, but they also had cereal and a few other continental items. This hotel is tucked away a bit from the San Stae vaporetto stop so be sure to get really detailed directions. We also liked the pleasant staff they have, everyone was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected it to be...”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. 3 of which were in the jr. suite. Both rooms (jr. suite and the regular room) were nice and big and clean. The owners are the best. As soon as we landed we were given a map with their restaurant picks. Obviously we were initially hesitant but after the first 3 were all hits we continued down the list and were never disapointed. When back in Venice will definately be heading back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good price”
Reviews.Author: borita
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Locanda Sant'Agostin for 3 nights on our first trip to Venice. It was great. The staff was very helpful and courteous and breakfast was adequate. The location was excellent with many great places for coffee and snacks nearby. After we left Venice, we visited Florence and Rome. The best pizza we had in Italy was right down stairs from Locanda Sant'Agostin. When you walk down the stairs it's the first restaurant to the right. Outstanding. The staff wasn't exagerating, it is the best in Venice. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Perfect Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: zanev
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect as I had never been to Venice before. We chose Sant'Agostin becuase of the great reviews on tripadvisor and because their room rates were very good. What a fantastic stay my Wife and I had there. It is located in an awesome part of Venice - San Polo. Close to the Rialto/Grand Canal, 15 min walk to San Marco. Yet it is in a local neighbourhood with all the charms of Venice, away for the crazy tourism you find in San Marco The inn is great. Clean, quiet. The staff were amazing providing directions, maps, restaurant recommendations and were super friendly. We even had one of our breakfasts delivered to our room for us! I highly recommend Locanda Sant'Agostin.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it”
Reviews.Author: Bigendian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early October for two nights (family of 4/son 13 daughter 12 both going on 25!). We always struggle with the views on Trip Advisor because of the variability, but were struck with the positive comments for the Locanda, so went ahead and booked. I should say right now that if youâ€™re into grand hotels with a restaurant and bar, with places to sit down in public and enjoy the views then this is not for you. However, if youâ€™re after something special, looking for a hotel that is small and intimate, is great value for money and where the service and attention is second to none, donâ€™t waste your time looking for anywhere else because this is the place. We stayed in the family room (101 I think) and found that there were only 3 beds! When we came back after our meal 4 beds were in the room; nothing was too much bother. Breakfast was fine for us and we didnâ€™t see the need for the hotel to provide anything different; if youâ€™re that hungry itâ€™s easy to find somewhere else and all the hotels were the same. Staff were simply great and the location was perfect. A few pointers. Donâ€™t be put off eating at some of the restaurants located on the Grand Canal. You can walk to the hotel from Piazzale Roma but there are some bridges to negotiate and make sure you have a decent map! Splash out (excuse the pun) and take the water taxi back to the airport; yes itâ€™s expensive (90 EUR with tip), but hey, we never regretted it.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Traveller416
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a wonderful trip to italy, including 5 days at this B&B. I was doubtful that the locanda could possibly live up to the rave reviews read here - but now I can only add mine! It is everything promised - clean, comfortable, quiet and ideally located. We were astounded to find a new bathroom and a kingsize bed, at this price, in the heart of Venice. We also received excellent restaurant advice from Frederico and Leonardo. I would recommend this place to any one!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay D
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little hotel in a quiet area, just minutes from the Rialto bridge. We booked up after reading the positive comments on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. We stayed in Venice for thee nights (the ideal length) and were upgraded for the first two nights to the junior suite. Given the choice, we'd certainly opt for that room again as it was very large, with lots of living space. Although on the map the hotel appears to be slightly out of the way, nothing in Venice is too far and St Marks Sq was a 15 minute walk (even in high heels). We ate in three of the restaurants recommended by the owner, and all of them offered excellent food. The best restaurant we ate in during our stay, hwoever, we came across ourselves and would certainly recommend it anyone wanting to mingle with real venetians in a trendy and vibrant corner (near Rialto bridge). Called "Muro", it served the best Chateaubriand my boyfriend and I have ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Room,Staff& Price”
Reviews.Author: DougJ193
Reviews.Content: Lets understand one thing, Venice is one of the most expensive cities in the world to stay in, this hotel is continually in the top 10 (now #4) on trip advisor and look at the prices of the other hotels in the top here (2 to 3 times as much). So for starters, the price is just unbeatable. We stayed for 3 days in room 105 I believe. As you read here in other reviews, it is true, the owners running this small hotel are very nice, charming, decent people, they recommended several places to eat and see before we even asked for any help and speak good english. The room has an entrance way with a very nice sized, clean modern bathroom off to the side before a second door where you actually get into the bedroom - this just added to the space of the room and I thought it was a nice setup. So when I opened the door to the actual bedroom I was stunned at the size of the room given this price, a king bed, plenty of room to walk around, a desk, and on another wall a sofa bed. And then I look up and realize that the ceiling is about 20 feet high, no kidding. The decor was lovely. This size and space in Venice at this price, very very impressive. The hotel is about a 5-7 minute walk to San Marco square. Its perfect, you walk through a few squares where the locals live and truly get the feel of Venice. I dont know why anyone would want to stay right on the square where the mobs are when you can have this little piece and quiet only 5 minutes away. There is a great bar a few doors down with a very freindly young staff and outdoor tables in a little square by a canal where you can wind down before going to sleep. I cant say enough about this place, the room, the owners, the location and the price, and the ceilings! I not only would stay here again, I will stay here again. Save your money, you can spend 3 times as much to get a big hotel with a fancy lobby, but your are not in Venice to stay in the hotel lobby. I stopped at the Daniel for a beer and a drink in their fancy lobby and paid 23 Euros. I stopped off at the bar around the corner from Locanda and we had about 3 beers and 3 drinks for the same price in a much more Venitian atmosphere sitting outside along a nice little canal bridge. I agree that the breakfast is very simple and you would be better off eating in one of the many cafes. A perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DeeDub
Reviews.Content: Having ploughed through reviews and then checking availability, my husband & I recently stayed 4 nights here. We arrived at about 10pm at night and found it easy enough using their directions. It's in a great location and you can easily walk everywhere. The rooms were very clean & pretty spacious (we were in 101B) but the air con left a lot to be desired - it didn't really cool the room but just circulated air & it was too noisy to leave our window open. Our only other negative would be the breakfast - it's ok if you're only staying a night or two, but really, for a little or no extra cost they could easily improve this. By day 4 I had had enough! There are some fairly good restaurants nearby and a great bar (Taverna de Buffa - I think!) right next door where you can sit out by a quiet canal and enjoy your drink. Would we stay there again? Yes, but I think we'd also look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: roallen
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant Agostin is a well kept bed and breakfast. Our room (102) was spacious and clean. The room is on the main level near where breakfast is served in the morning. We did hear some noise in the morning from dishes, but nothing too disturbing. Breakfast was served from 8 to 10am. It was nice to get something to eat at the hotel in the morning, but it was nothing to write home about. The same breakfast was served each morning which consisted of one cereal choice and several bread and jelly options. The hotel staff was very nice and courteous. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quaint place to stay in Venice. If you are looking for a larger hotel with tons of amenities, then this will not be the place for you. Nights: 2 Price per night: 278 euros Arrival: September 4, 2005

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunloverhongkong
Reviews.Content: After many research, I decided to go with Locanda Sant'Agostin after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I think the hotel is very charming and in a good location. Special thanks to the owners Federico and Leonardo for their great hospitality. I was actually surprised to find the room to be quite a fair size. One note, there was alot of dust under the table, other then that everything else is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ivanoregan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Locanda Sant'Agostin for 2 nights. After arriving from Milan by train we bought a map and decided that it was just as easy to walk there then get the boat to San Stae and walk from there. It was literally only 5 minutes away. However we had only a bag and a case between the two of us so we it wasnt much hassle travelling over steps. After arriving there we we greeted by friendly staff and shown to our room..(just left of the reception, 106 i think). The room was beautiful but like all rooms in Italy it had 2 single beds for a double bed. We did find that the rooms got very warm at night despite the air-conditioning. The breakfast was also very nice and was served by a very friendly lady that hadnt a word of english. Location-wise, we found it to be centrally located within easy reach of all the major attractions of venice. Overall we found the stay very pleasant and will hopefully return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to venice and want to stay in a quiet clean and friendly place choose this one. Good spacious room and bathroom. Adequate breakfast and very helpful friendly staff. Only 10 mins walk from Rialto bridge and less than 15 mins from St Marks Square. Outside of the hotel is an independent bar with a pleasant outside seating area and there is also a restaurant close by. From this location you can easily explore Venice on foot and will chance across lots of beautiful squares and secret passage ways. This part of Venice is a welcome retreat from the bustle of St Marks. The hotel is excellent value and for those seeking a haven to retreat to after a busy day sightseeing this is a good place to stay..

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Insatiable Nomad
Reviews.Content: We chose the Locanda Sant' Agostin after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived on Wednesday, July 27 from France after a long day of broken down trains and missed connections. Too tired to try and figure out how to get to the hotel, we paid the 50Euro for a private water taxi and it took us within 20 feet of the door. Our family of five booked a triple room and a double room. Both were absolutely gorgeous, with lots of space, a sparkling bathroom, and air conditioning that actually worked! The brother owners, Frederico and Leonardo, were gracious hosts and more concerned about the happiness of their guests than any place I've ever stayed. Breakfast, included, was delicious. The young lady that served coffee and hot chocolate didn't speak a word of English but still managed to tease our 17 year old and prod him into having "one more cup" of hot chocolate. She was delightful! The Locanda is centrally located, about a 15 minute walk home from wherever you happen to be in Venice. We loved the city and will definitely be back. When we return, the Sant Agostin is the only place we'll consider staying. One point to be aware of.... The hotel entrance is up about 25 steps from the street. If you have lots of luggage or a physical issue that makes stairs difficult, it's going to be a challenge. We managed just fine with two moms in their mid 70's and 6 huge suitcases between us, but it won't be suitable for everyone. Enjoy! Globetrotter Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: welshcookie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our annual trip to Venice choosing to stay this time at Locanda Sant'Agostin after reading many favourable accounts. We have never as yet had a bad experience with hotels in Venice but each time we try to move further out of the more 'touristy' areas, and the location of this hotel suited us. We found the staff at the hotel extremely helpful and friendly, the room was spotless and comfortable, once the windows and shutters were closed we couldn't hear a single bit of street noise despite a bar to one side and a busy restuarant the other (both of which we made extensive use of!). I fully recommend this lovely Locanda, especially if going a little off the beaten track is your thing but still in easy walking distances of the usual sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda for 3 nights. It is a very nice small villa, where the staff makes you feel more like staying at a friend's place, not paying customers. The continental breakfast was good, room was nicely decorated, marble bathroom and very modern. We had asked for directions in an email and found the villa right away (print a map from the Web though). We had dinner at the places Federico and Dario recommended and didn't go wrong! Will definitely go back to Sant Agostin next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Sant'Agostin in Venice is No. 1!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, you read all these reviews and wonder about the people writing them and what their standards are.... You wonder if the comments are really true or maybe a bit of a stretch and you probably wonder if the hotel description is totally accurate or not. Those are the thoughts I had while reading reviews and making reservations for my first trip out of the country to visit four cities in Italy. Well, my standards are extremely high, my comments are true and the hotel description for this hotel is very accurate - this is, by far, the best place we stayed in Italy and, actually, is one of the best places we have ever stayed! Immediately upon arriving, tired and weary, we were greeted by Fredriko who also helped us with our bags and, seeing we were tired, showed us to our room and told us to check with him after our "siesta" and he'd tell us how to get around (and not get lost), where to shop and the best places to eat (which he did). His knowledge proved invaluable to us Americans on our first trip to Venice. He ended up answering countless questions, was always happy to help and always had a smile. The customer service at this locanda is the absolute best we have received at any hotel anywhere! The lobby of the hotel and our room were wonderfully decorated with beautiful vintage furnishings. A yummy continental breakfast was included that we could have in our own room, upon request (no extra charge). The hotel is centrally located in a nice, quiet area, about maybe 10 minutes from the Rialto Bridge and 15 minutes from San Marko. We loved being so close to everything, yet having it so quiet at our hotel. We have already told numerous people about this wonderful little locanda and, if we ever return to Venice, we will definitely stay at Locanda Sant'Agostin. It really is the best!! The Sharpe's

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Friendly/Helpful Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Onie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in late June and highly recommend Locanda Sant'Agostin. We arrived at 1am due to a delayed flight and was warmly welcomed which was a nice surprise, the room was large and comfy bed. Very clean. The staff were all so helpful and gave us maps and recommendations. Also in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OliviaandSteve
Reviews.Content: Despite the photos, this hotel is not directly on a canal. Room was clean, 11' by 14.5' plus large bathroom with shower. Adjustable a/c, heating, room safe, bar fridge, hairdryer. No alarm clock, coffee making facilities. No lift, 15 steps up to reception. Heated towel rail. Be wary of hotel's recommendations for restaurants. Beware of prices shown on menus as you will probably be charged more - for eating in, for "cover charge", for accepting what you thought was free bread, for breathing... What we thought was extremely inconvenient for us was that they do not accept credit card payments for less than three nights stay. They insist you leave your room key with reception every time you leave the hotel. We left on a 1am train and it was no problem at all for the staff to mind our bags until that time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Locanda Sant'Agostin is conveniently located in a quiet area near Rialto. The area is nice and safe with a variety of shops, restaurants and pubs. Our room was nicely decorated and felt warm and relaxing, it was not large however, very cozy with a comfortable double bed and a modern marble bathroom. Leonardo was immensely helpful and pointed us in the right direction each day as well as provided maps and guides. At the end of each day we were welcomed home by our host who was eager to hear about all of the exciting details of our day exploring Venice. At the end of our stay we felt like old friends and would certainly stay here again, and recommend it to others looking for a nice place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel and the customer service. The hotel staff was eager to provide recommendations and were genuinely concerned that we had a good stay in Venice. The location is great, as was away from the crowds in the main tourist areas. The bar and the pizzeria next to the hotel also provided great food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Arewethereyet?SF
Reviews.Content: We must join the others who sing the praises of this small hotel. Staff is great and location good also. Even with the restaurant below (GREAT PIZZA) we weren't bothered by the noise. Getting there from San Stae Vapporetto stop is a little challenging, but, we found it without too much hassle. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice. Good value (at least as good as can be expected in Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Having stayed in a microscopic Venice hotel about 5 years ago as well as having stayed at a guest house with small space in Rome a few days prior, we did not have high hopes. I chose this hotel based on good reviews from Trip Advisor. The hotel met all our expectations: Very friendly staff always ready to help you out, small room but very clean and not at least a superior double bed. My Wife had the best sleep in years during those 3 days! So we can only too highly recommend Locanda Sant'Agostin. Great value for money. It was truly a home from home! We were very sad to leave and will be back at the first opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Jano064
Reviews.Content: Further to earlier reviews we had booked three nights at the Locanda Sant Agostin from 28th April to 1st May. It was our wedding anniversary and wanted to make sure that the Hotel was right for location, value and service. There is always a degree of trepidation when you visit somewhere for the first time. However we were very pleased with all aspects of the Hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough. The only small criticism is that the photograph that appears on the website is the view from our first floor room as opposed to being the Hotel. We were initially concerned with the bar downstairs but as mentioned in an earlier review the new double glazing took care of any noise and the air conditioning in the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is special !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Previous TripAdvisor contributors have given glowing reports about this hotel, and that is why we booked it for our stay in Venice 20 to 23 April, 2005. Well for us it was 'ditto ditto' all of the complimentary reports that have appeared previously. This is a very comfortable hotel in a good location. What makes this hotel 'special' however is the owners and staff . . . they were warm, friendly and helpful, especially the lovely 'bubbly' lady who served our breakfast each morning. Care and attention to detail is apparent throughout. Despite being (conveniently) next to a bar that stayed open late, triple glazed windows ensured we did not hear a thing ! We tried a couple of the owners restaurant recommendations which were great, but you should try the 'Pizzeria India' (despite the name it is an Italian restaurant we promise !) in Salizada S Polo opposite the entrance to the Church of S Paulo Apostolo . . . for great value traditional food with good service . . . 5 minutes walk from the Locanda Sant' Agostin. Would we stay at this hotel again . . . you bet we would ! The owners tell us that they will shortly be opening a second hotel near St Mark's, which with their influence and ownership should also be a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bobbyp
Reviews.Content: We spent a very enjoyable 4 night Easter break in Venice, staying at the charming Locanda Sant Agostin. Our choice was based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we booked by Internet with no problems whatsoever. This is a very well run, small hotel located in a relatively quiet area, but close enough to all the sites to reach by foot if you wished (including the Piazale Roma). The staff were exceptionally pleasant, and went out of their way to make sure everything was OK. Special mentions to Federico, with some great restaurant recommendations, and Eugenia, a cheerful and smiling face each morning at breakfast. The hotel is very elegant, with the chandeliers and oil paintings, but also retains a homely feel which makes it very comfortable. We had a quietly situated triple room which was spacious by European standards even though the second bed was not just a foldaway type. We had only 2 slight critisisms: the first being that the aircon was not working (don't know whether it was just our room); and secondly there was never am adequate supply of toilet rolls for some strange reason (and we had to request more). Breakfast was typically Italian, i.e. croissants, bread, jams, yoghurts, cheese, fruit juice and a plentiful supply of hot drinks. All in all we were pleased with our choice of hotel, even though it wasn't cheap, and would almost certainly stay here again if we ever return. Venice at Eastertime was very crowded indeed, but didn't detract from the enjoyment of this truly unique City too much.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel after reading the reports in this web site. It was our first trip outside U.S. so I wanted somewhere quite central but not too expensive. I was told that most hotels in Venice (expect the top ones) have small rooms, grumpy and unhelpful staff , and showers with no water pressure. Well what a suprise, the staff were great, the rooms were small but we could move around quite freely, they were very clean and quiet and the shower was as good as we have back home. Also it was just a very short walk to Train Station. We would certainly stay here when we return to Venice. Thank you to all the Locanda Sant'Agostin staff for making our stay in Venice so comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Locanda Sant'Agostin with my wife and 2 friends on two occasions; we have had an excellent trip on both occasions and are returning there next year for another visit. We love the hotel as it is not too large ( just 10 rooms) and has a warm atmosphere and a personal touch from the staff, you couldn't ask for a nicer and friendlier staff - expecially Leonardo and Fedrico. The hotel is situated (our opinion ) in the best location in Venice. It is located in a residential area but only at walking distance from everywhere, not far from the train station and just 5 minutes walk from Rialto. Try it you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “This little hotel is all of that and moreâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Venice I wanted the location in the heart of the city, away from the crowds. We get easy to find it, just 10 minutes from Santa Lucia train station like on website instruction. The staff is superb and is always ready to answer any of our questions, Leonard and Frederigo are incredible hosts and definately have the right formula for the best customer service! Everythings were perfect. Our room was clean and beautifully appointed breakfast simple but everythings ok, very good and with the kind service. We travel all over the world staying at hundreds of hotels and have yet to experience the passion for hospitality shown by Leonard, Frederigo and the staff at Locanda Santâ€™Agostin. We thank you again for recommendations and other informations (like to find a good restaurant or the best way to get everythings). Thank you and we see you next time in Venice at Locanda Sant'Agostin. This hotel is all of that and moreâ€¦ Paul and Christy.

Reviews.Title: “Would have liked to have stayed..!”
Reviews.Author: dooper
Reviews.Content: Cant really comment on this hotel becuase we tried to book it for our stay in Venice in early April but they failed to respond to our enquiries. We faxed, we emailed several times but no reply. We booked somewhere else instead although we did find the place when we were there and it didnt look as good as the place we finally stayed in !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights over the Easter holiday. Perhaps not the best time to visit Venice, given all the tourists and crowds, but the Locanda Sant'Agostin was a great place to stay. Away from the crowds, but close enough to walk anywhere. World famous Da Fiore restaurant right around the corner. Vaporetto stop nearby. Federico and Leonardo were both very helpful with restaurant recommendations and other information. Breakfast was typical European: yogurt, cereal, croissants, coffee and juice, and cheerfully served by Eugenia. Rooms were clean and beautifully appointed. Because shutters kept room pitch black, I would suggest to bring a clock with lighted numerals - otherwise, you might sleep well past breakfast, as we did the first day. We highly recommend the Locanda. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great, small hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sfslinky
Reviews.Content: Our train pulled into Venice and we were just awestruck by the sight of the canals in action. We loaded our bags into a water taxi and pulled up to the side of the canal where our hotel was located in the San Polo section. It is very quiet and has a discreet entrance. After going up the stairs, we met Leonardo and Federico. They were very nice and we had a wonderful room right next to the reception desk. The chandelier above the bed was made of venetian glass. There was a bathtub in the bathroom. Every morning we would have breakfast in the lobby before exporing Venice. Leonardo and Federico gave us a very detailed map plus suggestions on places to eat, visit and explore. This was one of our favorite places to stay. When I made reservations, they were very quick to respond to my emails and numerous questions. We had such a wonderful stay and beautiful end to our trip in Italy last June. When we come back, we would love to stay here again. I highly recommend this place for singles and couples.

Reviews.Title: “extremely friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just had 5 days at this hotel, amazed by the friendliness and helpfulness of all who worked there, from desk staff to the breakfast waitress. Easy to find, in easy reach of train station, and boat stops, (and the birrerira, a great pizza restaurant!) Spacious clean rooms, buffet breakfast (limited choices, but at least as much to keep you going!!) Good price for Venice, would recommend it to anyone for a comfortable stay at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “A place to remember”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 5 day stay in Venice at the Locanda Sant'Agostin.This is a beautiful small hotel. Tiny rooms , but fantastically appointed ( if you are used to staying in hotels in the U.S., then the rooms will strike you as small - but so is everything else in Europe! ). Our room was the smallest but tastefully decorated with a very wide range of amenities. The hotel staff is very polite and highly efficient. They respond very quickly to requests and any reported problems. Leonardo, a young man at the front desk, was fantastic, recommending places to see and telling us how to get there. Take his recommendations on restaurants too - they were all excellent. The location is perfect, in the center of this incredibly beautiful town, about 10 minutes walk form Rialto and train station. Leonardo helped us out with our bags, and we were sad to see the Locanda Sant'Agostin disappear behind us. But once we got home, there was an email waiting for us from Leonardo, thanking us and wishing us well. And that, in itself, is what recommends the Locanda Sant'Agostin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ejworden
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this great hotel. The staff was super nice and gave us a great list of places to eat and we ended up eating at Antica Birraria La Corte both nights because of the great food and decent prices and is only like a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Rooms were super clean and really quiet. The wine at the Taverna next door was excellent and a great place to hang out. I also liked that it was not right in the middle of the tourist areas and more Italians in the neighborhood than tourists. Great Place and would stay there again!!

HotelInfo.Name: Locanda Sant'Agostin
HotelInfo.Address: S Polo 2344 | Campo Sant'Agostin, 30125 Venice, Italy
